loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.ru:
Насибахон умная, добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и у них 4 детей. Её муж уехал в Россию, чтобы зарабатывать денег и вернутся с большим доходам.  Она сама кормит своих детей и старается, содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. Она продает детскую одежду более 10 лет. Насибахон хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить максимум дохода. Она мечтает, подстроит свой собственный магазин. С этой целью запрашивает займ в размере 900$ США . Она заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за поддержку и поощрение.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: N. is a smart, kind and goal-oriented woman.  She is married and has four children.  Her husband left to go to Russia in order to earn money and come back with large profits.  N. is supporting her children on her own and tries to provide a good quality of life for them.  She has been selling children's clothing for over ten years.  N. wants to expand her business and maximize her profits.  She dreams of building her own store.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of $900 for this goal.  She thanks all creditors in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne, a 36-year-old married mother of two children, owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has operated a hardware business for seven years, having acquired her initial capital from her husband.

Evalyne is requesting the loan to buy nails, iron bars and cement to sell. Her major business hardship is price fluctuation, and her goals are to have another hardware shop and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy nails, iron bars and cement to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 44-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 20 years old. Lilian and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice crops and cassava on their land. Lilian said that they are able to buy their basic needs and send their kids to school through the farm.

Lilian has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to continue earning from their farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jimsher

texts.en:
Jimsher is from the village of Giorgitsminda, Akhaltsikhe district. Jimsher’s village is located in Southern part of Georgia. The main business of the local population there is potato growing and dairy production. 

Jimsher is 50 years old.  He is married and lives in the village with his wife, Mtvarisa.  The only source of income for the family is agricultural activities. They have a milk cow and produce cheese, which is sold in the village. Also Jimsher and Mtvarisa grow potatoes, beans and maize on a family-owned plot of land. Harvested vegetables and corn are sold locally as well. Total average monthly income for the family is 350 Laris (approximately 210 USD). 

Jimsher requested credit for two purposes. He will purchase 2 or 3 calves and raise them. In spring, Jimsher will sell grown calves for a higher price and get profit. Also, a small part of the credit will be used for some renovation work on the house. 

After using the credit according to the predetermined purposes, the income of the family will increase and they will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves and renovate small part of the house

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 25 years old married woman with three school aged children.  She sells clothes in South Sudan and has been in business for four years.

Joice requested this loan through BRAC to purchase more clothes that she can resell at a profit.  She will use the extra income to build a concrete house.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: May

texts.en: May started her interior design business in 2000. Since then, she has done all the major stores and luxury shops interior design in the province. She is well known for her skills. She does one job in a month. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I have many children and I will do everything I can in order to support my children." May is 42 years old and lives with her husband and five kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. Her eldest daughter is a college student, and the other four children all attend a local school. She is requesting 3,000,000 tugriks to buy equipment and materials for her construction business.

loans.use: to buy equipment and materials

loans.name: Amparo Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Constructoras Del Éxito, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar encerrada por muchos cerros que rodean la urbe.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Amparo, tiene 36 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene  5 hijos de 17, 15, 12, 11 y 9 años de edad, los cuatro mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. 

Ella para ganarse la vida y con esto sacar adelante a sus hijos  se dedica al  negocio de compra y venta de arroz,  trabaja todos los días. Ella contrata un carro que le lleva hasta una piladora de arroz en Charapoto donde compra el arroz a mas bajo precio, luego se dirige a Portoviejo donde tiene sus clientes a quienes les entrega por quintales o por saquillos de 25 libras, sus hijos le ayuda en su negocio, lleva 6 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz y así seguir adelante con su negocio. Lleva 5 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos a mejorado sus situación económica.
 
Su sueño es tener local para guardar su mercadería.
texts.en:
The “Constructoras Del Éxito” (Success Builders) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo known for many years as “Ciudad Del Valle” (City of the Valley) because the city is surrounded by many hills.

We met Amparo, 36, here.  She’s separated but has five children who are 17, 15, 12, 11 and 9 years old.  The four oldest are in secondary school and the youngest goes to elementary school.

To earn a living and support her children she is a rice merchant.  She works every day.  She hires a car that takes her to a rice miller in Charapoto where she buys the rice at a lower price.  She then heads for Portoviejo where her customers are located and she sells by the quintal or in 25-pound sacks.  Her children help her with her business and she’s been in business six years; she does very well.

This loan is to buy rice to stay in business.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because thanks to the loans she’s improved her economic situation. Her dream is to have a locale to store her merchandise in.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
María Olga tiene 38 años de edad es soltera tiene una hija, vive con la madre y con la hija de doce años de edad en Guaranda sector Cuatro esquinas Provincia de bolívar.
LA VRC Cuatro Esquinas Central está formada por 12 socios que pertenecen al sector cuatro esquinas, los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como son agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio y otros.
María se dedica a al crianza de animales cómo pollos, cuyes, cerdos y la agricultura  siembra papas maíz y vive en la casa de la madre.
Las compras y las ventas los realiza en Guaranda, Solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos.
Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudaría a tener otros ingresos. El sueño es poder comprar un terreno y hacer una casa..
A los desafíos que se ha presentado son las heladas ene l cultivo de las papas.
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear en la ciudad, Atender a la familia fiestas de San José, Navidad y Carnaval.
texts.en:
María Olga is 38, and a single mother.  She lives with her mother and daughter, who is 12, in Guaranda, Cuatro Esquinas, Bolivar Province.
The lending community of Cuatro Esquinas Central has 12 members, and they are involved in varied trades such as agriculture, raising animals, sales and other activities.  María raises animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and also grows crops such as potatoes and corn.
She buys and sells products in Guaranda, and seeks this credit to purchase pigs to raise.  This credit will allow her to improve her income. One day, she dreams of owning some land and her own home.  Growing crops is difficult due to freezing conditions that affect her potato fields.
In her free time, Maria enjoys walking in town, and attending local festivals such as those at Christmas and Carnival.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola especializada en la producción de mango y limón, se encuentra ubicada en la región de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Raquel se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, en un establecimiento ubicado en la casa de sus padres, el negocio es atendido por las mañanas por su mama y por ella en las tardes, durante todos los días de la semana. El negocio les sirve para ayudar a sostener los gastos familiares y para abastecer a sus vecinos de productos básicos de consumo diario.

Adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar en una escuela de la zona, con lo que obtiene ingresos adicionales para ayudar a sus padres con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia, que también se sostiene de la agricultura, actividad que les brinda ingresos esporádicos.

Raquel ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles  que le permitan adquirir productos de primera necesidad con los cuales pueda ampliar su negocio y seguir colaborando con la economía de su familia. Ella es una cliente nueva para Edpyme Alternativa y goza de buenas referencias entre las personas que le conocen.
texts.en:
Raquel is 30 years old. She is single and does not have children. She lives alongside her parents in the district of Tambogrande, a farming area specializing in the production of mang and lemon. It is located in the region of Piura, more that four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Raquel is dedicated to selling groceries in an establishment located in her parents' house. The business at attended in the mornings by her mother and in the afternoons, by her, every day of the week. The business serves to help her support the family and to supply her neighbors with basic products of daily consumption.

Additionally, she is dedicated to working in a school in the area from which she obtains additional income to help her parents support the family who also is supported by farming, an activity that provides them with sporadic income.

Raquel has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1,000 "soles" that allows her to acquire staples with which she can expand her business and continue supporting her family. She is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa and enjoys good references among people who know her.

loans.use: to acquire staples with which she can expand her business.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Goefrey is a 29-year-old, hardworking man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. The family goals are to build a permanent home, educate his children and buy a car. 

Geofrey has been selling clothes for 5 years. He started with 3,000,000 UGX, but he now has stock worth 15,000,000 UGX. His major hardships are high taxes, customers not paying on time and price fluctuations. However, he has a dream of hiring employees to help expand his business and moving his business to a more permanent location. Goefrey needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Dizzy

texts.en:
Dizzy is 35 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has two children. For the past 6 years, Dizzy has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap.

To help expand her business, Dizzy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Dizzy to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for her children. Dizzy hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land.

Dizzy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dizzy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her stock, purchase supplies and stabilize her business.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a 34 year old married woman who supports 4 family members from Al Nasser Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for materials for sewing,such as fabric, beads and thread.In the future she would like to open a shop to sell her products. Also she hopes for her son's to continue their education.
Nisreen prefers not to display her photo on the internet, thus the above photo is of her male relative.

loans.use: to pay for materials for sewing

loans.name: Carina Bertha

texts.es:
Carina es una joven de 26 años de edad, es madre de un pequeño de 6 años de edad, el cual se encuentra estudiando el primer año de educación primaria, el es su razón de vivir y sobre todo el motor para salir adelante y seguir creciendo cada día; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, por sus atractivos turísticos como las “Islas Ballestas” y el “Candelabro de Paracas”; cuando Carina dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con si hijo y en oportunidades aprovecha para disfrutar de su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Cau Cau; ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Hotelería y Turismo.

Co mucho entusiasmo Carina trabaja diariamente en su negocio de Bazar, que es una especie de tienda en la cual se vende diversos productos como regalos, productos de uso personal, peluches, entre otros; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes de manera diaria; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es  muy amable y su negocio se ubica en una zona céntrica.

Carina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su valiosa ayuda y con ello podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como peluches, productos de belleza, juguetes,porta retratos, carmines, entre otros, entre otros, lo que le permitirá tener mayores productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, así ella podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Carina is a 26-year-old woman. She is the mother of a 6-year-old boy who is in the first year of his primary education. He is her reason for living and most of all, the impetus to move forward and continue growing every day. Her home is located in the city of Pisco, a city noted for its hot weather and tourist attractions such as the Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Candelabra. When she has free time, she likes to take walks with her son, and at times, to enjoy her favorite dish: the delicious Cau Cau. She only had a secondary education, but she would have liked to have studied Hospitality and Tourism.

With much enthusiasm, Carina works daily in her bazaar business, which is a type of store that sells various products such as gifts, personal products, and plush toys, among other things. She works in her store around 10 hours a day and can attend up to 30 customers daily. She believes that her business is going well because she is very kind and her business is located in a central zone.

Carina is very grateful for the Kiva lenders since this is the second time that they're offering her their valuable support with which she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business such as plush toys, beauty products, toys, picture frames, and lipsticks, among other things. This will allow her to have a larger number of products to offer to her customers and increase her income so that she will be able to continue working in order to accomplish her greatest dream: to study a career in the university and to provide her son with a good education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business such as picture frames, plush toys, and lipsticks, among other things.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy makes cleaning products like disinfectant, soap, detergent, shampoo, etc. She has been working in this business for about 2 months. She took a course at the Mifex MERIT Centers that taught her basic chemistry and gave her the skills to make her own cleaning products. This type of business is very lucrative in this sector because the manufactured versions of these products are usually too expensive for most to afford. Therefore, Nancy can make her own products at home and sell them to other businesses.

Nancy needs the loan in order to invest in the chemicals necessary to maker her products. She wants to give potential customers samples of her products in order to bring in new business. Her daughter is currently a marketing student and she wants to patent a brand for her mother to be able to market her product. The loan will also serve to cover these expenses.

Nancy and her husband have two children who are college students. During the week, her husband must leave home because he works at a banana plantation in rural Ecuador. Nancy started the business because she could not find a job and she felt the need to help her children through college.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Nancy needs the loan in order to invest in the chemicals necessary to maker her products.

loans.name: Meaaisi

texts.en:
Meaaisi is from the Village of Tulaele. Her small shop opened at the beginning of this year when she got her first loan from the SPBD, together with the money from her husband's business. Meaaisi’s husband is an engineer who fixes cars, and he is helping her build her business.

The shop is located at Tulaele in the front of Meaaisi’s house, and she and her daughter take turns in its operation. It is open 7 days a week. Meaaisi lives right across the corner of where the South Pacific Games will be held at August this year, and she expects a high profit from that event. She is requesting a loan to stock her freezer with more merchandise, which will enable her sales to grow.

loans.use: To purchase goods for freezer, flour, sugar, soap, paste, snacks

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 42 years old. She has 4 children, and her husband is a transit police officer. She works as a seamstress, and right now, in order to increase her income, she has invested in the sale of cosmetics and perfumes. She sells these products in her community. With the loan, she intends to purchase more creams and thread for embroidery, thus increasing her sales and helping her husband in the maintenance of the house. She is part of the Laguna 2 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

GUADALUPE TIENE 42 AÑOS, 4 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES POLICIA DE TRANSITO, ELLA TRABAJA HACIENDO TEJIDO, BORDADOS, COSTURAS, Y AHORA PARA PODER INCREMENTAR SUS INGRESOS INVIRTIO EN LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS Y PERFUMES, ESTOS PRODUCTOS LOS VENDE EN SU COMUNIDAD. CON EL CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR MAS CREMAS, HILOS PARA BORDAR, Y ASI AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO EN LA MANTENCION DEL HOGAR. PERTENECE AL GRUPO LAGUNA 2.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her two businesses

loans.name: José Socorro

texts.es:
José Socorro is married and he has two children, age 22 and 33. The lack of employment in the country made it difficult for José to find a job, therefore he decided to begin selling toasts and snacks in his own house. Due to the demand of his clients he started selling grocery products and little by little he has manage to make his business grow. Now he store is better stocked and with the help of his wife and an employee have managed to improve the quality of the service that they offer. In order to increase to the variety of products that they offer, José is requesting a loan of $650 that he will use to buy merchandise, he promises to repay the loan in 6 months. You can be an important part in the development of this business. Don’t hesitate and help this family, they are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

José Socorro es casado y tiene dos hijos de 22 y 33 años de edad, la falta de empleo en el país dificultó mucho que José consiguiera un trabajo, por lo que decidió comenzar con las ventas de tostadas y botanas en su propio domicilio, ante la demanda de sus clientes fue incorporando la venta de productos de abarrotes y poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio, ahora tiene un mejor surtido y con la ayuda de su esposa y un empleado han logrado mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrecen. Para incrementar al variedad de productos que ofrecen José está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyar a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Da Veit

texts.en: Mrs. Da Veit L., 44, lives with her husband, 47, and 3 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Da Veit L.'s husband is employed as a policeman and is paid $1 a day. Da Veit L. herself earns an additional $11.50 a day running a laundry service and renting housing. She has applied for this loan because she wants to expand her rental business by building more rooms to rent to the people in her area.

loans.use: to build more rooms to rent to people in her area

loans.name: Mirimar Femenina #5 Group

texts.en:
Josefina is requesting her sixth loan! She has made remarkable strides in improving her business, and also in improving the health and welfare of her children. Her goal is to keep working harder and harder in the future, and to keep advancing forward.

She is asking for this loan so that she can build a cement counter top in her store, and make it more attractive and clean for her customers. She has also recently started selling calling cards for the local telecommunications company, Claro—she plans to use part of the loan to continue purchasing these cards.

Josefina is very thankful that she is being given another chance to improve her life, and on behalf of her children and family, wants everyone to know that she is very thankful for this loan.

Josefina is part of the solidarity group, Miramar Feminina #5. The loan requested will be divided among the group members listed here, and each member will be jointly liable for their peers' repayments.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory items and invest in supplies to improve her store

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en: Suleyman N. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Aghdam city of Azerbaijan.  Now he is settled with his family in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  He is 49 years old, is married and has three children.  Suleyman is engaged in cattle-breeding, and he now wants to increase his number of cows.  To do this, he is requesting a loan in the amount $800 for buying one cow.

loans.use: To expand business by buying a cow

loans.name: Feda

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Feda K. is 50 years old and is married with three children, ages 31, 33, and 39. She has two nieces who are dependent on her. In 1997, Feda established a farming business. She now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming

loans.name: Marach D(I) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Rukia A.. She is currently in the business of selling shoes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of shoes. Rukia is 27 years old, and her husband is a soldier. She has 2 children, aged 1 and 2. Each week, Rukia makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay house rent and school fees for the children . Rukia previously had a loan from BRAC Uganda in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Rukia is joined in her small group by Siama F. and Maria N.. Siama F. has a retail shop and wants to add to the stock in her shop. Maria N. is currently operating a business selling used clothes and wants a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand shoe business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to for a small business.

loans.name: Philipine

texts.en:
Philipine is 38 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 12 and 10 years old. Philipine is a fish seller, and she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 5am to 1pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

In the past, Philipine has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Sion's Neema Group

texts.en:
Sion is 38 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 20, 18, 16 and 11 years old. Sion owns a small general store, which she started in 1998. Every day, she works from 1 a.m. to 10 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Nembris, Endesh and Joyce, who have businesses dealing in poultry and hair salon.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en: Mukhtar is 30 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Armenian-occupied Fuzuli in Azerbaijan and has settled in the Fuzuli region. This man is single. 5 years ago he started a clothing business. Now he requests a loan of $975 to buy more clothes to expand his business.  He promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr:
Célestine D. is 39 years old, married, and the mother of three. She has been in retail sales for over three years selling plastic packaging and wrapping material in Assahoun, a village located about 50 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She wishes to use this loan to buy some bags and five bales of plastics and to lease a store in order to increase the capacity of her commerce. The profits derived from her business will enable her to take on some of the responsibilities of her household.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Célestine D. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse, depuis plus de 3 ans, de emballages en plastiques à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter des sacs 5 balles de plastiques et louer un magasin afin d’augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Les profits bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge une partie des besoins de son foyer.

loans.use: To buy some bags, 5 bales of plastic, and to lease a store

loans.name: Gulsunoy

texts.ru:
Gulsonoy Morodova lives in Vahdat, Tajikistan. She is 34 years old, married and has 4 children. Gulsonoy has high school education. She has been in the retail sector for 6 years. Gulsonoy has a small trading location at a local market where she sells children clothes and shoes. This business helps her support her large family. Gulsonoy's husband is currently out of work. Before the start of the new school year, the client wants to increase the variety of goods she sells. This is why she needs money. Gulsonoy decided to obtain a loan; she plans to repay it within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Муродова Гулсуной жительница города Вахдат .Возраст 34 года, замужем , имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее .Вот уже более 6 лет клиентка занимается торговлей. На местном рынке она имеет небольшую торговую точку,где торгует детской одеждой и обувью. Этот вид деятельности позволяет ей содержать свою большую семью.Муж Гулсуной временно не работает. Перед началом нового учебного года клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки.Для чего ей нужны деньги.Гулсуной решила взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase goods variety

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a client of LAPO (Life Above Poverty Organization). She is 43 years old and married with four lovely children.

Mary is a registered medicine dealer. A nurse by profession, she has retired from service. She has been selling medicine and drinks for a long time.

Mary needs a loan of $450 to purchase more medicine for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine for sale.

loans.name: Subhan

texts.en: Subhan is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli, an Armenian-occupied territory in Azerbaijan. Currently, Subhan is settled in the Kayidish village which was built for IDPs. He has been involved in the taxi business for the past 10 years and now needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for a car

loans.name: Martha Anaely

texts.es:
Martha inicio con este negocio ya que necesitaba junta dinero para cuando naciera su hija y para que no le faltara nada, además que en aquel entonces ella no recibía ayuda D. nadie, por lo que con este negocio sostenía los gastos D. la casa y D. su embarazo. Comenzó hace poco mas D. un año con este negocio cuando una amiga le recomendó que iniciara un negocio el indicado para ella era la venta D. ropa para que no batallara tanto ya que estaba embarazada, ella le hizo caso y empezó a dedicarse a esto obteniendo buenas ganancias hasta la actualidad.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 5 meses para invertirlo en comprar mercancía D. temporada y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha started this business to save money for the birth of her daughter, so that she would lack nothing. At that time she did not receive help from anybody, she met the household expenses and those of her pregnancy with her business income. She started this business a little more than a year ago when a friend recommended it to her. The most suitable for her was to sell clothing, because she would not have to struggle so much, since she was already pregnant. She took her friend's word and started to work at it, and has maD. a good income up to now. She needs a loan of US $300, that she will repay in 5 months, to invest in seasonal merchandise so she can continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en:
In the sleepy town of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Zoila P., 59, is managing to operate a mini-store.  She has had to struggle to overcome life’s challenges. Having 5 children to feed, with a husband who is a farmer, tilling the land is not really enough.  Zoila had the idea of setting up a mini-store as that was the only thing she could think of to make ends meet. Friendly neighbors are her most promising customers.  The store was started with minimal capital from Paglaum MPC. Zoila cares for the store as if it’s her child, and the store has sustained the family for years and she managed to invest profits in more inventory. 

Zoila is very thankful to have become a member of Paglaum MPC who believe in her capacity to run a business. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan as additional working capital.

She wishes for an education for her children and that Paglaum MPC will continue helping the community.

loans.use: purchase more bottled goods, canned goods, and other grocery items

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Xuân 32 tuổi, chị thma gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị Xuân là từ chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Ngoài ra chồng chị là thợ cắt tóc nên  hàng tháng gia đình chị đều có thêm khoản thu nhập ổn định. Với mức thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng gia đình chị Xuân đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu tư cho các con ăn học
Với mức vốn 17.000.000đ xin vay trong vòng vốn tới chị Xuân dự định sẽ sử dụng để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoang Thi X. is 32 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2002. Currently the major sources of income of Mrs. X.'s family are from raising livestock and farming. Her husband is a barber, so her family has an extra stable source of money. With a monthly income of VND3,500,000, Mrs. X. family has resources to improve their lives and pay for the children's study. In this loan cycle, Mrs. X. requests a loan of VND17,000,000 to renovate the barns and buy food for livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate the barns and buy food for livestock

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola I. is 47 years old and married with 8 children. She sells goats. She has been in this business for a long time. Bola is requesting a loan amount of N100000 to increase the number of goats that she has to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is married with four children. Currently, all her children who haven't completed high school are in school. She lives with her husband and their kids at Koforidua in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works very hard because the partial responsibility for the kids rests on her shoulders as a mother. She is now 45 years old.

Lydia sells home products such as cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates. She makes her sales by ‘hawking’, which is door-to-door sales. Lydia is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to send her kids through school. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stocks of plastic goods and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She would be very grateful your support.

Lydia belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Akwan’ which means "God’s way". She hopes to receive GHS 400 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to help her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of plastic goods and kitchen sets

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Mrs. J. is a PMPC member under the PDP-LP program, is 47 years old, married, and has 3 daughters (1 in school). She has a good credit record with PMPC. She has a grocery store as her existing business, which gives their family a good profit aside from their coconut income. At this time she would like a loan for her business, and this will be her 7th cycle. Furthermore, she wants to engage in wholesale and retail trade in the future.

She wants to increase her income so she can support her daughter's college studies in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock such as canned goods, noodles, rice etc.

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.en:
Dmitriy is married with one child. He owns a retail business selling men's clothing. Dmitriy has three business locations at different markets. He works at one kiosk and has two employees that sell clothing at two other kiosks. His total monthly revenue is 10,000 UAH.

Dmitriy lives with his family in a small apartment. His relatives helped him chose his business direction and develop the business. Dmitriy is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working young man. He wants to develop his business even further, open new locations, employ more people and make even more profit.

Dmitriy would like to borrow 7,700 UAH to increase his inventory. He would spend the extra income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Sakirat

texts.en:
Sakirat B. is 40 years old and married with two children. She sells foodstuffs like tomatoes paste, spices and provisions. She is a LAPO client.

She is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Orgalidia Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Milagros es conviviente, tiene 27 años y estudio pedagogía, Milagros vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, además Milagros vende ropa y calzados variados a pedido, sus ventas son al crédito.
Milagros necesita un préstamo de 900 soles  dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatillas.
Los sueños de Milagros son obtener su titulo y tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Milagros is a member of the Bienestar Banco Comunal.

Milagros is 27 years old, lives with her significant other, and is studying teaching. She sells makeup through catalogs that she offers to friends and family. In addition, Milagros sells clothes and footwear by request, her sales are made on credit.

Milagros needs a loan of 900 soles, which will be invested in buying shoes.

Milagros's dream is to earn her degree and have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Sophia K. from Tukuyu. Sophia has been running a clothes selling business since 2006. She works 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Sophia currently earns about $80 US a month. She is married with two children: ages 5 and 8. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants who are orphans. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Sophia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor coverage of basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Martha Petrona

texts.es: La Señora Martha Petrona M. L. tiene 42 años de edad. Su estado civil es casada. Tiene un hijo y todavía no estudia. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Martha es una persona muy responsable y tenía la responsabilidad de su hijo, la vivienda de Martha es la más humilde de su comunidad. Es por eso que Martha decide incursionar en este negocio para mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. El sueño mas grande de Martha es mejorar la condición económica del país y que la ayuda que reciben las personas que quieran salir adelante con su negocio permanezca.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Petrona M. L. is 42 years of age, is in a civil marriage and has a son who is not yet in school. Her business is selling clothing and cosmetics and she's been doing this for more than five years. Martha is a very responsible person and is responsible for her son. Martha's house is the most humble in her community and that's why she decided to get into this business, in order to improve her family's living conditions. The money that she is requesting is for working capital to buy clothing, perfumes, beauty creams and cosmetics. Martha's greatest dream is for the country's economic condition to improve, and that the help received by people who want to get ahead with their businesses will continue.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda S. is proposing to borrow PHP5,000 from KIVA as additional working capital for her vinegar-making business. She makes the product on her own and earns income from her manufacturing activity. She wants the business to grow because she believes it is a good business to develop in their village because vinegar is part of the daily commodities needed for cooking food. Her vinegar is being distributed to stores in their village and packaged in bottles. 

Rosalinda works hard for the education of her four children, and her husband Rudy is her patient supporter and helper in doing their business well. Three children deliver their finished products during weekends. The family helps each other for the success of their family life.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her vinegar-making business.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Desde hace 10 años, en la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua, la señora Agustina M. posee su negocio de pulpería el cual atiende con mucho esfuerzo en su propia casa de habitación siendo visitada por varios clientes que buscan los productos tanto comestibles como productos del hogar que ella vende. 

Con el propósito de suplir sus estantes, la señora Agustina ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos comestibles y los productos del hogar para ofertarlos en su pulpería y de esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
For ten years, in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, Mrs. Agustina has owned a grocery store, which she has maintained with great effort, in her own house. Her store is visited by many customers that are looking for products such as groceries or things for the home. With the hope of stocking the shelves of the store, Mrs. Agustina looks to “Ceprodel” to request a loan to buy groceries and products for the home. She will offer these for sale in her grocery store in a manner that will satisfy her customers

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie A. recently joined PMPC to gain access to the various programs and services of the Cooperative. She has been operating a general store for 5 years that she would like to expand. She has not been able to access financing for her business expansion.  She is 46 years old, married and has 3 children. She is thankful that PMPC is willing to finance her purchase of additional inventory. She desires to live a good life in the near future and she would like all of her children to finish schooling in their chosen fields.

loans.use: To purchase additional product to sell.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Santa Rosa inicia su Primer ciclo con 18 socias. 
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. ropa, comida, leña, abarrotes en general, bebidas, frutas, servicio D. cerrajería, transporte.
	
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 7,500 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, fideo, azúcar, aceite, carne, leña, frutas y ropa.

Los sueños D. las socias son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales, tener casa propia y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa communal bank is beginning its first loan with 18 members. They have different businesses such as clothing, food, firewood, groceries, beverages, and fruit sales. They also have locksmith and transportation services. The members need loans in different amounts such as 300 or 600 PEN, making a total of 7,500 PEN for their communal bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, noodles, sugar, oil, meat, firewood, fruits, and clothing. The dreams of the members are to offer good education to their children so they will be professionals, to own their own homes, and to expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, sugar, oil, meat, firewood, fruits, and clothing.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramon V. de 56 años de edad esta casado con la Sra. Maria Benitez de 50 años de edad, con 2 hijos.
   Don Ramon se inició en esta actividad,  aproximadamente en el año 1.988; con el capital que su padre le dio, con lo cual  compró mercaderías, en un principio ropas y perfume, en la actualidad solo perfumes, además proveyendo a más de trecientas personas en forma continua. 
   El invertiría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías (perfumes) atendiendo que  comercializará a crédito a en una zona nueva.

loans.use: compra de perfumes.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
S. Lhagvasuren started a woolen and knitted-goods production business in January 2009 with two other people, producing small souvenirs. For now, they are running the business in the Service Center, but in the future they would like to purchase equipment and expand this business.

Lhagvasuren lives in Uvurkhangai province with three children: one son is serving in the army; one is a herder in the countryside, and her daughter goes to school. A healthy and diligent worker and good communicator with the ability to expand her business, Lhagvasuren is requesting 1,500,000 tugrugs (approx. $1040 USD) to purchase a knitting machine for 800,000 tugrugs and raw materials for 700,000 tugrugs. She would like to have her own workplace in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a knitting machine

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph owns a butchery in the Pipeline area of Nairobi. A 35 year-old father of three, Joseph has been running his butchery for the last four years and hopes to increase his business to admirable levels. He is requesting a first loan of Kes. 20,000 in order to open the same business in a different location. He desires to raise an admirable family and describes himself as focused and reliable.

About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To open a new branch.

loans.name: Flor De Jacinto Group

texts.es:
Juana J. M. tiene 43 años, es representante de la Familia Emprendedora Flor de Jacinto; en este tipo de grupo los prestatarios son familiares pero cada uno de ellos tiene su propio negocio. Juana se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, inició con el negocio porque su esposo fue despedido e invirtió el dinero de la liquidación en su pequeño negocio. La tienda es la principal fuente de ingreso para su hogar y como actividad extra, su esposo se dedica a la compra-venta de madera; invierten aproximadamente 5,000 pesos por cada pedido de madera.

Juana tiene 3 hijos, uno de ellos en la universidad, otro en la preparatoria y el último en la secundaria. Necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, maíz, frijol, aceite, leche y otros productos básicos. 

La señora quiere que sus hijos terminen su carrera y por eso trabaja con esfuerzo y dedicación para que tengan éxito en un futuro. También obtiene ingresos de la cría de cerdos. Ella sueña con tener una tienda de abarrote amplia para hacer frente a la competencia que enfrenta en su comunidad. 


Lucía G. R., pertenece al grupo de Juana tiene 47 años y se dedica a la venta de pozol que es la bebida tradicional de la zona y a la elaboración de productos artesanales (bolsas, tortilleras, moisés y abanicos entre otros). Comenzó con el negocio de venta de pozol desde hace aproximadamente 20 años.

Lucía necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz, cacao y leña para seguir vendiendo pozol además quiere comprar una balanza ya que para realizar sus ventas tiene que pedir prestada la balanza a un vecino.

Tiene 3 hijos que estudian la universidad por lo que necesita invertir más en su negocio. Con la compra de la balanza se le facilitaría su actividad pues ya no tendría que desplazarse para pesar su producto en casa del vecino, sus principales clientes son las personas de la comunidad. 

Actualmente ella vende sus productos en su casa y sueña con tener un local a lado de sus domicilio para establecer hay su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana J. M. is 43 years old and is the representative of the enterprising family Flor de Jacinto; in this type of group the borrowers are family members but each one of them has his or her own business. Juana sells groceries. She started the business because her husband lost his job and then his severance pay was invested into the small business. The store is the principal source of income for the household and as an extra activity, her husband buys and sells wood; they invest approximately 5,000 pesos for each order of wood.

Juana has 3 children, one is at a university, one is in high school and one is in middle school. She needs the loan in order to buy rice, sugar, corn, beans, oil, milk and other basic products.

Juana wants her children to be able to finish their studies and for this reason she works with a lot of effort and dedication so they can have success in the future. She also earns income from raising pigs. She dreams of having a large grocery store in order to contend with the competition in her community.

Lucía G. R. belongs to Juana’s Group, she is 47 years old and sells pozol which is the traditional drink of the region as well as artisanal crafts ( bags, tortilla baskets, baby cradles and fans among other crafts) She started her pozol selling business approximately 20 years ago.

Luica needs the loan in order to buy corn, cacao and firewood to continue selling pozol. She also wants to buy a scale; for now, in order for her to complete her orders, she has to borrow a scale from a neighbor.

She has 3 children studying in university; for this reason she needs to invest more in her business. The purchase of the scale would make things easier so she wouldn’t have go to her neighbor’s house to weigh her products; her main clients are the people in her community.

Currently she sells her products at home and has dreams of having a place next to her home to set up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic products: sugar, rice, beans, salt, oil, soap, milk

loans.name: Castulo

texts.es:
Cástulo tiene 44 años, él es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante; auque es divorciado y no tiene hijos, siempre piensa en darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres, con ellos vive y con una prima, en una amplia casa ubicada en un populoso distrito de Lima.

Este hombre trabajador se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que tiene en su casa y que desde hace 15 años lo mantiene muy bien. Compra ropa al por mayor y la vende a sus clientes, que le cancelan a fin de mes, con esta actividad no pasa ningún tipo de carencia y le ha permitido adquirir los electrodomésticos necesarios para vivir en regular comodidad junto a sus ancianos padres. 
Como Cástulo es un hombre emprendedor, también vende cerveza en su casa, sobretodo los fines de semana cuando esta bebida tiene más salida entre amigos y conocidos del barrio.
Así es la vida de este hombre que empezó a ser negociante desde muy joven y que ha aprendido a crecer honradamente a base de esfuerzo y mucho trabajo. Nada ni nadie lo desaniman en cumplir sus objetivos en la vida; quiere  llegar a ser un gran comerciante y tener su propia línea de ropa, además de una bien surtida licorería. Algún día, no muy lejano, sabe que lo logrará con su esfuerzo y habilidad.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y promete ser responsable con cada pago, porque sabe que habrá otros préstamos que le permitirán crecer económicamente. También está conforme con el trabajo y puntualidad de su banco comunal, siendo la mayoría de sus compañeras, mujeres. Ya tiene pensado en qué destinará el dinero que solicita, y será en comprar mayor cantidad de ropa de verano, pues ya empezó la temporada y los clientes están ansiosos por comprarla.
texts.en:
Cástulo, 44, is a man who is very eager to get ahead in life. Although divorced and childless, he strives to provide a better quality of life for his parents. He lives with them and a cousin in a large house located in a populous district of Lima. This hard-working man has sold clothing from his home for the past 15 years and has done quite well. He buys clothing at wholesale and then sells to his customers who pay him at the end of the month. This activity has allowed him to suffer no deprivations and has allowed him to buy the necessary appliances to furnish his home with a measure of comfort for his elderly parents. Because Cástulo is an enterprising fellow, he also sells beer from his home, especially on week-ends when this beverage is more popular among his neighbors and friends. Such is this man's life who learned very young to be a businessman and has learned to grow honestly thanks to his efforts and lots of work. Nothing dissuades him from reaching his goals in life; he wants to become a great merchant and have his own clothing line as well as a well-stocked liquor store. Some day, not too distant, he knows he will reach it with his effort and ability. This is his third loan with MFP and he pledges to be responsible with his repayments because he knows there will be future loans which will allow him to grow economically. He is also satisfied with the work and punctuality of his communal bank where most of his partners are women. He has decided to spend these funds in the purchase of a larger quantity of Summer clothing since the season has begun and his customers are anxious to buy it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his inventory.

loans.name: Savuth

texts.en: Mr. Savuth N. lives in the village of Srae Srang in Takeo Province. To earn a living, he is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare piece of land for cultivating rice. On his plantation, he faces the obstacle of infertile soil, which has a bad effect on his crops. Thus, he has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for the field in order to make his crops more productive. His wife, Mrs. Nuonn Chanthou, is a grocer. The couple has three children. Two of the children are employed in a garment factory, while the other child is only two years old. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers in order to make his crops more productive

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
SAN RAFAEL es un comité  que se encuentra en pleno desarrollo de la décimo etapa del Proyecto Mujeres Emprendedoras  dentro de la Fundación Paraguaya cuenta con 19 integrantes. 
Todas las integrantes son mujeres muy sacrificadas y luchadoras cada una con una familia que sacar adelante.
Se puede mencionar  el caso de la Sra . Juliana V.  posee un pequeño puesto de venta de frutas al costado de la Avda.  Carreteras de López, ella va al mercado de abasto a comprar las frutas,  ademas vende también  jugos naturales, tiene clientela  formada y asegurada ya que sus productos son muy solicitados. Con el ingreso que ella consigue día a día ayuda al marido. La misma comento que ingreso en el comité con la idea de ampliar su pequeño negocio y actualmente lo esta logrando por ello agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya.
Es un comité antiguo pero con  muchas ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
San Rafael is a committee of the Mujeres Emprendedoras [Enterprising Women] program of Fundación Paraguaya. This is their tenth loan. The committee has 19 members. All of them are sacrificing and fighting women, each with a family to raise.

It bears mentioning the case of Mrs. Juliana V., who has small fruit stand on Carreteras de López Avenue. She goes to the wholesale food market to buy fruit. She also sells natural juices. She has a regular and assured client base, as her products are much in demand. With the income that she makes day-by-day, she helps out her husband.

Juliana comments that she entered the committee with the idea of building her small business, and now she is achieving that goal. For that, she is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya. The committee is old, but is working hard to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise, clothing, fruit, herbs, cloth, cleaning products, and food ingredients, all for retail sale.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Miss T. Anna is a salon owner along Jubilee Street in Ibanda town. She has been in this business for over seven years.

Anna is a promising businesswoman whose future hope is to expand her salon so that she can employ more workers to help her work on more customers. More so, she is willing to attract as many customers as she can for better profits. She wants to use the loan for purchasing hair extensions, hair crème relaxers, jelly, and so forth for her salon.

Anna is thirty-years old. She is married and has four children of whom three are schooling. Her husband is a businessman who sells tiles.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions, hair crème relaxers, jelly, and so forth

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr: Saye S. est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banv Villageois de PALENE d'où elle a contracté 7 fois de suite du crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et vend de l'huile et des arachides. Elle participe à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Saye S. is a 43 year-old, married woman with five children. She is a member of the PALENE Village Bank and has previously taken out seven loans. She engages in the fattening of sheep and sells oil and peanuts. She helps to meet the needs of the family.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and develop her business

loans.name: Jelina

texts.en:
Jelina A. is from the village of Minaog, Dipolog City but she operates her business in Poblacion, La Libertad, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 57 years-old and married with one adult child. To make a living, Jelina owns and operates a general store selling a variety of grocery products.  She also sells soft drinks in the local community. Jelina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jelina joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Jelina is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital for her soft drink selling business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jelina from PMPC and through Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph M. is a 33-year-old married father of one son, Alvin. Joseph is a mechanic who repairs motor vehicles. He has been in this business for two years now.

Joseph joined KADET recently and is now accessing his first loan. With the money, Joseph plans to buy motor vehicle spare parts in order to meet the needs of the market around him and to keep his business ready for any mechanical problems that need his attention. He was introduced to KADET by a neighbor.
 
He dreams and hopes to one day own a big garage with several employees.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Lidia es soltera, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Lidia vende salchipapas de manera ambulatoria en una calle transitada, para lo cual cuenta con una carreta, actividad que realiza todos los días por las noches.
Lidia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de aceite, papa y la compra de una nueva carreta.
El sueños de Lidia es construir su casa.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the communal bank "Anabella.' She is single, 48 years old, and has 6 children. Lidia is a street vendor who sells salchipapas (typical Peruvian meal including a hot dog and fried potatoes) from a vending cart each night. Lidia needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles to use to purchase cooking oil, potatoes and to buy a new cart. Lidia dreams of building her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes and a new vending cart

loans.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en:
Hurelbaatar is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hentii province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', the Mongolian nomadic tent, in a yard that belongs to his relatives. His wife is a government worker earning 160,000 tugrugs (~ 112 USD) per month. Hurelbaatar operates a gold and silver goods business. He makes silver bowls, men's and women's silver belt buckles, and saddles with silver or gold decorations. 

Hurelbaatar has been operating his business since 1991 and has steadily expanded the business and become more experienced. He operated his business from his home until December 2009 when he began to rent a counter at the Ochmanlai trading center. Currently, his average daily revenue is 20,000 – 25,000 tugrugs (~ 15 - 20 USD), and his total monthly revenue exceeds 1,000,000 – 1,500,000 tugrugs (~ 705 – 1055 USD). Sometimes customers buy Hurelbaatar's products on credit, but they always pay the money back on time. Hurelbaatar has a loyal customer base because of his excellent service and experience of 19 years. Furthermore, he has been planning to expand his business in the future. 

Besides his gold and silver business, Hurelbaatar has operated a vegetable trading business since 2007. He planted 2.5 tons of potatoes on his land and sold all of them. Hurelbaatar is a very hard-working person who has a great business mind. His business is very important for him and he says, “I have been operating my gold and silver goods business for a long time, and I love my job. People like to buy my products, because I am dedicated to my craft.” He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1407 USD) loan to purchase more silver and other materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for silver and gold-working

loans.name: Donatela's Group

texts.en:
Donatela R. is from the town of Villa Ylanan Maddela Quirino. She is 56 years old and the leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Donatela R.'s group.

Donatela is married and has six adult children. To make a living, she sells seafood products including fish and shrimp in her local community. She has had this business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Donatela joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Donatela is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Donatela from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.pt:
Glória Azarais M. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 33 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos de 16, 13, 11, 9 e 5 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Frequenta 9ą classe no curso nocturno porque na altura não teve possibilidade devido a falta de recursos financeiros. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.
Saiu da cidade da Matola para o bairro da Matola rio depois de se juntar ao seu marido no ano 2000. Tem um negócio próprio a mais de 10 anos no quintal da sua própria casa, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.500.00mt a 4.000.0mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu irmão que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos, sumos, bolachas e outros) para aumentar e diversificar ainda mais a sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 15.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para poder aplicar no melhoramento do seu negócio como forma de ajudar o seu marido nas despesas de casa.
texts.en:
Glória was born in the town of Matola, in the Maputo Province, South of Mozambique. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of 5 children who are 16, 13, 11, 9 and 5 years old. All her children go to school. She is in 9th grade of night school because she couldn't finish school due to lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her family and supports two nephews who live with her. She left the town of Matola to the Matola Rio district upon moving in with her husband in 2000. She has had her own business in her backyard for over 10 years. She doesn't have any employees and has an income of 3.500.00 to 4.000.00m per month, which goes to household expenses and she manages to save some money in her savings account. She has never had loans with other banks. She came to know Hluvuku through her brother who is also a partner of the institution. This loan, in the amount of 20.000.00mt is her second. She intends to purchase merchandise (beer, sodas, juices, cookies and others) to increase and diversify her inventory. The previous loan was for 15.000.00mt and invested in the same activity. She commits to paying this loan on time in order to be able to be granted other loans. In the future, she would like to request more loans to improve her business as a way of helping her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products (beer, sodas, juices, cookies and others)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 45 year-old woman who runs a store that sells household goods (flasks, hot pots, mugs, plates, basins, hand bags, etc.).  She is married to a teacher and has two sons, ages 20 and 12, and one daughter, age 18.  She has been in business for 15 years and sells in the market center to local people, churches, and schools. Her primary challenges are low sales at different times of the month and competition from other businesswomen selling similar products. In addition to this business, she operates a transport minivan service ("matatu") on the Kakamega-Kitale route.

Josephine plans to use her 50,000 KES loan to pay school fees for her son at University Egerton (20,000) and school fees for her daughter at KCA Nairobi (30,000). In the past, Josephine has successfully repaid a 150,000 KES loan.

In the future, Jospehine hopes her two children complete college and will be working. She wants to purchase a car and build a home on her own piece of land so that her family can avoid paying rent. In 5 years, she aspires to be a wholesaler of cooking utensils in Kakamega, and to open many shops in different towns. She describes herself as hard-working, strict, and generous.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son at University (Egerton) and school fees for her daughter at KCA Nairobi.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley M. N. is twenty two years old, single and has no children yet. He does a transport business and provides the services to the people of Thika. He has been in this business for the last two years and he says the business is good. The only major challenge is the rains, which make it difficult to run the business. He is using his loan of KES20,000 to buy another motor cycle to expand his business. He hopes to buy a vehicle for taxi business. He describes himself as cheerful and social.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Mr. Khan V., 48, makes a living by selling fish that he buys from fisherman. Currently earning an average of $2 a day, he has been running his business for several years. His wife, 49, raises pigs and grows rice on their plot of land.

Khan V. is the father of seV. adult children, two of whom are now married and living away from home, while the other five are single. He has an unemployed daughter who he wants to establish in a grocery business and so is requesting a loan for her to use as capital to begin the enterprise.

loans.use: To mend an old house and to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.es:
Maria Elba P. C. tiene 47 años.  Es casada y vive con su esposo e hijos en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa, que está ubicada a una hora y media del cantón Chillanes.  Son 18 socios en total, que en la mayoridad tienen sus propios negocios. Esto es el primer  préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Maria se dedica a ama de casa. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos. Su sueño es que le vaya bien a su negocio.  

En su tiempo libre, le gusta disfrutar con su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Elba P. C. is 47 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar province. Maria belongs to the communal bank Santa Rosa, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 18 members in all, and the majority of them have their own businesses. This is the first loan that they have taken from the Cooperativa San José. Maria is a housewife. She is requesting this loan to buy pigs. Her dream is that her business is successful. In her free time, she likes to spend time with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is married and has two children; one of them is at school and the second one is still young.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Teddy rents a two-room house which has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, medication and food.

Teddy owns a bar in Nakulabye where she sells all types of liquors and beers.  She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of beer and jerycans of local gin. She doesn’t have any side job. She has been in this business for many years. She rents her business premises and sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale . She works seven days in a week and depends on this job for a living. Her business challenges are thieves and defaulters.

loans.use: To buy more gin and beer

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.en:
Uguloy lives in the city of Dushanbe with her 3 children. She has had a retail business for about two years and is in the process of expanding it. Uguloy sells a variety of clothing for women in local market. By offering a range of clothing items, she provides a convenient stop for her customers who often will buy more than just one item from her.

Uguloy has requested a loan of 4000 Somoni to increase her working capital and help sustain her business. Purchasing inventory from wholesalers has required a substantial investment from Uguloy which is why she decided to obtain a loan. This loan will give her added flexibility and will help cover some of her growing expenses while she develops a larger business. Additional profits generated by her business will provide Uguloy with stable income and the ability to support her dear children financially.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of shoes to expand her inventory

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn S. is from the village of San Vicente Alto Oroq. City, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Emelyn is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Emelyn works at someone else's business venture in the services sector, operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products, like vitamins and shirts, in the local community. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Emelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Emelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
