Ma. Theresa I. is from the village of Barangay 2, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old. Ma. Theresa is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Ma. Theresa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Ma. Theresa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ma. Theresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Theresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Theresa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ma. Theresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Shafqat's Group

texts.en:
Shafqat is 50 years old and is a seamstress. She has to work at this older age in order to put three meals a day on the table for her family. She is old but she is not disheartened by her financial situation. She lives in a big industrial city in Pakistan called Gujranwala. Her husband operates a donkey cart. He transports goods to earn an income for his family.

Shafqat has a great supporting nature. She has a daughter who married A. Aziz a few years ago. A. Aziz drives a rickshaw which is in need of repair and maintenance because, due to its roughness and poor condition, he can’t seat his passengers and continue his work. Therefore, Shafqat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help A. Aziz with his business. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw to do his job more efficiently.

Shafqat is a regular Asasah loan user and this is her 2nd loan.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of her son-in-law's rickshaw

loans.name: Judilyn

texts.en:
Judilyn S. is a married woman who lives in Purok RD, Barangay Su-ay, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a vehicle spare parts business. Her husband Ruben S., 42 years old, works as a conductor to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 3 children who are between the ages of 5 to 14 years old. 

Judilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon,  Judilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000 which she intends to use to buy more stocks for her vehicle spare parts business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and to make repairs to her home. Judilyn S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen T. T. N. is 29 years old and has 1 small child. She is a farmer who is raising 200 chickens for eggs. She has run this kind of business for many years and makes a good income from it. Since becoming a client of our credit program in 2006, she has used loans effectively in expanding her business. Currently, she wants a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana vive en la ciudad hermosa del Cusco, Perú y desD. hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón D. San Sebastián” D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas Arariwa. Ana tiene 4 hijos y se considera una madre trabajadora y emprendedora, ella tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en vender ropa para niños y bebes.
     
Ana con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir D. $ 700 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más ropas como por ejemplo compras, pantalones, casacas para bebes y niños. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ana lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru and has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón D. San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Ana has 4 children and considers herself to be a hard-working and enterprising mother.  She has a small business selling clothes for children and babies.

Ana plans to use her loan for $700 USD to increase her business capital.  She would like to buy more clothes such as sweaters, pants and jackets for children and babies.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being offered with this loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more clothes such as sweaters, pants and jackets for babies and children

loans.name: Felista Wanjiju

texts.en:
Felista Wanjiju N. is a married woman and a mother of five children. She lives in Waratho in the Kiambu district area. This is a middle class estate with a high population. Felista has been operating a grocery stall for a number of years from which she sells various kinds of vegetables such as cabbages, onions, tomatoes and many more.

Felista learned about KADET through a friend who was already a member. She has never borrowed from any other financial institution. Felista has applied for a loan which she plans to use to buy a dairy calf worth 15,000 KES. This will enable her to boost her income and thus support her family better.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 40 años. Es casado y resiD. junto a su familia en el anexo Santa Rosa del caserío Lagunas, un lugar habitado por gente bastante humilD. y trabajadora, pertenece a L. provincia D. Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más D. una hora D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio L. cual es atendida por su esposa. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes D. L. zona diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a L. buena calidad D. los productos que ofrecen y a L. buena atención que brindan, adicionalmente se dedica trabajar como agricultor. Con estas actividades se encarga D. sustentar económicamente a su familia.

L. creciente demanda que su bodega ha venido experimentando ha hecho que piense en ampliarL. adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Vicente is 40 years old. He is married and resides with his family in the Santa Rosa annex of the Lagunas village, a place inhabited by humble and hard-working people, belonging to the Lambayeque province and found more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He owns a small store installed in his home which is attended by his wife. There they offer different consumable products to neighbors and customers in the area, among them basic necessities and groceries. The business is well-known due to the good quality of products that they offer and the good service they proviD.. Additionally, he is dedicated to working as a farmer. With these activities, he is in charge of supporting his family economically.

The growing demand that his store has been experiencing has maD. him think about expanding by acquiring more products. For this, he has seen fit to request a loan of 2,000 "soles" from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase products to expand her shop.

location.town: Anexo Santa Rosa - Lagunas - Mórrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Khalila

texts.en:
Khalila is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while the other one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop for the last two years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Khalila faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She hopes to build rental houses in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cereals and sugar for her retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cereals and sugar for her retail shop

loans.name: Josè Narciso

texts.es:
Josè Narciso Q. A. tiene 40 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre vive con la compañera y con los hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.


Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, Recinto San Antonio parroquia San José del Tambo distancia de la oficina a 150 minutos de la comunidad se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Josè Narciso se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprar terrenos.

Le gusta disfrutar del deporte.
texts.en:
Josè Narciso Q. A. is 40 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 6 children.

The members of the UNION SAN ANTONIO community bank are located in San Antonio precinct, in San José del Tambo parish, 150 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this business for a long time.

José Narciso is a farmer.  He grows corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  He buys his products in the Matilde Ester shopping area and sells his products in Bucay.

José Narciso is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for growing corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to be able to buy land.  He enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Fe's Group

texts.en:
Fe P. is from the village of San Vicente, Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 48 years old. Fe is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Fe is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, she makes and sells sweets such as cookies and cakes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $69 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Fe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Her husband’s support of her farming business is Candida’s inspiration to continue through the challenges of poverty but growing her business despite that. The farming business has brought pleasure to Candida’s family. Because of its profits, she has been able to support the family’s need. 

Being a good mother and grandmother, Candida always wanted to support her children in whatever career they would be taking to better their own personal life and support grandchildren to complete college. Aside from Candida’s farming business financed by the loan she received from ASHI, she also has a retailing business which is her way of saving her profits to support the needs of her family, especially for her grandchildren’s education until college. With that, Candida is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds “palay”, and support the maintenance of her retail business. This would provide for her and make their business grow, and make more profit, which will enable her to support her ambition in life.

Candida has been an ASHI member since 2002. Her family is very glad that she has an opportunity to improve their quality of living through the income of the farming business she has established with the support of the loans she has requested.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, rice seeds "palay", and support the maintenance of her retail business.

loans.name: Trabajando Por El Futuro Group

texts.es: EDAPROSPO, tiene una nueva alcancía Comunal que se hacen llamar “Trabajando por el Futuro” conformada por 7 personas muy responsables, quienes  decidieron  cambiar su futuro ya que solicitaron un  préstamo, algunos para emprender un negocio y otros para invertir en su negocio. Tal es el caso de Zenobia quien tiene 34 años de edad es casada, tienes dos hijos aun menores de edad y es la tesorera del grupo. Ella tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como: yogurt, jugos, gaseosas y galletas, aparte de vender en su bodega ella se encarga de repartir pan por las mañanas. Zenobia juntamente con su esposo trabajan arduamente y con el resultado de su trabajo lograron comprar un auto el cual lo emplean para trabajar en transporte público local, él se encarga de cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos y la comida mientras que Zenobia se encarga de cubrir los gastos de la casa como: luz agua teléfono y otros gastos más. A Zenobia le gustaría comprarse un carro más grande para transporte público y por eso ella y su esposo  trabajan con el fin de lograr dicho objetivo. En la fotografía podemos apreciar a los socios en el momento del desembolso en nuestras instalaciones, en donde concurrieron con sus menores hijos y  los dos socios de los extremos derecho e izquierdo asistieron acompañados de su madre.
texts.en:
A new group has joined Kiva partner EDAPROSPERO’s community bank. The group is called Trabajando por el Futuro (Working for the Future) and comprises seven very responsible people who have decided to work for a better future so they are seeking a loan. Some wish to start a new business; others wish to invest in their current businesses. 

34-year old Zenobia fits into the latter category. She is married, has two children, and is the group’s treasurer. She runs a small grocery store out of her house and plans to use the money to buy more merchandise such as yogurt, juice, soft drinks, and cookies. As well as running the store, she delivers bread in the mornings.

Zenobia and her husband work very hard and as a result have managed to buy a car which they use to provide a local taxi service. Her husband is responsible for paying for the children’s education and food, while Zenobia is responsible for expenses such as electricity, water, telephone etc. She would love to buy a bigger vehicle, and this is one of the couple’s goals. 

In the photograph you can see the group members during the time of loan distribution in EDAPROSPERO’s office. Some of their young children are also present. The two members on the extreme right and left have brought their mothers along.

loans.use: to buy yogurt, juice, soft drinks, and cookies

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun V., 30, resides with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. V. sells rice, earning an income of USD 3.30 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3.30 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 80 on other expenses. V. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase chickens and rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy chickens and rice.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora S. is from the city of Tabid, Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old. Flora is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of planting and harvesting seaweed for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Flora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. 

Flora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seedlings and twine to expand the business. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings and twine

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, junk foods, biscuits, shampoo, soap and detergents in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Elizabeth joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional beverages and biscuits. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and biscuits

loans.name: Rolan

texts.en:
Rolan R. is from the city of Tangub City. He is 35 years old. Rolan is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, he operates a family member's business, running a general store where he sells a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rolan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase canned goods, noodles and rice to sell. This will be his 1st loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles and rice to sell

loans.name: María Virginia

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Valroc. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un bebé de 6 meses  de edad. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella y su esposo tienen un negocio de bazar y cabinas telefónicas, allí además de vender artículos de bazar también venden ropa, perfumes, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas, trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00. Los productos para el bazar los compra en Portoviejo. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio ocho años y que les ha ido bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar artículos de bazar, perfumes, tarjetas telefónicas y ropa. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos les dan sin tantos requisitos.

Su sueño es agrandar más su negocio
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Valroc meet every fortnight in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is renowned for its delicious sweets, which are famous in the whole country and are prepared by warm and friendly local people.

Here we met Señora María. She is 23 years old, married and has a 6-month-old baby from this union. Her husband is a merchant. She and her husband have a small hardware store and telephone booths. In addition to hardware, they sell clothes, perfumes, recharge phone cards. They work every day from 8 am to 9 pm. They buy their supplies in Portoviejo. María says that she has been in this business for eight years and that they have done quite well.
This loan will be used to buy hardware articles, perfume, phone cards and clothes. She has had so far three loan cycles and likes her communal bank because the loans are granted without much red tape.

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hardware articles, perfume, phone cards and clothes.

loans.name: Gulerahon's Group

texts.en: Gulerahon K., aged 27, is the leader of this group. In order to earn money to meet their family's needs her husband has gone to work in Russia. Gulerahon takes care of two sons, both of whom are preschool age (under seven). With the initial investment of 8,000 soms Gulerahon started cultivating wheat. She has applied for this loan so she can use the money to purchase fertilizers for growing wheat. In the near future she plans to start repairing the house. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for growing wheat

loans.name: Wendy Pola

texts.es: Wendy es una joven de 23 años de edad,  propietaria de variedades Quik , negocio ubicado en el barrio Santa Maria de la ciudad de Barranquilla donde vive con su cónyuge; desde el año 2009 decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios, después de haber trabajado y adquirido durante varios años experiencia como vendedora de un almacén; Wendy es procedente de San Onofre una población del departamento de Sucre y llegó , cuando tenía 2 años,  a la ciudad de Barranquilla  de la mano de sus padres, quienes le han provisionado bienestar y la posibilidad de estudiar, acompañada de una actitud proactiva hacia el trabajo. Ella estudia licenciatura en humanidades, lengua castellana e idiomas en  la universidad y simultáneamente trabaja. En su negocio vende ropa femenina y masculina,  así como también accesorios tipo miscelánea, que ofrece mediante el sistema de crédito y también de contado respondiendo a las necesidades de su clientela,  ubicada principalmente en el barrio donde vive. Este es su primer financiamiento y con el comprará ropa para caballeros, colonias, pañuelos y accesorios varios, preparándose para atender la demanda que viene a propósito de  la celebración del día del padre,  época de mucho movimiento comercial,  durante la cual se incrementan sus ventas usualmente. Su sueño es tener varios puntos comerciales y terminar sus estudios universitarios para postularse en la Policía nacional como profesional y ella trabajará persistentemente para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Wendy, a young lady who is 23 years old, is the owner of the Quik variety store, in the Santa Maria neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla, where she lives with her husband,  In 2009 she decided to open her own business after having worked and gained several years of experience as a store saleslady.  Wendy is from San Onofre in the department of Sucre, but moved to Barranquilla with her parents when she was two years old.  They provided her with well-being, an education and a pro-active attitude regarding work.

She studies liberal arts, Spanish and foreign languages at the university, while also holding a job.  She sells ladies' and men's clothing, as well as different accessories, on a credit or cash basis, whichever is most convenient for her customers who live mainly in her neighborhood.  This is her first loan and it will be used to buy men's clothing, colognes, scarves and various accessories.  This is in preparation for the high demand that will come with the celebration of Father's Day, usually a very busy time when normal sales increase.  Her dream is to have several sales points and finish her education to try and become a national policewoman.  She will work hard to make it happen.

loans.use: To buy men's clothing, colognes, scarves and various accessories.

loans.name: Carlos Leonel

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 37 años de edad, el es casado, cuenta con casa  propia, en la que reside con sus esposa e hijos, su esposa se desempeña en la venta de productos de belleza, actividad con la que apoya a carlos desde su casa , que esta ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande en el departamento de Piura en el norte del Perú.

Carlos se dedica a desarrollar labores de agricultura desde hace varios años, el suele sembrar distintos tipos de tubérculos. Además se dedica a la comercialización de animales, entre ellos tenemos principalmente ganado ovino los cuales están ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive

Carlos desea dar mantenimiento a su cultivo y ampliar corral de sus animales para lo que  cuenta con una experiencia de más de 15 años. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles, para solventar dichos gastos.

Carlos es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carlos is 37 years old, married, and owns his own home where he lives together with his wife and children.  His wife sells beauty products and, through her business, she supports Carlos.  She works from their home which is located in Tambogrande district, in Piura department, in the north of Peru.

Carlos has been farming for several years.  He usually grows different types of tubers.  He also sells animals, mainly sheep, which he keeps in an area behind his home.  When they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the traders who always visit his area.

Carlos would like to care for his crops and expand his animal pen (he has more than 15 years experience raising animals).  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa, in order to cover these expenses.

Carlos is a calm and responsible person.  His greatest wish is to grow as a businessman and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to care for his crops and expand his animal pens

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn, 40 years old, is a married woman from the town of Sto. Nino, South Cotabato. She has two children aged nine and three. She is a rice farmer and has been doing this business for 13 years now.

Jovelyn needs a loan to support her livelihood. The loan will help her buy fertilizers and rice seed.

In the future, Jovelyn hopes to send her children to college. She believes also that through God’s provision, she will be able to raise her family well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seed.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú), tiene 43 años de edad y tiene cuatros hijos. Actualmente, Ana vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con sus hijos. Ana y su esposo tienen  un negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de repuestos en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. Su esposo es la persona quien se encarga de la administración del negocio. Ya son cuatro años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Ana requiere el préstamo para comprar repuestos y otra parte será para el pasaje de sus esposo. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoq Allpa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Ana was born in the city of Cusco (Peru). She is 43 years old and has four children. Currently, Ana lives in the same city where she was born, together with her children. Ana and her husband have a family business which consists of selling spare parts in the city of Puerto Maldonado. Her husband is the one who takes charge of managing the business. They have operated this business for four years, and it is going very well for them thanks to the dedication they put into their work. At this time, Ana needs a loan to buy spare parts, and another portion of the funds will be used for her husband's travel expenses.  

The borrower is a responsible and hard-working person, and thanks to these qualities, her fellow members invited her to participate in the “Mosoq Allpa” communal bank of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, and also to pay for her husband's travel.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng sells groceries and earns $5 per day. She is a single mother with 2 children.  One of them works in the factory and earns $2.50 per day. Every month, Chheng has to spend $89 on food, $15 on electricity and $20 transportation. 

Chheng would like a loan of $500 to buy more grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to buy a store for herself.  At present, she is helping to make her daughter's store run well.   She would also like to get a shop for her son to do motorbike repairing so that he can have his own career and support himself.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a 66-year-old widow and a food vendor. She has been in this business for the last sixteen years. 

She is a  KADET LTD client and this is her first loan to finance her business. With this loan she plans to expand her business by purchasing rice, beans, cooking oil and wheat flour into her business.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to be able to provide for her grandchildren.

loans.use: purchasing rice, beans, cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Iris Del Socorro

texts.es: Iris vive en el municipio de Soledad con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en las edades de 10 a 25 años. Allí se dedica al oficio de la confección y también vende mercancías variadas, como ropa interior y exterior femenina, colonias, perfumes cremas y accesorios. Su necesidad personal de generar ingresos, fueron sus principal motor para desarrollar esta actividad de manera independiente y poder apoyar la gestión de su hogar. Iris maneja otra actividad con lo que complementa sus ingresos que ofrece los servicios de enfermería, actividad en la cual se encuentra capacitada para hacerlo. Su credikiva es el séptimo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  organización con la cual tiene 12 años de estar vinculada; con él  comprará telas, hilos, botones, broches, correderas, pellones, colonias, perfumes, brasieres, suéteres, bermudas, chancletas, para continuar su crecimiento y expansión en el mercado.  Con el apoyo de la Fundación Iris ha logrado cambiar su forma de vida, pues mejoró sus ingresos, aplicando a sus créditos toda su fuerza de trabajo y disciplina. Su meta más adelante es organizar locativamente su taller en su vivienda y ampliar la miscelánea., pero su gran desafío es que su creciente clientela, le hacen sentir como su capital es insuficiente para responder a sus expectativas.  Mientras tanto, Iris trabaja persistentemente, logrando obtener un aumento 38% en sus ganancias, lo cual ha permitido la reinversión en su negocio.
texts.en:
Iris lives in the municipality of Soledad with her ​​husband and 5 children aged between 10 and 25 years old.  She works there making clothes, and also selling various goods such as underwear and outerwear for women, colognes, perfumes, lotions and accessories.  The main driver for her developing this activity independently was her personal need for income and to be able to support her household.  Iris manages another activity that supplements her income; she provides nursing services, an activity which she is capable of doing.

This Kiva loan is the seventh loan that she has received from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization which she has been involved with for 12 years.  With it, she will purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, snaps, zips, interfacing, colognes, perfumes, bras, sweaters, shorts, and flip flops, to continue her growth and expansion in the market. 

With the support of the Foundation, Iris has succeeded in changing her way of life as well as improving her income, by applying her entire work ethic and discipline to the loans.  Her goal for later on is to set up her workshop in her home and expand the amount of miscellaneous items she offers.  But her big challenge is her growing customer base, which makes her feel like her capital is insufficient to meet their expectations. 

Meanwhile, Iris works consistently, achieving a 38% increase in profits which has allowed her to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, snaps, zips, interfacing, colognes, perfumes, bras, sweaters, shorts, and flip flops,

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is 59 years old and married. She has 14 children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Hope runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Hope has been in this business for 26 years, and she sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, soap, noodles, etc.
 
She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

In the future Hope would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Claude is 33 years old. He is married with two children between two and five years old. He sells various goods such as soft drinks, biscuits, lotions, etc and he has three years of experience in this business. He works from 6 am until 6 pm every day except Sunday.

Claude has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more goods such as soft drinks, biscuits, lotions, sugar, rice, salt etc for sale. Once his business is expanded, Claude hopes to reinvest in this business and to save in the future.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, biscuits, lotions, etc to sell.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is a married man with one child. He lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato where he manages a rice farm.

Ramon has been engaged in farming for 30 years. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. He earns about 10,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Ramon also started raising pigs to expand his source of income. He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pig feed.

In the future, he hopes to become a successful businessman. He also hopes for his child to have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира занимается услугами маникюра, педикюра и наращиванием ногтей в парикмахерской. Даная услуга очень востребована и приносит хорошие доходы. Муж Нодиры на заработках в Российской Федерации и ее заработки помогают ей в содержании двоих детей. Она хочет получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса  для покупки сырья, а именно набор ногтей, крема, лаков, средство для снятия лака, аппарат для сушки ногтей и для покупки униформы.
texts.en: Nodira is involved in providing manicure, pedicure and nail extension services at a hair salon.  This service is in high demand and brings in a good income.  Nodira's husband is working in the Russian Federation, and Nodira's income helps her to support her children.  She wants to obtain this loan to expand her business and to buy supplies, such as a set of nails, lotion, nail polish, nail polish remover, equipment for drying nails and to purchase a uniform.

loans.use: to purchase salon supplies

loans.name: Batamgalan

texts.en: Batamgalan has been making handmade shoes and his wife has been selling them in the market since 2006. He owns a counter in Mongolia's biggest market and his monthly income is approximately 2,100,000 tugriks (MNT). Now that winter is approaching, he needs additional raw materials to make warmer shoes. He is a young and diligent man who is requesting 2,200,000 MNT to buy materials for his business. Batamgalan is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (Mongolian nomadic tent) in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. His elder son is a school student and the younger one goes to kindergarten.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es: Doña Edel es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas,  tiene 42 años, es madre de 5 hijos, 2 de ellos ya mayores de edad que no viven con ella,  los otros están en escuela y colegio, y un niño de apenas 2 meses de nacido. Los ingresos económicos de su familia son muy escasos, su esposo trabaja en una finca piñera, y lo que recibe de salario se hace insuficiente para cubrir los gastos básicos de su familia, por eso trabaja mucho, desde muy temprano se levanta para realizar las labores de porcicultura, lavar los chiqueros donde están los cerdos, darles de comer, así como sus labores domesticas,  luego se va a trabajar medio día a la cocina de la escuela de su comunidad,  y para cuando regresa también realiza labores de costuras. Todo esto para poder darle los estudios a sus hijos y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos.  Este es el tercer crédito que solicita a Fundación Mujer, y en los créditos anteriores ella y sus compañeras de grupo han sido muy responsables y puntuales.  Edel es una mujer muy luchadora, que busca el bien para ella y su familia, y sabe que solo con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación puede lograrlo,  su mayor anhelo es mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia, tener su negocio propio en la casa para ya no tener que salir a trabajar. Actualmente el banco está compuesto por 10 socias, y van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias, como siembra de plátano y otras hortalizas, cría de ganado y cerdos.
texts.en:
Edel is the President of the “Mujer Creciendo Juntas” communal bank.  She’s 42 years old and the mother of five children.  Two of them are already adults and no longer live with her and the others are in secondary and elementary school; she also has a new-born, two-month old son.

Family income is very low.  Her husband works for a pineapple plantation but his salary is insufficient to cover his family’s basic needs.  Because of this she works very hard.  Starting very early in the morning she rises to do the chores related to the pig farm: washing the pigsties where the pigs are and feeding them.  She also does the household chores.  Then she goes off to work half-days in the local school’s kitchen and when she returns home she also does sewing.  All of this is to be able to provide schooling for her children and to help her husband cover expenses.

This is the third loan she’s requested from Fundación Mujer.  In the previous loans she and her fellow group members have been very responsible and punctual.

Edel is a very determined woman who seeks her and her family’s wellbeing.  She knows that she can only reach it through much effort and dedication.  Her greatest wish is to improve her and her family’s quality of life, to have her own home-based business so as not to have to go out anymore.

The bank currently has ten members and they will invest in animal husbandry, banana and other vegetable farming, cattle and pig raising.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed concentrate.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es socia del banco comunal Las aguilas, del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de  Ucayali, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de golosinas, lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos desde hace ocho años y ha estado apoyando a su esposo todo este tiempo, su negocio lo tiene en su misma casa, cuenta con una vitrina donde exhibe sus golosinas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.  1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 cajas de galletas, 3 bolsas de caramelo de diferentes sabores, una bolsa de tofes, 1 caja de chicle, 1 caja de chocolate, 1 bolsa de gomitas, 1 bolsa de chupetines.
Sus tres hijos son mayores de edad, cada uno tiene su familia propia, su esposo es maestro jubilado y tiene un sueldo que recibe del estado, con eso mantiene la casa y parte de sus gastos. 
El pequeño ingreso que genera su negocio es para que lo siga invirtiendo en lo que crea que es más conveniente, gracias a Manuela Ramos ahora tiene sus propios ingresos y eso le da mucha satisfacción .
En la foto se muestra participando de una reunión de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of 'Las Águilas' (The Eagles) community bank.  She is from Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  Alicia is 47 years old, married, and has three children.

Alicia's business is selling candies.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos for eight years and has been supporting her husband all this time.  Her business is located in her home and she has a display case where she displays her candies.

With this new loan for 1,500 soles, Alicia will buy two boxes of cookies, three bags of different flavored sweets, one bag of toffees, one box of gum, one box of chocolate, one bag of gumdrops and one bag of lollipops.

Alicia's three children are grown up and each one has their own family.  Her husband is a retired teacher and receives a salary from the State.  This is how they support their household and cover some of their expenses.

The small income that Alicia's business makes is to invest in what she believes to be most appropriate.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos she now has her own income and this gives her a lot of satisfaction.

In the photo, Alicia can be seen taking part in a meeting of her community bank.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of cookies, three bags of candies, toffees, gum, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old, married, and lives in Ubay, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Josephine has a business that sells spices. She has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 9,500 PHP to purchase spices for her retail business. Josephine has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. 

In the future, Josephine hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spices for her retail business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, aged 32, lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married with three children and runs a salon. Initially she was being employed by someone else and after saving her wages she started her own salon. She desires to educate herself and children, buy land to grow crops, and move her business to a more permanent location. Her business faces a problem of price fluctuations and unseasonable weather.

Monica wants a loan to buy cosmetics for resale and will use part of it for synthetic hair for the salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale and synthetic hair to use in the salon.

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is married and has one son. She is an entrepreneur from the town of Skvira, where she sells groceries. She owns two vending locations at two different markets. Svitlana has been in this business for 5 years. She has one hired employee who works at one of her vending kiosks. Her average net profit amounts to 4,500 Grivnyas a month. 

Svitlana is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and to stock one of her grocery kiosks with confectionery inventory for the upcoming holiday season. Svitlana is very enthusiastic about her venture and her business. She invests all her energy in her business and seeks its growth.

loans.use: to stock one of her kiosks with additional merchandise.

loans.name: Malik

texts.ru: Малик 1959 года рождения, женат имеет 6 детей. Жена домохозяйка, но помогает мужу  по бизнесу. Она стрижет коз и эту шерсть продает.  В начале весны жена Малика и его невестки стригут ангорских коз, после обработки делают пряжу. В течении года они продают пряжу на рынках города. Сам Малик также работает разнорабочим на стройке. У нас сотрудничает с 2010 года. Первый кредит получил в феврале на покупку коз и овец. Также сыновья работают в России и высылают деньги на проживание. За скотом также  ухаживают невестки, когда он уезжает на работу. Кредит получил на покупку баранов и коз.
texts.en: Malik was born in 1959.  He is married and has six children.  His wife is a homemaker, but helps her husband with the business.  Malik shears goats and sells the wool.  His wife and daughters-in-law shear Angora goats at the beginning of spring, then treat the wool and make yarn.  They sell the yarn over the course of a year at the city markets.  Malik also works as a handyman at a construction site.  He has been partnering with us since 2010.  He obtained his first loan in February to purchase goats and sheep.  His sons work in Russia and send money home for living expenses.  Malik's daughters-in-law also help with the livestock when he leaves to go to work.  He is requesting this loan to purchase sheep and goats.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Akech

texts.en:
Akech is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Akech is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 35 year old married woman from Jubeiha, Amman, Jordan who helps support 4 family members. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy materials for the hand woven baskets that she makes and sells. She plans on opening a shop to sell these baskets.

loans.use: to pay for materials for making baskets

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph and his wife have worked on their current farm situated in the deep remote town of Siongiroi, Kenya, since 2000. Since then, their farm and family have grown in more ways than one. In 2008, the couple started working on a run-down farm. Today, they are making money off the poultry and dairy animals they raise and also the maize and vegetables they grow.  He loves to dairy farm, especially since it was always a life goal of his to be a farmer. 

Joseph is seeking a loan to purchase a pedigree dairy cow. There are more than 100 cattle breeds in Kenya. However, not all are good producers of milk. In fact, very few are. Cattle aside, the tastes and preferences of milk in the market is really growing in diversity in Kenya.  Purchasing a pedigree cow goes to show how Joseph is keen on controlling lameness levels in his dairy cattle. 

Your loan will make a significant difference to Joseph's farm profitability. The couple will make use of the returns from this investment to pay for the loan, pay for their children’s education and the rest will be reinvested in the business. It has always been their ambition to share their passion about farming with their children. 
This smallholder farmer dreams are in your hands.

loans.use: To buy a high pedigree cow

loans.name: Margelyn

texts.en:
Margelyn is 40 years of age, and is married. She has two children in school. Her husband works as a seaman. Her way to help her husband in carrying their needs and improve their standard of living is to engage herself in business.

Margelyn runs a water refilling business. She offers free deliveries for her customers. Margelyn has been in her business for one year, and she hopes to take care of the business while she can manage it.

Margelyn wants to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy gallon containers, caps, and seals. She hopes to expand the business by adding another branch.

loans.use: to buy gallon containers, caps, and seals for her water refilling business.

loans.name: Sarvat Hatam Oglu

texts.en:
38-year-old Sarvat lives his family life with 3 children. His family’s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. He is an internall displaced person (IDP). Since 2002 Sarvat has been engaged in selling home apliances .

He applies for a loan amount of $1000 for the first time to further develop his business, to buy new home apliances, to increase his incomes, to improve his family\'s living condition with this additional income, and to obtain some funds for the education of his children.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Valentine Ambe

texts.en:
Valentine is a monogamous married father of ten children. The overwhelming need for tuition, food, medications, and reasonable accommodation for his family is the challenge he has to deal with. He joined GHAPE in 2004 and acquired skills in piggery, marketing techniques, and management and group dynamics in training sessions organized by GHAPE. With previous loans he succeeded in providing his community with meat and manure. He used manure from his pig-farm to assist his wife to cultivate their own vegetables.

Given a loan of $400, he plans to carry out expansion by buying more pigs, feed, and sticks and nails to repair the fence, reserving money to meet the vet needs of the animals.

He plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment of the repayment shall be due on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Raising Pigs

loans.name: Raqia

texts.en:
Raqia lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow; her husband died a few years ago from cancer. She has a son who is a carpet weaver and he is face with economic difficulty. His mother wants to take a group loan for her son so that he can buy all carpet weaving materials to support his family well and make a good income. He wants to thank his mother for helping him.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the son of the borrower. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to some people to post a picture of a woman to the Internet. However, the loan is to the female borrower who is responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy carpet weaving materials

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel is married and has two children aged 24 and 26. Faced with high unemployment in his country, it proved very hard to find a job and he thus began to help his mother-in-law selling clothes. He soon afterwards began his own business selling clothes and groceries on local markets. Fortunately, he made good sales and his business is growing thanks to the quality of his products and the good service he provides.

Miguel now needs a $ 250 loan he will use to buy goods to respond to his customers’ demand. He promises to reimburse this loan in 3 months. Miguel is very thankful to you to help him improve his service and the quality of life of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Arnaud Braud, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel Ángel es casado y tiene dos hijos, de 24 y 26 años de edad. Ante la falta de empleo que hay en el país le fue muy difícil conseguir un trabajo por lo que empezó a ayudarle a su suegra con la venta de ropa. Poco después inició su propio negocio en los mercados rodantes donde vende ropa y abarrotes. Afortunadamente ha tenido buenos resultados y ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que vende y al buen servicio que ofrece.

Ahora Miguel necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía con la que espera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. El se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en tres meses. Miguel agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu apoyo de mejorar su negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Buy goods to sell on local markets

loans.name: Laura Francisco

texts.pt:
Laura Francisco M. is 34 years old. She is married with 4 children. They live in the neighborhood of Magoanine in Maputo. She has a small store where she sells various products. She joined the program in November 2006, and requested a loan of 3.000mt which she paid in full. She is now in the 3rd cycle of the credit program. Laura is requesting a loan of 6.000mt to be repaid in 5 months. She plans on increasing inventory and strengthening her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Laura Francisco M. tem 34 anos de idade e vive maritalmente com o seu esposo e 4 filhos no bairro de Magoanine em Maputo.Tem uma mercearia em casa onde vende uma diversidade de produtos.Entrou para o programa em novembro de 2006 e tomou como 1º empréstimo 3.000 MT.Vai para 3º ciclo de empréstimo e pretende tomar 6.000MT para pagar em 5 meses, o qual pretende reforçar o seu negócio que tem vindo a registar um modesto crescimento.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel is married, 27 years old and has two children. His wife is currently working overseas in Spain. He lives in Santa Cruz with his two small boys.

Miguel owns a fleet of 3 motorcycles that he rents as motorcycle taxis in the city of Montero. He needs the loan to purchase a fourth motorcycle. Since he is purchasing a second hand motorcycle the price of the unit will depend on its condition.

His credit rating is good and he fulfills his credit obligations with Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

Miguel Angel es una persona casada de 27 años de edad, su familia está compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos. Actualmente su conyugue se encuentra trabajando en España, él vive en Santa Cruz con sus dos hijitos. Miguel cuenta con tres motos las cuales las renta para que las mismas sean utilizadas como moto taxis, debido a la gran demanda de este medio de transporte, sobre todo en la ciudad de Montero, es que el solicita el presente crédito para adquirir una moto más. El precio de esta moto dependerá del tiempo de uso que tenga la misma. Los antecedentes crediticios de Miguel son buenos, no reporta aspectos negativos en el sistema financiero y tiene un buen cumplimiento con sus créditos en Agrocapital.

loans.use: MOTORCYCLE PURCHASE

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is a 58-year-old widow, mother of eight children, four boys and four girls. They all are grown up and are working, some of them outside the community.

Oliva is running a cafeteria that she started three years ago. She says she had wanted to have this business for a long time, but she didn´t have access to capital, so she had to wait for the appropriate moment.

Six months ago, Oliva took a loan from our organization and was able to radically change her business. With her loan, she bought a lot of kitchen utensils and now she can prepare the food in good, hygienic conditions. Oliva hopes her business can become so much more profitable that she can hire a girl to help her with the preparation of the food.

With this, her second loan, she plans on purchasing food ingredients to keep on running her business and varying the menu to attract new customers.

loans.use: purchasing food ingredients for her little cafeteria

loans.name: Olga Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia, 40, is single and has no children. For 10 years, she worked selling Avon perfumes and jewelry door to door. A year ago, she received a promotion and she's now an authorized sales rep for Avon; that's to say, she's a distributor for a group of agents. She lives with her father and sister, helping with family expenses, and is pleased to be operating her own business. Her dream is to buy a vehicle so that she can more easily distribute her products to the agents. She's a visionary, able to see how an entrepeneur with her own shop can turn it into a major operation.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Eugenia P., es Soltera de 40 años de edad, sin hijos; desde hace 10 años trabajó como promotora de produtos de Avon (venta de perfumes y joyas), ofreciendo el producto de casa en casa; hace un año, recibio un ascenso en su trabajo, y ahora ella es vendedora autorizada por la empresa Avon; es decir que distribuye a un grupo de promotoras. Actualmente vive con su papá y su hermana; apoya al gasto necesario familiar, es feliz llevando y administrando su propio negocio. Su sueño es poder comprar un vehículo, para poder repartir su produto a las promotoras. Ella es visionaria, se vé como empresaria con su propio local que después sea convertido a un almacen.

loans.use: El préstamo lo utilizara para la a inversión de su negocio.

loans.name: Husna's Mbuyuni Group

texts.en:
Harima B., age 48, is married with 5 children (35, 24, 18, 15, and 10 years old) and 2 other dependents (ages 15 and 10) who are also living with them. Harima owns a fruit and vegetable stand, which she started in 1994. Working from 10am-9:30pm daily, she earns about $60 a month from this business.

Harima now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. Harima belongs to the loan group called Motorauzo and will be sharing this loan with subgroup member Rukia R.. Rukia is a food vendor.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her shop

loans.name: Kiyinki B1 South C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Victo N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase the inventory. Victo is 20 years old and is married with a husband who is a retail shop attendant for work. Each week, Victo makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build rental houses. Victo has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her retail shop business and the loan was paid back on time.

Victo is joined in her small group by Suzan N., Joyce N., Topista Namboozo, and Betty M.. Suzan N. has a business selling produce and wants to uplift her business. Joyce N. is currently operating a tailoring business and wants a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Topista Namboozo operates a business of selling maize and wants to boost business. Betty M. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to start a business selling shoes.

loans.use: To add stock to her shop

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 29 years old and is married woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 7 years old. Salama conduct taxi business, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 5am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

In the past, Salama has taken out 1successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan can expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Celmira

texts.en:
Celmira V. C. has a business knitting beautiful goods in the town of Moche near the city of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. She’s been knitting her entire life and has many different products and loyal clients. On the weekend, Celmira also runs a small eatery serving crillo food to people in her community.

Celmira is 38 years old, single, and has 1 child. She loves working from home where she can also spend time with her child. She works hard to save so she can one day send her child to university to study and become a professional. She also has the goal to one day own her own restaurant.

A member of the community bank Siempre Adelante II, Celmira is requesting a loan of s/800 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy the materials needed to make her beautiful goods.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy the materials needed to make her beautiful knitted goods.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith I. is 30 years old and she is married with 8 children. She lives at Sabo Oniba, Lagos State, Nigeria. Edith is a fashion designer and she also sells clothes to her customers. Edith has  sewing machines and  trainees under her supervision.  She learned this business for 2 years in a fashion home and she started her own business 10 years ago. she is a LAPO client.  She needs the loan amount of $1,200 to buy more clothes for sales. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sales

loans.name: Claudia Teodora

texts.es:
Claudia is an adoring mother of three, and is separated from her spouse. In spite of this she tries to meet the needs of her children alone, and they value their mother's efforts to give them an education. Because of this, Claudia leaves early in the morning for the hospital, where she has worked as a nutritionist for more than 27 years. Claudia is in charge of the menu for hospital patients. On finishing her shift, she goes to work at the recycling stand in the market, where she spends as much time as possible, especially on weekends and holidays. Claudia also spends her time selling beautify products, which she offers to clients and friends. In spite of these multiple efforts, Claudia isn't able to cover the costs of keeping a home, and above all to cover her children's university tuition. It is for this that Claudia is asking for a loan to invest in her recycling stand in order to satisfy the demand of her clients. We hope that you support this noble mother, who is fighting for the wellbeing of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia es madre D. 3 jovencitos a quienes adora, a pesar D. estar separada D. su esposo trata D. satisfacer soL., las necesidades D. sus hijos, quienes valoran el esfuerzo D. su madre para darles una educación. Así que Claudia desD. muy temprano sale rumbo al hospital D. L. ciudad donD. trabaja como nutricionista por ya más D. 27 años. ElL. está a cargo D. los alimentos D. las personas internas, al terminar se dirige a su puesto D. plásticos dentro del mercado D. su ciudad, al que se dedica el mayor tiempo posible, sobre todo los fines D. semana y en las ferias. Muy a L. par, también se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza, que ofrece a sus clientes y amigos. Sin embargo estas múltiples tareas y actividades no resuelven los diversos gastos en su hogar, sobre todo los requerimientos para los estudios D. sus hijos que ya están en L. universidad. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo para invertir en su plastiquería y satisfacer L. demanda D. sus clientes. Esperamos que apoyen a esta noble madre, que soL., lucha por el bienestar D. su hogar.

loans.use: Revamp her business in order to earn enough to cover the cost of university tuition for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Asha's Twaomba Salama. Group

texts.en:
Asha is 38 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 19, 17, 16 and 8 years old. She has been a food seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mtumwa, Asma, Mwanahawa, and Asha J. .

loans.use: To buy more food items to expand her business

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran K. is 37 years old. He is married with two children. His wife is a housekeeper and Imran is a market vendor selling shoes for men in the local market. After 13 years of working at the market, Imran already has enough experience to do his work successfully. He has clients who always buy from him and now he is trying to satisfy the needs of clients with various tastes and income levels. He works very hard to give his children a good education and to cover their basic needs.

Imran is planning to increase his working capital in order to purchase new winter shoes for selling. For this purpose, he has applied for $1200. He promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all for supporting him.

loans.use: to purchase new winter shoes for selling

loans.name: Sombo

texts.en: Mrs. Sombo S. is 59 year old laundry worker at the Phsa Thai Market in the province of Banteay Meanchey and earns around $3 per day. She is widowed with three children, two of whom are married, one stays in family’s home. Her son is motorcycle taxi driver and earns approximately $5 per day. Sombo lives in the Kbal Spean Village, Banteay Meanchey Province. Sambo needs a loan of $400 to purchase a new motorcycle instead existing old for her son’s business. Sambo's son is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle instead existing old for her son’s business

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Mrs. Va S. is 24 years old and is married with one child. She lives with her husband and young child and in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She works in security and earns US$2.5 a day. Her husband, Korn Saraket is 26 years old and operates a motorbike-taxi. He is able to earn US$4 a day.  

Mrs. Va S. is requesting a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband so that they can start owning and operating a motor-taxi service. (Her husband is pictured)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Hay C. is 34 years old and sells fruits in the Kampong Cham province. Her business has been around for about four years and she makes $6 US every day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. Her husband, Chhun Bunthoeun, 43, is a construction worker building houses. On average, he makes $6 US a day. Mrs. Hay C. is asking for a loan of $1200 US to make two investments. She would like to both invest $700 US to buy construction tools for her husband, and also put $500 US into her own fruit business, increasing her stock of fruits to sell. She sees these investments as opportunities that will be able to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To buy construction tools and more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Devotha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Devotha S. from Mwanza. She is separated with 3 children, between the ages of 10 and 17 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Devotha S. has been running a beauty saloon since 2005. This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by two employees.

Devotha S. currently earns about US$ 250 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to buy more women's long hair, cosmetics, and weave-ons for resale. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Devotha thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more women's long hair, cosmetics, weave-ons for re-sale

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Mrs. Hen L. lives in Chhoer Teal Phlos village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Keo Poy, helps her with her plantation. In this plantation, they face some problems because they do not have enough money to purchase rice seed, pesticides, fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work on their field.

In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Hen L. decided to ask for a loan for those purposes. She is 54 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a tailor while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, pesticides, fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work on their field

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Djiguiya est composé d’une veuve et de 4 femmes mariées dont deux polygames. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou. (4ème région administrative du Mali) où elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et dans le marché de Ségou Coura à partir de leurs activités Commerciales.
Elles font le commerce d’articles divers tels les condiments, les céréales et autres.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle il décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son 8ème prêt de groupe. Tous les sept précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter,  4 bassines de tomates fraîches dont une partie serait transformée en concentrée de tomate, 50kg de laye, 40 boites de tomate concentrée, 50kg d’oignon frais dont une partie serait torréfiée, 25kg de soumbala (condiment préparé à base de noix de néré et de la soja), 4 sacs de sel iodé, 4 cartons de cubes maggi ,4 sacs d’attiéké et 7 sacs de riz. Elles se ravitaillent en ces denrées alimentaires au grand marché de Ségou et lors des foires hebdomadaires. La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché de Ségou Coura à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de 35 835FCA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt et la prise en charges des dépenses des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Djiguiya is composed of a widow and four married women, including two who are polygamous. They live in the Bagadadji district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), where they know one another through marital and community ties and through their businesses at the Ségou Coura marketplace. They do commerce in various goods, such as condiments and grain.

To satisfy the needs of their customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which they are on their eighth group loan. All the preceding loans have been repaid without difficulty.

This loan will be used to buy: 4 tubs of fresh tomatoes, part of which would be processed into tomato paste; 50 kg of garlic; 40 cans of tomato paste; 50 kg of fresh onions, part of which would be roasted; 25 kg of soumbala (a condiment made from néré seeds and soybeans); 4 sacks of iodized salt; 4 boxes of Maggi cubes; 4 sacks of attiéké (dried fermented cassava), and 7 sacks of rice. The group members resupply themselves with these food items at the grand marketplace of Ségou and during the weekly fair. Sales are made at home and at the Ségou Coura marketplace to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

The group members hope to realize an average monthly profit of 35,835 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover the children’s expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments and grain

loans.name: María

texts.es: La señora María tiene 61 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su madre, su hija, su yerno y su nieto. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una línea cosmética por catálogo muy reconocida. Ella es una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es buscar clientes y la técnica para vender sus productos es dar una muy buena atención a las personas interesadas, eso es lo primordial nos dice. Este negocio le es rentable porque con el paso de los años se ha ganado una gran gama de clientes y sobre todo trabaja a pedidos, por lo que le va muy bien. Posteriormente le gustará poner una tienda de ropa. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, aun no sabe a fondo de cómo es el trabajo de un banco comunal, pero tiene muy buenas expectativas al respecto, además ha notado en sus compañeros responsabilidad. María invertirá la cantidad que requiere en la compra de productos de belleza, porque como vendedora le dejan a un precio especial, y no quiere desaprovechar esa oportunidad.
texts.en:
María is 61 years old, single, and lives with her mother, daughter, son-in-law, and grandson. For the past 10 years she has made her living selling beauty products from a well-known line of catalog cosmetics. She is a very active woman who dreams of succeeding. What she likes about her work is looking for customers, and her technique for selling her products is to provide good customer service to women who are interested in buying from her—that is crucial, according to María. This business is profitable for María because she has developed a large customer base over the years, and above all, because she takes custom orders. She eventually wants to set up a clothing store. This is the first time María has requested a loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she does not yet really know how a communal bank works. She does, however, have high expectations for it, since she has noticed that the other members of her bank are responsible. María will invest the amount she needs in purchasing beauty products, since a saleswoman is giving her a special price, and María does not want to miss out on this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her volume of merchandise

loans.name: Sakinaxanım

texts.en:
Sakinaxanım K., 55 years old and single, has been a teacher for her whole life. It is very hard to make a living on a teacher's salary alone and eight years ago she found that sewing can bring in a good income.

Sakinaxanım went to a special sewing and modeling school and successfully completed her courses. Now Sakinaxanım is a very popular seamstress in Sabirabad city. She not only makes the garments but also designs suits, dresses and other items for women.

Sakinaxanım enjoys her job and would like to open her own studio. She needs to purchase a modern sewing machine to speed up the whole sewing process since her orders are increasing every day. She has applied for a $1500 US loan. Let's do our best to help this brave and hardworking woman.

loans.use: To purchase a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
