Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.
Carmen es casada, tiene 55 años y 6 hijos, Carmen viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. frutas, verduras y D. las ferias compra cereales que luego comercializa en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Carmen venD. leña en su casa.
Carmen necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leña, cereales.
Los sueños D. Carmen son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Banco Comunal Renacer. She is 55 years old, married, and has 6 children. Carmen travels to the region's different fairs to sell fruits and vegetables. She also buys cereals from the fair, which she later sells at the provisions market in the city of Ayacucho. In addition to all this, Carmen also sells wool out of her house. Carmen needs a loan of 2,000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of wool and cereals. Carmen's dreams are to proviD. a good education to her children and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de leña, cereales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase items in bulk

loans.name: Ndena

texts.en:
L. is married and has six children. He has a farm in Atoukichum Mejang. There he plans to use his loan to farm lots of cocoa and plantain. Some of the loan will be used to cover the cost of transportation. 

This is L.’s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. At age 63 he has experience as a farmer. He says he has a successful operation because he “works hard toward the business”.

Having experienced death and illness in his family, along with poverty and stolen property, L. has lived a long life. Earning a profit from this loan will help him to pay for his children’s school fees, invest in the small business sector, do repairs on his house, as well as acquire some small equipment items for his house.

L. takes out GHAPE loans because he can make small, frequent payments to pay back the loan. Also, GHAPE has taught him how to better manage his money. 


About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Cocoa Seed, Plantain Suckers and Transport

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe D. is from the village of Sta. Felomina, Iligan City. She is 33 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.en:
Nicasio S. is from the village of Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. He is 37 years old. Nicasio is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nicasio owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari, or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products in the local community, such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. Nicasio has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nicasio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicasio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nicasio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Irmia

texts.en: Irmia M. owns and operates a general store.  She is selling a variety of different products to local communities.  She is 56 years old, married and blessed with three adult children.  She has had the store for 10 years now at San Isidro Bajo.  She earns an approximate income of PHP 2,500 per month from the business.  She joined Paglaum MPC and is now availing her first cycle loan.  The amount will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She desires to live comfortably and save for their future. She is hopeful too to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elva Rosalia

texts.es:
Elva es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad.
Elva es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 5 años, Elva tiene 3 carros con los cuales realiza transporte de carga a la ciudad de Vilcashuaman, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, además Elva vende abarrotes en la feria de Vilcashuaman y también reparte a tiendas.
Elva necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de combustible.
Los sueños de Elva son educar a sus hijos, ahorrar para su vejez y constituir una empresa de construcción.
texts.en:
Elva is a member of the Community Bank, 'Prosperidad' (Prosperity).

Elva lives with her partner and is 41 years old. She has 3 cars with which she transports heavy loads to the city of Vilcashuaman, an activity that she does together with her husband. Elva also sells groceries in the Vilcashuaman market as well as to shops.

Elva needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in buying fuel.

Elva dreams of educating her kids, saving for her old age and setting up a construction company.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fuel/Para la compra de combustible.

loans.name: Maria Glenda

texts.en:
Maria C., 46, is from the village of Poblacion, Clarin,Misamis Occidental. Maria is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a clothing business. Her main source of income comes from general clothing sales to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,600 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maria Glenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Maria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 1st from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase inventory, working capital

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 28 year old Mercy M.  from Mbozi. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 1 and 5. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant because he is an orphan. Mercy has been running a shop  business since 1999. Her business is purchasing and selling various commodities in her shop. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Mercy currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to open the same business at a new location. In the future, she plans to improve quality and range of products. Mercy thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To open the same business at new location

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Mr. Cornelio is married and has one small son. He dedicates himself to sale- he has sold tapioca for six years. He has his own house and protects his tapioca there. He wants to buy a piece of land where he can store his tapioca.
He wants a Vehicle to make even more capital, and works very hard. With the loan he plans to buy a tapioca in large cuantities.

loans.use: With the loan he plans to buy a tapioca in large cuantities.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Néstor P. tiene 20 años, y toda su vida se ha dedicado a la producción de leche y agricultura. Junto a su hermano menor ellos le dedican todo su tiempo al cuidado de la tierra y la de sus padres que ya están viejitos, ya que los papás poco o nada pueden hacer por ayudar en las tareas de la casa.

La madre de Néstor  Doña Cecilia, está enferma de los riñones además padece de reumatismo y no puede movilizarse por si misma. Néstor después de entregar la leche muy temprano al modulo de la zona, se va a sus clases, por que el esta estudiando agronomía en un instituto, el nos cuenta que esto mejorara la producción de sus tierras y de este modo poder salir adelante con su familia.

El préstamo el lo invertirá en la compra de una ordeñadora, con la cual espera mejorar la producción de la leche y la de sus ingresos, el sueño de Néstor es verla sana a su mamá y trabajar junto a ella en las tierras que lo vieron crecer y hacerse el hombre de bien que es ahora.
texts.en:
Néstor P. is 20 years old and has spent his whole life as a milk producer and farmer. He and his younger brother spend all their time cultivating the land since their parents are elderly and can no longer do much of the household chores. Néstor's mother, Doña Cecilia, has a kidney illness as well as rheumatism and cannot move unassisted. After delivering the milk to the local processing plant very early in the morning, Néstor goes to school where he is studying agronomy at an institute. He states that his studies will help him improve the production of his lands thereby helping to get his family ahead in life. The requested funds will be used to buy a milking machine so that milk production can be increased leading to higher proffits. Néstor's dream is to see his mother well again so that they can work the land that saw him grow into the good man he is now together.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milking machine.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre que a sus 51 años se da tiempo para trabajar y criar a su pequeña hija (Camila) de 6 años, con quien pasa sus días entre risas y juegos en su modesta casa ubicada al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Como buen padre trata de criar a su hija correctamente, aunque está separado de su pareja, hace lo posible por cumplir el rol de padre y madre. Además presta el servicio de taxi durante las mañanas y las tardes, hasta que su hija llega del colegio, pues en ese momento debe atenderla y ayudarla con sus tareas. 
Hace 15 años que empezó a dedicarse a este oficio porque sabía manejar autos y le pareció que podría ser muy fácil, pero el tiempo le ha demostrado que todo trabajo merece esfuerzo, y hoy tiene un doble esfuerzo porque el ser padre es una gran obligación de la cual jamás escapó, por lo contrario adora los momentos que pasa con la niña de sus ojos. 
A Juan le gusta salir a taxear en horas punta, pues le es muy rentable. Con este trabajo no tiene problemas económicos y le alcanza el dinero para vivir cómodamente al lado de su pequeña. Sabe que debe dar lo mejor de sí, es por eso que tiene planeado para el futuro comprar un auto más y brindarlo en alquiler, porque su mayor preocupación es la educación y el futuro de su hija, además ella es el motor que lo impulsa a seguir trabajando diariamente.

Este es su sétimo préstamo con MFP y será responsable como en las anteriores ocasiones, ya que ese es el principal valor que le inculcaron desde niño. Le dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la reparación de su auto, para brindar seguridad a los diversos pasajeros que moviliza.
texts.en:
Juan is a 51-year old man who spends his time working and caring for his small 6-year old daughter (Camila), with whom he passes his days between smiles and games in his modest house located to the south of the city of Lima. As a good parent, he tries to raise his daughter correctly. Although he is separated from his partner, he does everything he can to fulfill the role of both father and mother. He offers his taxi service during the mornings and afternoons, until his daughter arrives from school. At that point he must attend to her and help her with her homework. It has been 15 years since he began in this trade, because he knew how to drive an automobile, and it seemed to him that it would be quite easy. But over time he has found that all work takes effort, and now he has to double his efforts because to be a father is a big commitment from which one can never escape. On the contrary, he loves the time he spends with the apple of his eye. Juan likes to go out with his taxi during peak hours, when it is very profitable. With this work, he does not have economic problems and he is able to raise enough money to live comfortably with his daughter. He knows that he must give his best, and for this reason he is planning to buy another car in the future and offer it for rent. His main concern is for the education and future of his daughter. In addition, she is the engine that drives him to continue working daily. This is his seventh loan with MFP and he will be responsible as in the previous occasions, since this is a principal value that was instilled in him from the time he was a child. The money that he is requesting now will be invested in the repair of his auto, to provide security to the various passengers that he transports.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair his auto

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is very hardworking; every single day, she makes sure that her family gets fed properly. She is 30 years old, married and has two children. She sells all kinds of drinks and food items. She has been a LAPO client for five years and has good record. She hopes to expand her business in future. She is requesting a loan of N 100,000; she will use the money to purchase more drinks and food items in bulk in other to make more profit and enhance her family's standard of living. Her children are doing well in school; her heart's desire is to educate them.

loans.use: purchasing more drinks and food items

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a constructor working in this field since 1980. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his 4 children's needs. Today, Hussein is asking for a loan of US$ 1,000 to buy wood and tools needed for his business.

loans.use: buy wood and tools

loans.name: Yeadze

texts.en: Yeadze is twenty-nine years old. She is married has given birth to one child who is in school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Yeadze is a trader in jewelry. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Yeadze has been in business for three years and would like to expand her business. She wants the loan to procure many kinds of jewelry – earrings, necklace, etc. in bulk.

loans.use: To buy jewelry.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy O. is 40 years old and is married with four children. Her husband works for a company to support the home.

Christy sells garri (cassava flakes) in a major market in Benin City. She says she expects her business to grow larger from the profits derives from her business. She therefore hopes to improve the standard of living in her home.

Christy is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more garri to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Christy is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more garri to sell

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 35, married, and the mother of two children aged 17 and 20 years. Both her children go to school and she takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a one-roomed house where she is staying with three people. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. Harriet has a stall frying chapatti (flat bread) and samosas (pastries). She incurs transport costs to and from buying wheat flour and cooking oil and peas. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala

Harriet works seven days a week .She receives an average of 30 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and monthly market dues for her business and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges are transportation of boxes of wheat and jerrycans of cooking oil.

Harriet has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for seven years, servicing her fourteenth loan, working with the same group mates. Harriet joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of cooking oil and cartons of baking flour. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting a bakery.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of cooking oil and cartons of baking flour

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora S. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Nora is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Nora owns and operates a business operating a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as noodles, shampoo, candies, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Nora has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Nora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Nora is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of forest products and preparation of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Young Traders Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Young Traders' group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,400,000 from Kiva lenders for the second time. With the help of their previous Kiva loan, these entrepreneurs were able to expand their businesses, made more profit and consequently improved their living conditions.

On the left in the photo is Ibraham P. who is the leader of this group. Ibraham is age 36. He was born in Freetown, is married to a businesswoman, and they have 3 children together. Two of their children are in primary school and one is still very young. Ibraham started business 2 years ago. He sells market food – rice, oil, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), tomatoes, etc. With his share of this loan, Ibraham will buy rice, oil, Maggi, and tomatoes wholesale.

loans.use: Buy rice, oil, Maggi cubes and tomatoes wholesale

loans.name: Kamu Kamu D Nakasi Winnie Group

texts.en: N. Winnie is an encouraging businesswoman of thirty-three years old, a single mother of three children, all going to school. She is looking after one orphan (girl) who is schooling, too. She runs a restaurant business which she has been operating for over twelve years. She is using the loan to purchase restaurant items such as a variety of food like bananas, maize flour for 'posho', rice, cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and so forth to prepare food for her customers. She is a hard-working businesswoman whose dreams are to expand her restaurant business, build a house, and educate the children.

loans.use: To purchase restaurant items such as  bananas, maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en: It is delightful to see people striving to improve their living conditions. Probably the main factor driving these people to go forward is the sole conviction of these people that they deserve something better in this life than to just obtain allowances from Government and wait for better times. Maybe another factor which makes these people different from the crowd is their feeling of responsibility for the future of their children. They feel themselves responsible for building a decent life for the sake of the wellbeing of their children. Aigul T., the leader of this group, is forty-three years old and is divorced. She has a daughter who has turned twenty-one and who works in a private company, obtaining a salary of $60. Aigul trades in vegetables at the market and her income is somewhere around $175 a month. During summertime her daughter helps her in the business. Aigul started selling vegetables fifteen years ago. During this time she has been able to buy a two-room flat (apartment) and see her daughter married. Aigul wants to expand her assortment of vegetables and therefore decided to apply for this loan. One of her future plans is to send her daughter to college. Aigul’s partners are: Cholpon O., 41, is the mother of two children, both of whom go to school. Her husband is retired and receives a pension. She works as a teacher and also trades in cosmetics, selling to her colleagues at school. She needs a loan to increase her turnover. Damira A., 41, has four daughters. Her husband provides welding services while Damira stays at home with a child. She and her husband have been able to buy a house, even though their salaries are not so high. Now Damira needs a loan to buy a circular. Juma M., 51, is a taxi-driver. He manages to earn two to three dollars a day. His spouse is a housewife and they have two children. His elder son is also a driver, working in the capital. Juma needs a loan, as he plans to buy a battery. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To expand her assortment of vegetables

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 40-year-old, hardworking lady. She sells clothes and shoes in her hometown to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years now.  She says that she has a high turnover since she has a good customer base because of her good customer-care skills.  

She has joined a group in Faulu Kenya called Tushikane P., which enables the members to access loans guaranteed by the group. She hopes to grow her business and improve her living standards now that she can access loans. This is her first loan.  

Her wish is to see her children go through college and be professionals. Her customers have different tastes of fashion and designs and she is not able to meet their demands due to her limited capital. She has therefore requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, to add stock of clothes and shoes.

In the photo, she is the one looking up with a shoe in her hand; the other people are her customers.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes and shoes for sale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 26-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is a single man who lives with his parents. Mohamad has been working as a plumber since 2003. In order to improve his business, he wants to buy tools for his work. 

Mohamad is happy with his work and proud of the service quality that he provides. When he first started his business, he had difficulty making himself known. Once his customers were satisfied, however, they started telling each other about him and this allowed him to increase his number of clients. In the future, he is hoping to further expand his business. 

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, to buy tools and electrical wires to help grow his business. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

loans.use: To buy tools and electrical wires.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose K. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts (peanuts) and simsim (sesame seed) at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of groundnuts to sell. Rose is 31 years old and is married to a nurse. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim, a very caring lady and a citizen of Multan, Pakistan, famous for its sweetmeats and sacred places, has owned and lived in a small two-room house with her family for over 15 years. She does domestic sewing in order to bear the financial burden with her husband, a milk shop employee who earns a small income by selling milk.

As the inflation rate steadily increases, their earnings become insufficient to meet the family's financial needs. Therefore, Shamim is requesting a loan from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan) to buy a buffalo for her husband so he can start his own milk-selling business, hopeful that the enterprise will enhance her family's earnings, enabling them to overcome their financial problems.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo to start a milk-selling business

loans.name: Anastasio

texts.es:
El señor Anastasio tiene  33 años y tiene tres hijos.  Anastasio trabaja como porteador,  es el de llevar durante todo el viaje del camino Inca al Santuario de Machupicchu el equipaje del grupo ( carpas , cocina , utensilios , guía , alimentación , equipo , sillas , mesas , etc.). 
El recorrido se hace durante cuatro noches y tres días, él carga aproximadamente 20 kilos de carga y 5 kilos de carga personal. Muy temprano por la mañana sale de su casa para dirigirse al kilómetro 82 donde se encontrara con el equipo profesional de viaje. Para luego dar inicio a la caminata. El primer día llegará al complejo arqueológico de llactapata, lugar donde almorzará para luego continuar hasta el primer campamento en Wayllabamba en donde pasaran la noche después de una reparadora cena. El segundo día después de desayunar darán inicio a la parte más difícil de la caminata pero no imposible, en donde caminaran hacia el punto más alto del Camino que esta aprox. a 4,200 m.s.n.m. Después almorzarán para luego continuar descendiendo hasta llegar a Pacaymayo en donde cenarán y pasarán la noche. El tercer día después de desayunar empezaran a caminar hasta ascender  al complejo arqueológico de Runkarakay y al complejo arqueológico de Puyupatamarca, donde almorzarán, después de un breve descanso continuaremos con la caminata hasta llegar al último campamento Wiñay Huayna (siempre joven) y cenarán y pasaran la última noche. Cuatro día después de desayunar, continuaran con la caminata muy temprano para llegar a Machupichu. 
Anastasio pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la asociación Arariwa y requiere el préstamo para implementar su casa.
texts.en:
Anastasio is 33-years-old and has three children. Anastasio works as a porter, carrying luggage on the Incan Trail to the Machu Picchu Sanctuary for groups (tents, kitchen utensils, guide, food, equipment, chairs, tables, etc.)... The tour is for four nights and three days, he carries approximately 20 kilos of cargo and five kilos of personal items. He leaves his house very early in the morning to go to kilometer 82 where he meets with the professional team for the trip. Then they begin the walk. The first day they arrive at the Llactapata archaeological complex, the place where they eat lunch before continuing to the first campsite in Wayllabamba where they pass the night after a refreshing dinner. The second day, after breakfast, they begin the most difficult (but not impossible) part of the walk where they walk to the highest point of the trail that is approximately 4200 meters above sea level. After lunch, they continue descending until they arrive in Pacaymayo where they eat dinner and pass the night. The third day, after breakfast, they begin to ascend toward the Runkarakay and Puyupatamarca archaeological complexes where they eat lunch. After a brief rest, they continue walking to the final campsite, Winay Huayna (Always Young) and eat dinner and pass the final night. On the fourth day, after breakfast, they continue walking early in the morning to arrive in Machu Picchu. Anastasio belongs to the communal bank “Villa Rayanniyoc” of the Arariwa association and he needs the loan to build his home.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build his house.

loans.name: Deomida

texts.en:
Deomida C. is from the town of Talibon. She is 62 years old. Deomida is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Deomida owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Deomida has been engaged in her business for over 6 years. She dreams of her businss prospering.

Deomida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Deomida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Deomida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Deomida from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rutendere Women's, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Maurice T. operates a 4 year old garment sales business in Butogota trading centre, while selling clothes in monthly and weekly markets in the area, earning 360,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis. This has inspired her more in her business.

Having noticed the prevailing market in the area from local occupants and travelers, she started a clothes business. It is for this reason that she wants to get this loan to improve her financial prospects in terms of restocking her business with attractive materials and more bales of clothes.
 
By her own account, the future of her business is promising and this will see her earn more revenue as she manages to maintain her customers by doing timely shopping for them. With the loan she wants to purchase more garments to give her business a new lease on life, which will improve her sales revenue and enable her to take care of her family.

Maurice belongs to a group of members who insure and hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel N. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Manghanoy, La Castellana, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating two business ventures, a general Store and a pig fattening business. Her husband Melvin, who is 40 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are aged one to 15 years old. 

Ritchel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,500 PHP, thus uplifting her family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 21st cycle loan, she is borrowing 49,500 PHP, with which she intends to purchase more stock for her sari-sari store (a neighborhood general store) so that she can continue to save up for the future and the education of her children.  Ritchel is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock for a small general store.l

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 48 year old married woman and mother of 4 children. Sanaa works at home selling clothes and Mouneh (traditional rice-stuffed, preserved vegetables). This is Sanaa’s 6th cycle with Al Majmoua. Her previous loans helped in improving her social situation greatly. She did the necessary maintenance to her house and she bought a car. This time Sanaa is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes from Turkey, to increase her capital and to add new collections for the winter season. Her clients can be anyone, as her products are suitable for everyone. Her long experience in preparing Mouneh made her client-base increase. She hopes to open a store in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes from Turkey, to increase her capital.

loans.name: Wilfrido Alejandro

texts.es:
Wilfrido de 56 años, tiene una tienda de víveres, vive en una casa de caña y cemento ubicada en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales.

Cuando la esposa falleció el comenzó a comprar mercadería para tener una pequeña tienda de víveres ya que se sentía solo en su casa. Poco a poco surtió su pequeña tienda y la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

El quiere surtir mas su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, bebidas, azúcar etc. En el futuro quiere tener mas arreglado su negocio para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Wilfrido is 56 years old and he has a grocery store. He lives in a house made of cane sticks and cement and it is located in Fortin de Guyaquil, a region known for its unpaved roads and its vendors. When his wife passed away, he decided to purchase merchandise to set up a small grocery store to keep himself from feeling so alone. He gradually increased the variety in his store, located in the front section of his house. He works from 6am to 9pm every day. He would like to stock his store, for which reason he requests a loan. He will purchase rice, soft drinks, sugar etc. In the future he hopes to have a better equipped business, to secure his old age.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, sugar, rice.

loans.name: Tulia Esther

texts.es:
El negocio que tiene Tulia A. de 54 años de edad  en Santa Elena, un barrio al sur de Barranquilla, es su gran bendición familiar, porque con sus utilidades ha logrado llevar a su hija a niveles superiores de educación y por eso hoy es una enfermera profesional, laboralmente ubicada en la ciudad de Ibagué y también desde allí apoya su gestión Comercial 
Tulia Inició su actividad hace 9 años, comercializando ropa que compra en la ciudad de Medellín y  vende a crédito   a clientes en la ciudad de Barranquilla. En la actualidad tiene 8 años de ser cliente de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la ha apoyado en el fortalecimiento de su negocio a través de 8 financiamientos, formándola  empresarialmente y adquiriendo buenas relaciones pues ha conocido muchas personas que la han ayudado y el mejor ejemplo es que su hija pudo realizar sus prácticas profesionales en el departamento de Amazonas por razones de esta cadena de buena conexión. En la actualidad solicita su credikiva porque adicionará calzado, pues abrió un nuevo mercado en Ibagué y tiene pedidos con los cuales rotará mas rápido su cartera, aprovechando la época de primas y bonificaciones a fin de año, especialmente con los  clientes que tiene en diversos sectores  de la ciudad. Su  sueño ampliar su negocio mediante su gestión y los financiamientos que proyecta tener a futuro con la Fundación, organización que ha trascendental para su mejor desempeño productivo, relacionado con nuevos clientes y capital de trabajo adicional para responder sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Tulia A., age 54, lives in Santa Elena, a neighborhood to the south of Baranquilla.  Her business is a great family blessing because with its profits she has managed to give her daughter a higher education.  Her daughter is now a nurse who works in the city of Ibaqué.  That is also where she supports her business efforts.

Nine years ago Tulia started her activity by selling clothes that she bought in the city of Medellín.  She sells the clothes on credit to customers in the city of Barranquilla.  She has been a client of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for eight years.  This organization has supported her in strengthening her business with eight loans.  It also helped shape her as a businesswoman, and it has helped her acquire good relationships.  She has known many people who have been helped.  The best example is that her daughter was able to do her professional training in the Amazonas department because of the network of good connections.

She is currently requesting a Kiva loan because she will start selling footwear.  A new market in Ibaqué opened.  She has orders, which will make her money turn over more quickly.  She will be taking advantage of the end of the year payments and bonuses, especially with the customers she has in diverse sectors of the city.  

Her dream is to expand her business through her efforts and the future loans she plans to have with the Fundación.  This organization has been of great significance in improving her productive performance, her connection with new customers, and increasing her working capital in order to fill her orders.

loans.use: To buy clothes and footwear that has been ordered

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem C., 27, is a professional scarf weaver. She weaves and sells scarves in her local market in Takeo province. She is married with two children, who still live at home, and her husband sells banana ice cream. She typically makes about US$2.50 each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for US$1000 to raise pigs and cows.

loans.use: To raise pigs.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Teresa actualmente se desempeña como conserje en el Centro de Salud de dicho caserío donde tiene 20 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y zinc con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Mrs Teresa currently works as a janitor in the  town's Health Centre.  She has been working there for 20 years.  This is her first loan from Ceprodel and she will use it to buy bricks, cement, sand and corrugated metal sheeting to improve her home.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand and corrugated metal sheeting

loans.name: Reynaldo De Jesus

texts.es: Reynaldo De Jesús tiene 23 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa en tienda. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que no ha sido fácil mantener este negocio, el ha sido un padre muy responsable y dedicado. Su mama tenía cierta experiencia con este tipo de negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes son sus amigos, vecinos y público en general el está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Reynaldo solicita este crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas formales, vestidos, trajes para damas y caballeros entre otras pues se acerca la temporada navideña y tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Reynaldo De Jesús is 23 years old.  He sells clothes in a store.  He has had this business for over five years.  It has not been easy to maintain this business.  He has been a very responsible and dedicated father.  His mother has experience in this type of business.

Most of his customers are friends, neighbors, and the general public.  He is always concerned about his customers’ needs.  

Reynaldo is requesting a loan to buy pants, formal shirts, dresses, and suits for women and men, among others.  The Christmas season is coming, and he has a lot of orders.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Joseph Gatoto

texts.en:
Joseph is 26 years old, married to Eunice Mbaire and has one child. He has been selling milk around Naivasha town for the last three years. He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid back his first loan well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to open a permanent milk bar instead of going round selling his milk.
In the future, Joseph hopes to own a large dairy farm in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To open a permanent milk bar

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and electricity. 

She has operated a beauty salon for the past year. Neighbors and passersby are her potential customers. Elizabeth faces the major challenge of theft in her business. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase packets of hair weaves and chemicals for her beauty shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase packets of hair weaves and chemicals for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Edwin Jonathan

texts.es:
Edwin Jonathan C. V. tiene 19 años, Es soltero, vive con los padres en  el  Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. No tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Edwin Jonathan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Edwin Jonathan C. V. is 19 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

The members of the SAN JACINTO community bank are located in Campo Alegre precinct, in Guare parish, in Baba canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Edwin Jonathan is a farmer.   He grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in the Cepeda shopping area and sells his products in López shopping area.

Edwin Jonathan is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a plot of land.

He likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena E. is from the village of Mialen Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Elena is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Elena has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Joysie

texts.en:
At her age, 43 years old, Joysie never feels tired of doing things to make money for their everyday living. Her husband, Roberto, sometimes gives her some money from his salary as an OFW (Overseas Contract Worker). However, Joysie does not stop there because she knows her children need her support to achieve their own dreams in life. That’s why she decided to join and borrow from Kiva's field partner, Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), for the secured capital that she needs for her rice sales. 

Her business is operating but Joysie needs additional funds to expand her business. She wants to increase the stock of rice that she sells in her house. This will make her business grow. Joysie has a simple dream:  ensuring her family does not experience hardship will make her happy. That’s why she will never get tired of helping them, even in little ways. If her dreams come true, Joysie also hopes to extend her helping hand to others – most especially her relatives who also need support. Joysie is very glad for the inspiration and encouragement, which give her the strength to continue dreaming for the best in life.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice that she sells in her home

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: doña María R. jiron es trabajadora de Enacal Masaya, ella vive en el costado este del parque de Masaya, ella quiere el dinero para mejora de vivienda
texts.en: Mrs. Maria R. Jiron is an Enaca Masaya worker and lives in the East side of the Masaya Park. She is requesting a loan to upgrade her house.

loans.use: Housing upgrade

loans.name: Ouy

texts.en:
Ouy C. is 32 and lives with her husband and one young child in Takeo Province. To earn a living, she makes baskets at home and sells them, typically making a profit of U.S. $2.50 each day.  Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver at the local market, and earns U.S. $4 per day.

Ouy C. will use this loan of U.S. $700 to buy a new motorbike for her husband, whose existing motorcycle is old and unreliable.  In the photo that accompanies this profile, Ouy C. is pictured with her husband at their home.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Great Hope Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: 36-year-old Joan N. runs a cosmetics sales business in Kirinya trading center in Mukono. This business appeals mostly to middle class ladies who she says are regular users of the cosmetics she brings to sell. This happily married mother of one says her sister's advice was pivotal in getting her started. Before that she was running a small drug sales business. Joan says her determination and diligence have gotten her this far. Monthly this business generates her about $50 and she says with this loan she is going to purchase more cosmetics to resell. Joan is affiliated to Great hope Development Group-Mukono.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita T. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old, married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Lolita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and junk foods. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and junk foods

loans.name: Anetou

texts.fr: Agée de 41ans, Mme Aneto est revendeuse de jus de fruit. Mariée à un chauffeur, elle est mère de 03 enfants.  Elle est dans l’activité cela fait 11ans. Elle achète les matières premières au Grand marché de Lomé après transformation en jus elle les vend à son domicile. Madame Aneto veut assurer l’avenir de ses enfants c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce troisième prêt pour acheter les matières premières (arome, sucre, citron…) afin de réaliser plus de profit.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anetou sells fruit juices. She is 41 years old, married to a driver, and the mother of three children. She started this activity 11 years ago. She buys her supplies at the grand market of Lomé, and after making the juice, she sells it from her home. 

Mrs. Anetou wants to provide for her children’s future, which is why she is seeking this third loan. She will buy the necessary supplies (extract, sugar, lemon, etc.) to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy extract, sugar, and lemon

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Apolinaria is 51 years old.  She has an egg business in the Philippines. Apolinaria requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a larger stock of eggs to sell in her stall.

Apolinaria has been in the business for 16 years.  In the future, Apolinaria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs to sell in her stall

loans.name: Quintilion Group

texts.en:
Hashim S., who is in his early 20s, is married with one small baby girl. He has been running a mobile-telephone business for three years now. He works from 6:30 to 10:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Hashim's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his supply of telephone spare parts, telephone housings and furniture. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy more equipment for mobile-telephone sales. 

Hashim will share this loan with his loan group, "Quintilion," which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Hashim is in the back in a white-and-black striped shirt.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for mobile-telephone sales.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Soledad; ella tiene 19 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas como naranjas, mandarinas, pomelos y limones, ella trae de lugares como Quillabamba y también lo vende en los distritos de Calca, Cusco y Pisaq y también la socia se está preparando para estudiar la carrera de contabilidad, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de fruta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar fruta como mandarinas, naranjas y pomelos. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Soledad, 19, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

She is single.  She alternates her daily chores with the sale of fruit like oranges, mandarins, grapefruit and lemons that she brings from places like Quillabamba and sells in Calca, Cusco and Pisaq Districts.  She is also getting ready to start studying Accounting.  She wants to enlarge the fruit selling business and is asking for a loan to buy fruit like mandarins, oranges and grapefruit.

She is happy about the loan and committed to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Luis Arnulfo

texts.es: Luís tiene su actividad que es brindar el servicio de molino. Tiene más 22 años en su negocio,  inicio por cuenta propia que fue muy difícil porque no tenía el capital suficiente, pero a pesar de esto solicito un financiamiento que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos para su actividad. El crédito será utilizado para proporcionarle mantenimiento a los molinos, pintarlos y acondicionar el lugar. El sueño de Luis es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Luís' business is providing a milling service.  He has been in this business for more than 22 years.  He started on his own initiative and it was very difficult because he didn't have enough capital.  However, in spite of this, he requested a loan which would help him to cover his business expenses.  

Luís will use this loan to carry out maintenance work on his mills, paint them and also fit out his premises.  Luís' dream is to continue growing in his business.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance work on his mills, paint them and also to fit out his premises

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som lives in the province of Siem Reap. She is a foreman construction worker, earning a profit of around US $4 each day. She has a life partner in her husband who is a chief and a construction worker. This young couple works together in the same occupation. They always use their motorbike to go to their workplace and to ride anywhere in and around their village. Their motorbike has broken down and they often spend a lot of money to repair it. Therefore, Mrs. Som is seeking a loan of $700 to buy a new motorbike to replace the broken one so that they won’t have to pay for repairs any more.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 31 años, es soltero vive con sus hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos Katiuska de 9 años y Luis de 7 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz y arroz.


Luis  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol,  Compra sus productos en el Comercial Peña y vende en el mercado mayorista de ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, frejol y cacao,  compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría a superarse económicamente y  mejorar su producción. Su sueño es comprar una finca pequeña.

Le gusta conversar.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 31 years old, single, and lives with his children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. He has two children, Katiuska (age 9) and Luis (age 7).

The members of the Communal Bank “Valle Alto” meet in the neighborhood of Voluntad de Dios in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Luis is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. He buys his products at the Peña Commericial Center and sells at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing corn, rice, beans, and cacao, as well as fertilizers for these crops. With the support of this loan, he will be able to excel financially and improve his production. His dream is to buy a small farm.

Luis enjoys making conversation.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine has been a farmer in her home area of Kitale in Western Kenya for 19 years and currently employs one farmhand. Her farm produces maize, beans, milk and vegetables. She runs a transport business as well as low cost rental houses. She is married with 8 children, five of whom are still in school.

Christine has made a loan request amounting to 100,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a poultry shed and purchase the poultry birds for her new venture. She says the business will act as the source of food and provide school fees for the education of the children. She aspires to be a breeder of both dairy and poultry

She concurs with other farmers that the running cost for diseases is a great challenge.

loans.use: to pay for construction of poultry unit and buy poultry birds

loans.name: Sam Onn

texts.en:
Sam onn (pictured with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband, Vannak is now a construction worker. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2003, and have two young children, a son and a daughter. 

Sam onn is requesting a loan of 200 USD to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary lives in Uganda. She is single and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (three nephews and nieces). 
Rosemary has a business of selling African batiks and clothing. She has been in this business for eight years, and works six days out of every week.  Rosemary sells her products in a retail shop. Rosemary has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy rolls of fabric (batticks and other cloth). 
She generates additional income through a pub. Rosemary's main business challenges include bad debtors, thieves and seasonality of her sales. Her goals and aspirations for the business are to buy sewing machines to make designs and also to own a tailoring school. 
Rosemary lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of baticks and other African cloth.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 32 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to buy a plot.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with seven children, both of whom attend school.  They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her monthly expenses are school fees and clothing for the family.

For the past four years, Saumu has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumptions to neighbors and passersby. Saumu faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing goods in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and having her own shop.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 27-year-old married woman from the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She has 2 children aged 4 and 9. 

Rowena’s husband runs a transport business.

Rowena is in the business of raising hogs. She has a backyard piggery. 

She plans to use her loan to buy more piglets and feed.  Rowena hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Mavjuda's Group

texts.en:
Mavjuda is the leader of this group. She is 37 and brings up a son and a daughter; both children study at school. Her husband works in Russia; each month he transfers 5000 soms to meet the family's needs. Three years ago, with an initial investment of 10000 soms, Mavjuda started to sell materials. At the moment her business runs well. She is applying for a loan to purchase more fabrics and materials to increase the commodity turnover of her business. In the future she wishes to expand her business and then save money to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a hardworking business man aged 35. He is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the past three years, he has been renting houses to bring up his family. He is also employed. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his house renting business. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to renovate the houses.

loans.use: to renovate the houses

loans.name: Saiyohatkhon

texts.ru: Саёхатхон замужем имеет двоих несовершеннолетних детей. Чтобы содержать семью и помогать мужу она на рынке продает детскую одежду. Полученную прибыль она тратить на содержание семьи и на обучение детей. Дети учатся в школе. Часть прибыли тратит на расширение товарооборота. К каждому сезону следует обновлять и пополнять ассортимент товаров. Саёхатхон хочет получить займ и пополнить товар зимней детской одеждой. Она надеется на получение займа и благодарна вам.
texts.en: Saiyohatkhon is married and has two children, both under 18 years of age. To support her family and help her husband, she sells children's clothes at the market. She uses the money she makes to support her family and on the children's education. Her children go to school. Some of the money she makes is used to increase turnover. Ahead of every season, the selection of clothing must be updated and additional stock purchased. Saiyohatkhon would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional inventory of children's winter clothes. She hopes to receive her loan and is grateful to you.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for retail

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 51 years old and lives in Looc, Maria, Siquijor. She is married with four children.

Gertrudes has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Gertrudes has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for six years. In the future, Gertrudes hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Milagro De Dios Group

texts.es: Reyna Elizabeth con sus amigas Priscila, Fidelina, Rosa Elizabeth, Evelia, Celina, Francisca, y Sayda conforman el banco solidario Milagro De Dios. Ellas son personas responsables que disfrutan de tener este medio de vida. En el caso de Reyna ella se dedica a la venta de sopa. Ella inicio este medio de vida por su Mama quien le enseño a tener este medio de vida y así Reyna pudiera obtener un medio de ingreso para su hogar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de verduras, carnes, cucharas, tasas entre otros. Juntas han decidido realizar este crédito con el fin de mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Reyna Elizabeth and her friends Priscila, Fidelina, Rosa Elizabeth, Evelia, Celina, Francisca and Sayda make up the “Milagro de Dios” (God’s Miracle) communal bank.  They are responsible people who enjoy having this way of earning a living. 

In Reyna’s case, she sells soup.  She started this way of life thanks to her mother who taught her this occupation so that Reyna could have a way of earning household income.

The reason for this loan is to buy vegetables, meats, spoons and cups, among others.  Together they have decided to take out this loan in order to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, spoons and cups.

loans.name: Hamro

texts.ru: Хамро 40 – летний женатый мужчина. Он проживает в городе Худжанд. У него двое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. При доме у него имеется участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и сеет зернобобовые культуры. Кредит берет для посева овощей.
texts.en: Hamro is a 40 year old married man. He lives in the town of Khujand. He has five children. He has secondary education. Hamro has a plot of land by his house where he grows vegetables and sows legumes. He is taking out the loan to sow vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is from the village of Kolagi in the Gurjaani District. He is 45 years old, married, and lives with his family: his wife, Nana, their 18-year-old daughter, and 14-year-old son. The children go to school. 

Gia has a tractor. He provides tilling services to the farmers in his and nearby villages. It is the main source of income for the family. Along with the tractor, the family owns 0.1 hectare land, where peach trees grow. The family sells peaches in the local market. The family's total average monthly income is 800 Laris (GEL). 

Gia requested this loan to purchase mowing equipment, which will be fixed to the tractor. After purchasing the aforementioned equipment, Gia will provide not only tilling, but also mowing services to his client farmers. It will increase family's income. Gia plans to use the additional income to purchase additional parts for the tractor in order to diversify the services provided to his clients.

loans.use: to purchase mowing equipment.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 43-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi-Amman, Jordan, and is a mother of three children.
Eman is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase blankets, accessories and make-up for trading purposes. Eman aspires to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase blankets, accessories and make-up for trading purposes.

loans.name: Aminata Issa

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Aminata Issa. She is married and has four children who are 21, 17, 14 and 10 years old. Three of them are school-going children. 

In 1992, Aminata Issa established her business by working seven days a week and 11 hours a day. She earns about SLL 6,667,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Aminata Issa has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cartons of cosmetics and attachments. 

Aminata Issa did not succeed in building the house, but was able to acquire land, pay her daughters school fees and settle other domestic problems. She also set up a business for her son. Aminata encountered a problem of an accident when repaying her previous loan. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of cosmetics and attachments.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes owns a small diner where she makes breakfast and lunch. She started the business in light of the struggling financial situation she found her husband in. With a small amount of capital, she was able to rent a location for her business and invest in rice, eggs and other ingredients for her meals.

Lourdes needs the loan in order to make improvements to her business. With her previous loan she was able to buy many more ingredients and offer a more diverse menu. She is now looking to also invest in a new freezer for her business.

Lourdes is 46 years old and has 5 children. Only her daughter who is 11 lives with her because she goes to school. Her husband now works and helps support the household. Her dream is to allow her daughter to finish high school and possibly attend college.

loans.use: Lourdes needs the loan in order to make improvements to her business.

loans.name: Delvina

texts.en: Delvina runs two charcoal stores.  She has spent more than seven years in this business. Delvina is very strategic; all her stores are located at places where they fetch a good number of customers. She wants to increase the size of her two stores and open another store on an adjacent street. Her expansion plan needs funding. From her own savings, Delvina can only finance 20% of the plan. The remaining portion of the funding needs to come from lenders. Delvina is in need of USD 750 to implement her plan.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon O. is in a group of 25 widows who have been contracted to supply fertilized eggs to a hatching project in Ugunja. Upon succesfully supplying the eggs, they will be loaned chicks to rear and supply eggs once more to the same project. Sharon has repaid a loan of 25 USD. She would like another loan of 140 USD, enabling her to increase the population of her fowls, thus increasing the supply of fertilized eggs to the hatching project. Fertilized eggs, in addition, are recommended for people living with HIV /AIDS, and all of the group members are living positively. This loan will ensure that she meets her basic needs.

loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify the business.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil A. lives in Beylagan. He is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children. He owns a tea-house in the middle of Beylagan. Kamil established this business many years ago, and by now the chairs and tables in the tea-house are very old. To attract more clients to his tea-house, Kamil wants to buy new tables and chairs and has therefore asked the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of US$500.

loans.use: Purchase of  tables

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando is married; his wife is a homemaker and they have 2 children who are 6 and 4, respectively. He has always been a hard worker, someone who started at an early age helping his family with their clothing business and contributing his earnings to them from the time he was 15. When he married, his expenses increased and he had to strike out on his own to build a business that would support his own family. With the help of his father, he started his own clothing-sales business and his wife helped him in her spare time. His business has grown little by little but he wants to continue to grow in order to give his young children a good education and a better quality of life.

Fernando is asking for a US$750 loan to buy merchandise for his business so that he can continue to grow it. He offers to repay the loan in 6 months. He and his family are very grateful for the support you are providing to help them get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Fernando es un hombre casado y su esposa se dedica a su hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años respectivamente, él es un hombre muy trabajador, que empezó desde chico ayudando a su familia que también se dedicaba a la venta de ropa y el desde los 15 años estuvo apoyándolos, cuando se caso sus gastos se incrementaron y tuvo que independizarse y tener un negocio para poder mantener a su familia, así con la ayuda de su padre, empezó con la venta de ropa por su cuenta y su esposa le ayuda en sus ratos libres , y como sabe del negocio lo ha hecho crecer poco a poco, pero desea continuar creciendo para poder brindarles a sus pequeños hijos una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida.

Fernando solicita un préstamo por US $ 750 para poder surtir su negocio y comprar mercadería y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia están muy agradecidos por tu apoyo ayudándolo a salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Gloria Rosa

texts.en:
Up until a couple of years ago, Gloria helped her fisherman husband by taking care of their home and family. However, her husband has now retired and the meager retirement benefits he receives are not enough to support them any longer. So with Gloria’s strength of character and determination, three years ago she joined her village bank, took out a small loan, and opened a liquor store from a room in her house. She is open until 6:00 in the evening and sells only “para llevar”, or, to go.
