Gloria is fortunate (and very thankful) that she does not have to travel far to stock her inventory; she has ‘proveedores’, suppliers, who deliver right to her house.

Gloria has many regulars who count on her for delicious wines for weddings, birthdays, holidays, and other celebrations, plus new custumers she generates through word of mouth, with old customers raving about the inviting business she has built. When asked what her goal is with this loan, Gloria looks up, smiles, and says ‘seguir trabajando!’- to keep on working! She also hopes to increase and expand her inventory so she can offer more variety to her customers and always have enough on hand.

loans.use: expand her inventory so she can offer more variety to her customers

loans.name: Rukmini

texts.en: Rukmini is 28 years old and has a child aged 7. She sells goods such as cooking oil and noodles in her small shop. She usually earns US$7 per day. Her husband, D., earns US$2.50 per day by taking people on his motorcycle. She requests a US$75 loan to buy more goods to fill her shop. Rukmini is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop with more inventory

loans.name: Evelyn's Group

texts.en: Evelyn sells fresh fish in the local market. She intends to pay school fees for the children and to buy a mortocycle with the profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy a fridge

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya F., age 22, is married with 3 children (5, 3, and 2 years old). Raya owns a snack shop, which just opened a few months back. Working from 6am-12pm daily, she currently earns about $9 a month from this business.

Raya hopes for a loan to increase her sales of snacks and tea. Raya belongs to the loan group called Motomoto, whose members ensure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy food items for her shop

loans.name: Imakulata

texts.en:
Imakula is 48 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 25, 17 and 12 years old. She and her husband also take care of 4 other children, ages 18,12,10 and 8 years old. Imakulata runs a kindergaten school, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business.

In the past, Imakulata has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her school. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her school.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her school.

loans.name: Aboki

texts.en: Mr. Aboki A. is married. He is 36y ears of age and hails from ijaniki, Lagos State, Nigeria. He sells phone accessories, recharge cards and makes phone calls. He acquired the skill for 1year and has been in this business since 2001. Aboki has being borrowing from LAPO Microfinance and repaying loans for the past 4years and needs the sum of $875 to enable him buy more phone accessories and recharge cards for sale.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories and recharge cards for sale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina L. has a general store in Porvenir, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. She opened her store 1 year ago after working in a home washing clothes for most of her life. She now earns more money selling food and clothing to her neighbors.

Marina is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children. She is so happy she has her store. She can now work from home and spend more time with her children. She also feels betters because washing clothes everyday was very difficult on her hands. She dreams of one day being able to send her children to University.

A member of the community bank Mujeres al Progresso, Marina is requesting a loan of s/2500 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her store and add some new products.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store and add some new products.

loans.name: Titos Paulo

texts.pt:
Titos is 28 years old and was born in Namaacha. He is single, and has a 5-year-old daughter who lives with her mother and is in school. Titos finances the schooling of his 5 nieces and nephews, sending them money on a monthly basis. They live with their mother, however their father lost his life last year (2007).

Titos is a teacher, and has the equivalent of a 12th grade education. He has been working as a teacher for five years, earning a salary of 4,500.00 MT a month. Because of his expenses with his nieces and nephews he is not able to save any money.

Titos lives in his own house, which he intends to improve with this loan. It is his dream to finish and furnish the house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva volunteer.

Nome: Titos paulo R. Localizaçao : namaacha Sector de Actividade: Habitaçao Uso do emprestimo: Compra de material de construçao Data de Desembolso: 05-05-08 Valor de emprestimo: 10.000,00mt Numero de prestaçoes: 16

Titos de 28 anos de idade, natural de namaacha, solteiro pai de uma filha de 5 anos e frequenta colegeo, vive com a sua mae e custea estudos de 5 sobrinhos enviando mensalmente dinheira para casa onde eles vive com a sua mae, sao filhos do tio que perdeu a vida no ano passado (2007).

Titos tem a formaçao de professor, com nivel equivalente a 12ªclasse, assim trabalha como professor a cinco anos, aufere um salario mensal de 4.500,00mt, diz que nao consegue poupar nenhum dinheiro devido as despesas dos sobrinhos.

Titos vive numa propria casa, aqual pretende melhorar com este emprestimo, constitui grande sonho para a vida dele concluir a casa de material convencional e mobilar.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family's house

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida and her husband dedicate themselves to renting motorcycles. She administers the renting, while her husband uses one as a hired driver. This how the family pays household expenses. Sadly in the past months, a number of their motorcycles have had different mechanical problems and they don't have the money to pay for the repairs. The couple is requesting a loan to fix and maintain their stable of cycles, which are their only means of labor. They predict these costs will be around 300 soles ($125), which they earnestly hope you can help them with.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Nelida trabaja junto a su esposo, ellos se dedican al alquiler de motocarros. Nelida administra el alquiler, mientras su esposo trabaja con uno de ellos en transporte público. Es la manera en que esta familia sostiene los gastos diarios del hogar. Lamentablemente en estos últimos meses, varios de sus motocarros se encuentran con diversas fallas mecánicas y no cuentan con el dinero para su reparación. Ellos solicitan un préstamo para el arreglo y mantenimiento de sus motos que son sus únicas herramientas de trabajo. Frente a ello han previsto que los gastos de mantenimiento suman 300 soles, monto con el que no cuentan por el momento y desean encarecidamente que los puedan ayudar.

loans.use: Repair and maintain their motorcycles, her only means of income / Reparación y mantenimiento de sus motocarros, que son sus únicas herramientas de trabajo.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela grew up in a family that was always dedicated to making bread. She knew this business very well, so she decided to dedicate herself to it to take good care of her children.

She had the need to make an income, since she was widowed at a very young age and had the responsibility of being both mother and father, since she had two children and a third one on the way.

She started in April 1982, making the most of her knowledge and the ease with which she could make bread. At that time she also sold clothing, gold jewelry, chorizo, queso, shoes, etc. She always sold things to obtain income to take care of her children. Now she only makes cakes because her children are adults and take care of themselves.

She needs a loan of $1200, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase supplies so she can fill the orders of her clients, making the most of graduation season in the schools.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Graciela creció en una familia que siempre se dedicó a la elaboración de pan, conocía muy bien el negocio, por lo que decidía dedicarse a esto para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso, ya que enviudo muy joven y se quedé con la responsabilidad de ser padre y madre a la vez, ya que tenía dos hijos y venía en camino un tercero. Comenzó en Abril de 1982 aprovechando el conocimiento y la facilidad que tenía para elaborar pan, aunque en ese entonces también vendía ropa, joyería de oro, chorizo, queso, zapatos, etc. siempre dedicada a las ventas para obtener un ingresos que le permitiera sacar adelante a sus hijos pero hoy en día ya solo se dedica a elaborar pasteles pues sus hijos ya están grandes y ya se valen por sí solos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $1200 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes aprovechando que es temporada de graduaciones en las escuelas.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Arastun

texts.en: Arastun was born in 1983. He lives in Baku city. This young man has been in the consulting business for a year. He is single. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy a new computer so he can provide his clients with the best service.

loans.use: to buy a new computer

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda C. tiene domicilio propio, esta casada con Alejandro Quispe, la pareja tiene tres hijos. La casa esta ubicada en la zona de Llojeta ,área suburbana de la ciudad de La Paz.
Yolanda es tejedora de chompas, las cuale vende a una microempresa que lleva ese producto al exterior, su esposo es chofer de transporte publico.
La vivienda  tiene dos habitaciones de adobe que se encuentran a media construcción, el crédito solicitado será para la conclusión de las dos habitaciones, de esa manera, sus hijos tendrán mayor comodidad.
Esta es la sexta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Yolanda C. has her own house, is married to Alejandro Quispe, and has three sons. She lives in Llojeta, an area in the outskirts of La Paz. Yolanda knits jackets and sweaters, which she sells to a company that takes this product to foreign markets. Her husband works as a driver of public transportation. Her house has two adobe rooms that are not fully built. She asks for a loan to finish this construction that way her children can be happier. Yolanda has not been able to receive a loan even though she has applied for one several times in the past. Her case and circumstances have already been analyzed and the conclusion of this analysis is favorable towards her receiving a loan.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CONSTRUCCION

loans.name: Shah Gul's Group

texts.en:
Shah Gul baji, the wife of M. A. K., lives in Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. Shah Gul baji completed her education through the 5th standard grade. She is the mother of seven children: two sons and five daughters. None of her children goes to school. Her eldest son is a mechanic who works in a workshop. Shah Gul baji’s husband makes spare parts for vehicles with a lathe. He has been in this business for the past 20 years. Shah Gul baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. Shah Gul baji successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy another lathe to expand her husband’s business. She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Shamim baji and Shabana baji each want a loan to buy tools to repair vehicles for their motor workshop. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy car wheels to resell. Najma baji wants a loan to buy a lathe.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy another lathe

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de 6 femmes (dont 5 mariées et 1 célibataire) ayant une  moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et 4 enfants et qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies  dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Elles excellent dans les activités d’achat et de vente d’habits  pour enfants, de savon, de condiments alimentaires, de fruits et de légumes. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter,  le groupe décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso à travers une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Jiguiya 2 de Médine). Il est à son 7ème  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter,   5 sacs de pomme de terre,   5 sacs de manioc, 5 caisses de banane  sur place auprès des producteurs venant des villages environnants. Elles effectuent  leurs ventes d’une façon fixe au marché et de façon ambulante dans les services au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée des femmes et des hommes.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 8 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of six women (five married and one single) with an average age of 27 and four children, and who live in large, extended traditional families in the neighborhood of Médine in the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They excel in buying and selling children’s clothing, soap, condiments, fruit and vegetables. In order to meet the demand of their ever-increasing clientele, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution through a women’s association in their neighborhood (the Association Jiguiya 2 de Médine). They are now on their 7th solidarity loan (group loan) and all previous loans were fully repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy five bags of potatoes, five bags of cassava and five cases of bananas from producers who come to Médine from neighboring villages. The women sell their produce either at a dedicated market stall or by walking around and selling for cash or credit to a clientele consisting of both men and women. The women each hope to make from this loan a monthly profit of CFA 8,000, which will be used to pay the loan interest and provide for their families’ needs. The remainder will be invested in their business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, cassava and bananas

loans.name: Krous

texts.en:
Mrs. Krous S. is a villager in Siem Bouy village in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Huor Sreng, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Even though they have different businesses, they still can not support their family well.

In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Krous S. decided to ask for a loan to buy some ducks and ducklings to start a duck-breeding business. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in garment factory while another stays at home to do housework. One of her children is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some ducks and ducklings to breed

loans.name: Filogonio

texts.es:
El señor Filogonio H. O. ya tiene 3 años trabajando en un puesto de venta de alimentos, que es atendido por él, y que además le deja muy buenos ingresos por las ventas que tiene. 
Ahora el señor Filogonio está solicitando un préstamo para ampliar su negocio surtiéndolo de mas mercancía debido a que tiene muchos clientes, para así  proporcionarles un mejor servicio, también planea poner un segundo puesto con el cual pueda obtener mayores ingresos que le servirán para hacer crecer todavía más su negocio y para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Filogonio H. O. has worked for three years in a kiosk that he runs, where he sells foods that bring in excellent income from the sales that he makes. Now Filogonio is asking for a loan to increase the size of his business by supplying it with more merchandise. This way he can better service his many customers. He also plans to install another kiosk with which he may obtain better income that will help him to continue to make his business grow and to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the size of his business and to install another kiosk.

loans.name: Battogtoh

texts.en: Ms. Battogtoh B. is a 39-year-old widowed mother of two sons. In 2007, she started operating a food stall selling vegetables, bread, milk, and other foods to make money to feed her sons. In June 2008, she expanded her business by opening a general store in the yard in front of her house. She also receives 54,000 MNT (about $35-40 USD) a month from the government as a pension for her husband's death. Battogtoh lives in a traditional Mongolian ger about 130 km from Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her sons built the new store themselves. Both of her sons -- aged 12 and 16 -- go to school and help run the family business.  When Battogtoh goes to the market to buy goods, her eldest son works at the store and her youngest son goes with her to help carry the goods. The average daily income in the store is 30,000-50,000 MNT (about $20-40 USD), which mostly comes from selling milk, cigarettes, and bread. Most of the store's customers are Battogtoh's neighbors. This 400,000 MNT loan is the second loan she has taken from XacBank, Kiva's Mongolian microfinance partner. Battogtoh is a very open and active person. She now plans to renovate the structure housing her store.

loans.use: To buy new and varied inventory for her general store

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru: Мирзоев  Муким житель Вахдата. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Имеет высшее образование , по профессии юрист. Но нигде не работает, кроме того , что занимается животноводством. Как и многие жители сельской местности он покупает и продает как крупно рогатый скот , так и мелко-рогатый скот. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить овец и коз . Таким образом он сможет увеличить поголовье скота , что принесет дополнительные доходы. Погасить кредит сможет в  течеине 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mukim M. lives in Vakhdat and is married with five children. He has a university degree in Law but he works in animal husbandry. Like many rural residents, Mukim buys and sells livestock. He would like to receive a loan for the purchase of sheep and goats and therewith increase the number of livestock and make more money. He would be able to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. is single and has no child. She has received schooling through junior high. Sarah sells fabric; she is a seamstress who specializes in sewing ladies’ wear at Kisi near Elmina, which she has done since 2005. Sarah uses her income for paying the rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. She will use the loan to purchase more and greater variety of fabrics and other sewing materials for her sewing work. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and other sewing materials

loans.name: Amavi Ognimélé

texts.fr: Madame O. amavi ognimélé est une veuve qui habite avec ses 02 enfants le quartier  d’agbalépédo qui est un quartier de la ville de Lomé. L’activité qu’elle exerce pour subvenir aux charges de ses enfants est la vente de charbons de bois. Elle exerce son commerce dans son quartier de résidence en gros et en détail, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1990. Elle a besoin de rehausser son stock pour cela elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20  sacs de charbons de bois et assurer les frais de transport.
texts.en:
Ms. O. Amavi Ognimélé is a widow who lives with her two children in Agbalépédo, a district in the city of Lomé. To provide for her children, she works selling charcoal. She does commerce wholesale and retail in the district where she lives and has been working at it since 1990. She needs to replenish her stock. To do so, she’s requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 sacks of charcoal and to cover transportation costs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Harimabonu

texts.ru: Харимахон и ее муж работают в местном колхозе. Заработную плату получают безналично продуктами питания. Чтобы обеспечить семью супруги дополнительно занимаются откормом скота. Харимахон 55 лет, у нее 3 детей. Харимахон планирует купить одного бычка и хочет получить займ.
texts.en:
Harimabonu and her husband work at a local collective farm. They are not paid in cash but rather in food products. In order to support the family, the husband and wife are involved in livestock feeding. Harimabonu is 55 years old and has 3 children. She plans to obtain the loan in order to purchase one bull.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Lường Thị

texts.en:
H. Lường Thị makes a living primarily from raising cattle for sale. She is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xuong. She is married and has two school-aged children. H. just started this business and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2005, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. H. is now requesting a loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase new livestock to raise and sell. This will be her fifth loan from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business.

No. 1440051223.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Santa Catalina” are from the centre of Cuyocc, Anco District, Province of Churcampa and Department of Huancavelica. The community has a population of approximately 1500 co-proprietors. The city is primarily sustained by cultivation of corn, wheat, potatoes and other products.

Octavia lives with her partner and has three children. Octavia sells various clothes in her district. She began with only a few assorted products and now her business has grown. With the loan she hopes to obtain, she will buy more clothes to diversify her business. The dreams of Octavia are to obtain more products and to support her children in becoming professionals. 

Donatilda is married and has two children, aged 12 and 14. Donatilda buys and sells smaller animals, like chickens and guinea pigs. Her loan will be invested in the buying of chickens and guinea pigs.  The dreams of Donatilda are to have more capital and to buy large animals and support her children in their education.

Maribel is married and has four children. Maribal started selling fish and, with her first loan, she changed her business to sell clothes at fairs. With the loan she hopes to obtain, she has plans to buy a broader variety of clothes. The dreams of Maribel are to buy a loom in order to make sweaters and to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy clothes, chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro is forty-six years old. His wife, Wilma, serves as a day care worker in their village. They have three children who are all in school, enrolled either at the high school or at the elementary level. His family lives in the remote town of San Vicente Angadanan, Isabela, where most of the people are very hard working and value camaraderie.
 
He is managing a rice field of 3.5 hectares. Farming is the family's major source of income, so Teodoro does his best to manage his farm well in order to bring in a good crop. Teodoro is requesting a loan of PHP25,000 from Kiva lenders to support his farming.  The loan will allow Teodoro to buy a sufficient supply of fertilizers, seed varieties, pesticides and insecticides, and to pay his labor costs. He hopes that through the program he can strengthen his business and become more stable.

loans.use: To provide business capital

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Sangita B. lives in Bhatkepati Village. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and daughter. Her husband, Mr. Ram Kumar B., is in the Nepali army. Her daughter is studying in pre-primary school.

Mrs. B. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Bhatkepati. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as rice, maize, noodles, snacks and cold drinks. Her husband also helps her in the shop. 
Now Mrs. B. is requesting an Rs 10000.00 loan to expand her business by purchasing different varieties of grocery items for her shop.

Mrs. B. uses her income to provide a good education for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock

loans.name: Bahrullo

texts.ru: Нозимов Бахрулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 31 год. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Бахрулло по профессии "шофер", он по специальности работал более 10 лет. В данный момент он более 6 лет занимается предоставлением услуги "такси". Кредит просит для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en:
Bahrullo N. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. Bahrullo's profession is a driver in which he worked for more than ten years. Now he has been providing taxi services for more than six years. He is asking for a loan to repair his car.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the car

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisun que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Flor es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Flor tiene su casa en el barrio San José en donde vende bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Flor vende cosméticos por catalogo.
Flor necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas.
Flor sueña con tener una tienda mayorista y construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the “Ccatarisun” (which means “Let’s raise ourselves up” in Quechua) Communal Bank. Flor is married, 39 years old, and has 2 children. Flor lives in the San José neighborhood where she sells beverages, an activity she does every day. In addition Flor sells cosmetics via catalog. Flor needs a loan for 3000 soles to invest in buying soda pop. Flor dreams of having a wholesale store and building her house with quality materials.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soda pop

loans.name: Stumai

texts.en:
Stumai is a member of the Frelimo Borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 55 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 6 children.Her children are aged 25,21,20,20, and 16 years.

stumai started her own business selling charcoal 18 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Stumai second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 400,000 In order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan,Stumai,hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn R.'s main source of income comes from providing automotive repair services in her community. She is 40 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the town of Katipunan. Jocelyn has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for automotive repair services

loans.name: Saina

texts.en:
Saina F. is a 23-year-old woman living in the town of Samatau 3. She is single and does not have any children. To make a living, Saina owns and operates a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking and selling a variety of confections, such as cookies and cakes, in the local community. Saina has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 450 WST a month from these activities.

Saina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saina is requesting a loan from SPBD in the amount of 1000 WST, which will be used to purchase baking equipment. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Saina from SPBD. Saina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 58 años, el un hombre muy trabajador y honrado. Vive solo en su casa propia y  está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus metas.

La Peña Restaurante “Costa, Sierra y Selva”, es uno de los lugares más concurridos de la ciudad de Juliaca, ya que si uno quiere comer bien y rico está obligado a visitar este lugar. Guillermo es el orgulloso dueño y es también quien cocina los deliciosos platos, ya que él es natural de Trujillo y su especialidad son los platos norteños.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 5 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todos sus clientes a la vez, ya que hay horas en que su restaurante se llena demasiado. Con el paso del tiempo, anhela ampliar más su peña y hacer que su negocio crezca.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Guillermo con MFP, está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable por lo cual es respetado por sus compañeras. Con los mil quinientos soles que solicita comprará nuevas sillas, mesas y cubiertos, con los cuales espera brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 58 years old, is a very hard-working and honorable man. He lives alone in his own house, and is prepared to work hard to meet his goals. The La Peña Restaurant “Coast, Mountains and Jungle” is one of the most frequented establishments in the city of Juliaca given that, if you want to eat good food, you must visit this place. Guillermo is a proud owner, and is also the chef who prepares the delicious meals as he originates from Trujillo and his specialty is food from the northern region. What he most enjoys about his work is cooking, and he does it with much care. He has been in this business for 5 years, and one of its most difficult aspects is tending to all his customers at once since sometimes the restaurant is quite busy. Over time, he hopes to expand and grow his business. This is Guillermo’s second loan with MFP, and he is committed to working arduously to pay his installments on time. He is a very responsible member of his cooperative bank, for which he is well-respected. With his one thousand five hundred Peruvian soles, he would like to buy chairs, tables and silverware to be able to provide a higher level of service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and utensils for his restaurant.

loans.name: Club De La Amistad Group

texts.es:
La  alcancía comunal denominado “Club de la Amistad” esta ubicado en las Lomas de Horacio zevallos, en el distrito de ate, se encuentra  representado por la señora  Giovanna L. y conformada por 9 socios que radican en dicha zona. La señora Giovanna tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos de 18, 16 y de 1 año de edad, todos ellos dependientes, el negocio al cual se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza  mediante catálogos desde hace 1 año y 1 mes.
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 5 años, nuestros socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta de comida rápida en los mercados, otros socios a la venta de jugos, golosinas y otros socios a la venta de ropa; con el reciente préstamo otorgado, la señora Giovanna comprara productos en stock para aumentar sus ganancias y también piensa en comprar puertas y ventanas para implementar su vivienda, todos los demás socios incrementaran su capital para así obtener una mayor productividad, mejor posesión en el mercado y captar mayores clientes. Los socios tienen grandes sueños y metas y se encuentran, muy agradecidos con la institución por todo el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos, seguir trabajando y no defraudarlos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Club de la Amistad” is located in Las Lomas de Horacio zevallos, in the district of ate. The communal bank is represented by Mrs. Giovanna and has 9 members who live in the area. Mrs. Giovanna is 35 years old, has a live-in partner and 3 children ages 18, 16 and 1, all of them dependents. She has had a business selling beauty products from catalogs for a year and a month.

They have worked with EDAPROSPO – prosperidad for 5 years, our members are involved in different activities like selling fast food in markets, other members sell juices, sweets and others sell clothing; with the funds from the loan, Mrs. Giovanna will buy products to add her stock to increase her earnings and she is also thinking of buying doors and windows to install in her home. All the other members will increase their capital to achieve more productivity, improve their position in the market and attract more clients. The members have big dreams and goals and they are very appreciative of the institution for all the support given and promise to comply with the payments, to continue working and to not disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 60 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband is a retired police officer. Mary sells drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers and she aspires to be a major drink distributor in the future. She is a hardworking woman, working long hours to meet the basic needs of her family. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is 45 years old and married with four children. Her eldest child is 16 years old. Elizabeth lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She bakes and sells cakes. She also sells baking ingredients, such as bags of flour and baking powder, at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more baking ingredients to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baking materials for resale

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es: La señora  CLAUDINA R. D. O. tiene 60 años, vive en el distrito del PORVENIR, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal CARIDAD II. La socia presenta estudios hasta 6to D. primaria, es casada  y tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales 1 depenD. económicamente D. ella. La socia se dedica a la venta D. productos alimenticios como: galletas, gaseosas, cerveza, arroz, azúcar, etc. Este es su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo utilizará para abastecer su tienda con mas productos para poder aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Claudina R. D. O. is 60. She lives in the Porvenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Caridad II Communal Bank. She went to school until the sixth graD.. She is married and has six children. One child is economically dependent upon her. She sells food products like crackers, soft drinks, beer, rice, and sugar, etc. This is her first loan for 300 PEN. She will use it to stock her store with more products. She will do this to be able to increase her sales and her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy crackers, soft drinks, beer, rice, and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria es una cliente antigua  de nuestra agencia, ha demostrado ser una buena cliente, de manera responsable y con buena actitud, ha cuplido con sus obligaciones. Su esposo es chofer propietario de un radio taxi actualmente sigue en esta actividad en la empresa splendid. La sra. Victoria destina todo su tiempo a la venta de su mercaderia, ella vende en la feria 16 de julio y tambien esta en la ciudad de la paz frente al nuevo mercado lanza en la calle figueroa. Junto a sus hijos la señora se sacrifica para lograr tener con el tiempo su propia casa, ya que por el momento viven el la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Ms. Victoria has been a client of our organization for a long time. She has demonstrated herself to be a good client. With a responsible manner and a good attitude, she has complied with her obligations. Her husband is the owner and driver of a radio taxi. He currently follows this activity in La Empresa Splendid (The Splendid Business). Ms. Victoria spends all of her time selling her merchandise. She sells in the feria 16 de julio (July 16 Fair) and also is in the city La Paz, in front of Nuevo Mercado Lanza (New Pole Market) on Figueroa Street. With her children, Ms. Victoria sacrifices in order to have her own house in time, as for the moment, they live in her parents house.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is 42 years old and is married with four children with ages between 4 and 12 years. Valerie and her family live in Nyamagabe, in the Southern Province of Rwanda.

Valerie has been in the business of studio photography for the past ten years and she is still in the same profession. Her studio is open from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day. She employs two people in her studio and she hopes to see her studio become extremely expanded.

Valerie says her goal is to expand her studio through purchasing some additional equipment including a machine to be used in printing out the photos. She is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can achieve this goal.

If her plan is successful, Valerie hopes to build a secure future for her family as well as reinvesting some of her earned profits in the business.

loans.use: To buy some additional equipment including a machine to be used in printing out the photos

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca A. D. M. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán, junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. La señora Rebeca, posee una venta D. ropa usada, la cual es importada D. Los Estados Unidos. Su negocio esta ubicado en las cercanías D. la Alcaldía D. Ahuachapán, lo que le brinda una excelente ubicación ya que es un lugar muy concurrido por las personas. Tanto Rebeca como toda su familia cuentan con muy buenas referencias, ya que se refieren a ellos como personas muy trabajadoras y amables quienes siempre están dispuestos a esforzarse más cada día, Rebeca solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, sobre todo juvenil, la cual es la que más se venD.. Ella espera mejorar las ganancias, ofreciendo mayor cantidad D. variedad D. prendas D. vestir D. manera que pueda captar la atención D. mayor cantidad D. clientes.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 47 years old and lives in the Ahuachapán Department, along with her husband and three children who attend school. Rebeca sells clothing that is imported from the United States. Her business is located in the vicinity of the Ahuachapán City Hall, which is an excellent location because it is so well known by many people. Rebeca and the rest of her family have very good references and are known to be hard working and friendly people who are willing to work harder each day. Rebeca is requesting a loan so that she can invest in larger amounts of clothing, particularly children’s clothing, which is her biggest seller. She expects to increase her revenue by being able to offer a greater variety of clothing items and be able to attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in clothing for resale

loans.name: Abdrahamane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdrahamane B. est âgé de 26 ans, célibataire et sans enfant. Il vit chez sa mère dans une   famille nucléaire au 3ème quartier de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 8ème  année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien), il opta pour le métier de tailleur. 
Après 3 années d’apprentissage auprès de son grand frère, il évolue en solo depuis maintenant 3 ans dans son atelier se trouvant au quartier Alamoussala. 
Il est très sollicité pour  son génie de création. 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices. Il  a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son 1er  prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, une machine à coudre. 
Il  s’approvisionne sur place. Monsieur Abdrahamane B. fait ses prestations au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’entretenir sa maman et de bien mener son activité.  
Son ambition est d’ouvrir un second atelier.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdrahamane B. is 26 years old, unmarried without children. He lives with his mother in a nuclear family in the 3rd area of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having left school in the 8th grade (Mali educational system), he chose to become a tailor. After three years as an apprentice to his older brother, he now works on his own, in a workshop located in the Alamoussala neighborhood. He is very much in demand due to his creative genius. To increase his working capital and generate more income, he is requesting a first individual loan from Soro Yiriwaso, with which he will buy a sewing machine. He gets his supplies from the area. Mr. Abdrahamane B. provides his services for cash or on credit, to a customer base of both men and women. With this loan, he hopes to attain monthly earnings of 65,000 FCFA. The profits will allow him to take care of his mother and run his business smoothly. His ambition is to open a second workshop.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yams for planting

loans.name: 07.05.03 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en: Tinh L. T. (19) is a 56-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. She is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 07.05.03 H. Hoa Group. Tinh is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a business raising cattL. for saL.. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month. In 2003, Tinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase calves to raise and sell. Tinh is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase calves to raise and sell. The loan will be her 6th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. N. T. Hiep (13) is a 54-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. N. T. Truong (5) is a 28-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business. 3. L. T. Sam (37) is a 51-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. H. T. Phuc (18) is a 62-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Tinh L. T. (19) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Tinh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 07,05,03 (07,05,03 H. Hoa). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Tinh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Tinh kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND. Vào 2003, Tinh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Tinh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. T. Hiep (13) là 54 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. T. Truong (5) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 3. L. T. Sam (37) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. H. T. Phuc (18) là 62 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more palm oil in gallons to sell.

loans.name: Farahiya

texts.en:
Farahiya is 30 years old and married with one child. She runs a boutique in Nairobi to earn a living. She has been in the business for ten years and has two employees. She is in a group of young members of Faulu Kenya who are determined and focused on improving their businesses. They meet on a weekly basis to save their money. The group guarantee loans for each other.  

She previously took out two loans of 90,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya, which she used to expand her business and pay school fees for her child and she successfully repaid.    Her greatest wish is to see her children through college and be professionals. She has requested a loan of kes 80,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stock of clothes for sale. She hopes to grow her business to a wholesale level and build her family a house in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos P., reside en el Municipio de Jucuapa del Departamento de Usulután, tiene 61 años de edad, vive con su esposa  tiene 50 años, se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera.
Carlos aprendió el oficio hace 22 años, y a base de esfuerzo y sacrificios logro comprar las herramienta necesarias para tener  su propio taller de carpintería en la casa de habitación, el elabora camas, roperos, jugueteras, sillas y mesas de madera. Trabaja según la demanda de sus clientes para maximizar los materiales. Con los ingresos de su trabajo él ha solventado las necesidades de su familia. 
Carlos es un señor muy trabajador y responsable quien realiza un excelente trabajo, así mismo es muy cordial y amigable. Él solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de materiales para elaboración de muebles  y comprar diferentes clases de madera, pegamento, clavos, pintura, barniz, esto le ayudara  para tener a la venta muebles, atraer  clientes y brindarles un mejor servicio, el aspira tener un taller grande, diversidad de muebles terminados, obtener ingreso para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos P., lives in the municipality of Jucuapa in the Department of Usulután. He is 61 years old, and he lives with his 50 year old wife. He makes wooden furniture for a living. Carlos learned to make furniture 22 years ago, and due to his hard work and sacrifice he has managed to buy the necessary tools to run his own carpentry shop at his house. He makes wooden beds, wardrobes, toyboxes, chairs, and tables. He works according to the demand of his clients in order to maximize his materials. He uses his business's profits to pay for his family's necessities. Carlos is a very hardworking and responsible man who does excellent work, and is also very kind and friendly. He requests a loan to buy furniture making materials such as different kinds of wood, glue, nails, paint, and varnish. These materials will help him to have furniture for sale, attract clients, and provide better service. He aspires to have a large shop with many finished pieces of furniture, and to make more money to improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cedar wood, glue, nails, paint, and varnish.

loans.name: Maribelou

texts.en:
Maribelou T., from the village of Southern Pob. Plaridel Misamis Occidental, is 38 years old and separated from her spouse. To make a living, Maribelou owns and operates a specialized retail store selling clothing and shoe products, lotion, cologne, etc. in the local community. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Maribelou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 25000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 50000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Maribelou plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, and blocks

loans.name: Samit

texts.en: Mrs. Samit Y. and her family are living in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. She was born in 1977 who is a farmer who owns three-hectare plot of land where she can earn some money to support her family while her husband, Mr. Phoeurn Nak, is a horse cart driver who can also earn some money to support his family. Now she has some problem because her field is time to do farming, but she did not have enough money to support. So to improve current production, Mrs. Samit Y. is seeking for a loan to purchase rice seed and rest of the loan she hires farming laborers to help her to do farming. She is a mother of four children whom all are studying in school and helping their parents’ businesses. Her husband is taken the photo with her.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed

loans.name: Aidarbek

texts.en:
Aidarbek K. was born in Nurmanbet village, where he still lives. He is 32 years old and has three sons who are seven, four and two. He was the youngest child in a large family, where all the children helped their parents in the household and they cultivated land and pastured cattle. After graduating from secondary school and serving in the Army, Aidarbek got married. His parents gave a milk cow to the couple, thereby making a distinctive contribution to the start of Aidarbek’s business.

Aidarbek is a hard worker and his strong efforts allowed him to broaden his business with three cows and two bulls. His wife milks the cows and sells about 20 liters of milk daily to the loyal customers. Also, Aidarbek cultivates a small plot of land with red beets and cabbage. Aidarbek plans to use this loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy one milk cow and sheep, because it’s a good way to find the means for subsistence of the five member family. 

Aidarbek believes strongly that his children will become educated in the future. And today, he makes every effort to reach this goal. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Germeline

texts.en: Germeline operates a rice retail business, which she started only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to obtain a loan. The business is a big help for the family in covering their expenses and setting aside savings for the future. Germeline is requesting a new loan of PHP 12,000 to buy inventories of rice to sell. Germeline hopes that her business will become successful someday. She also dreams of seeing her six children graduate from college and find stable jobs. Germeline wants to thank ASHI/Kiva lenders who are sponsoring this loan. It is one of the greatest opportunities for her to start reaching for her goals.

loans.use: To buy inventories of rice to sell

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en: Julie Ann S. J., 28 years old, is married to Philip S. J., a driver. The couple is blessed with only one son. These young parents are very industrious and full of dreams. They wish to have a stable business, to build their own house, to send their only child to a better school and to live comfortably and happily. It was 2008 when she joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), partner Microfinance Institution of KIVA in the Philippines. She joins ASHI and KIVA because she believes that these institutions can help her achieve her dreams. When she received her loan she used it properly on farming and now she earns a profit. She also maintains very good performance and shows discipline as a member. She is rewarded for her effort. Now, she is applying again for a new loan to use towards their rice field production. This loan will be used to purchase sacks of organic fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for the farm labor. The income from this business will help the couple in their daily needs and in preparation for the future of their children. The couple's plan is to expand their business and to seek an additional income generating project venture in the near future. They are hoping that ASHI and KIVA will always support their plan and their financial needs to be freed from the cycle of poverty.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer, pesticides and to pay farm labor.

loans.name: Estanislaa

texts.es:
La Sra. Celia  D. 68 años D. edad , casada tiene 3 hijos , todos ya  formaron sus propias  familias,  sólo uno D. ellos vive con ella .
Es oriunda luego D. la ciudad D. San Antonio, siempre se dedicó al comercio, pues se dedicaba a comprar y vender mercerías y bazar en forma ambulante, pero luego D. a poco fue ahorrando y decidió habilitar una despensa bien surtida en su domicilio, y así D. esa manera ya no salir fuera D. su casa, y compartir un poco más D. su familia, su esposo actualmente ya no trabaja, por la edad pero le ayuda atendiendo el negocio, que ya tiene 25 años.
La misma ha recurrido al crédito pues le permite abaratar los costos D. las mercaderías comprándolo al contado, ya que como tiene  proveedores que le hacen llegar los productos y a veces no cuenta con suficiente capital entonces los deja a créditos, es por eso que ella cuida mucho en devolver en forma puntual cuando acceD. a un préstamo porque eso le permite renovar en forma más ágil el siguiente.
texts.en:
Celia is 68 years old. She is married and has 3 children, all of who have their own familes. Only one of them lives with her. She is from the city of San Antonio. She has always been a merchant; she would buy and sell merchandise in a variety store and as a street vendor. Later, little by little she saved up and decided to outfit a well supplied convenience store in her home. That way, she wouldn't have to leave her house and she could spend more time with her family. Her husband is not working at this time due to his age, but he helps her attend to the business, which they have had now for 25 years. She has turned to loans because it allows her to keep costs down by buying merchandise up front. She has suppliers that bring her products and at times she doesn't have enough capital so she buys on credit. That is why she is very careful to make her payments on time when she has a loan because this allows her to renew easily the next time.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her kiosk such as herbs, snacks, baked goods and beverages.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca;  La socia tiene  45 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos,  La socia se dedica a la distribución de cigarrillos y venta de juegos pirotécnicos, la socia es visitada por muchas personas en las fiestas patronales y fiestas locales con realce de aniversarios honrosos, La socia distribuye junto a sus hijos los juegos pirotécnicos a diferentes ciudades en el país. La socia en esta ocasión necesita capital de trabajo para la compra de algunos juegos y abastecer su mercadería para las fiestas que se vienen en el mes de octubre, noviembre y diciembre.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería y juegos para abastecer su negocio. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Francisca, 45, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is a single mother of two children.  She distributes cigarettes and sells fireworks.  She is visited by many people during the Patron Saint festivals and local fiestas associated with important anniversaries.  She and her children distribute fireworks to various cities in the country.

On this occasion she needs funds to invest in merchandise and fireworks to stock her business.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted through this means and at the same time pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and fireworks.

loans.name: Yost

texts.en: Yost Y. is 60 years old and lives with his wife and five of his children in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a chief villager, and he is also has a grinding mill business. He typically makes US$4 of profit a day. His wife sells gasoline from home and earns US$3 per day as well. Three of the children are in school, while two are technicians. Yost Y. is asking for a loan of US$200 to buy more gasoline for his wife to sell and also to fix his leaking roof.

loans.use: To sell gasoline.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria Cristina tiene 43 años y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, Perú, ella desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Maria Cristina es madre soltera pues su pareja la abandono con su hijo, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora pues tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa de baño y muchas cosas más. 
 
Maria Cristina con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 400 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar mas ropa como por ejemplo toallas, polos, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina is 43 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón de San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Maria Cristina is a single mother since her partner abandoned her and her child.  She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has a small business selling swimsuits and many other things.

Maria Cristina plans to use her loan for $400USD to increase her business capital.  She would like to buy more merchandise such as towels, polo shirts etc.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as towels, polo shirts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: 2 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La banca comunal “2 de Julio” es parte del centro focal de Panamericana. Cuenta con  nueve integrantes (en esta oportunidad estaban almorzando, también estaba la mamá de una socia, la señora de manta beis a rayas café y sombrero mostaza), este es su segundo ciclo y se encontraban muy conformes por que el no tuvieron tropiezos en el ciclo primero.  Entre los negocios de las señoras, se cuenta con: transporte público, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, costura de sacos de dama, venta de detergentes, venta de vajilla, venta de zapatos, venta de ropa y cobradora de minibús.

La presidenta, la señora  Marcela es una mujer que ya tiene un hogar consolidado con su esposo y sus dos hijos.  El negocio de la señora Marcela es la cobranza de los pasajes, en el minibús que conduce su marido.  Ella indica que trabajan en forma conjunta porque han comprobado que cuando ella maneja el dinero de los pasajes, tienen más ganancia.   Su solicitud es por Bs. 2500.- y será invertido en la reparación de la movilidad, compra de llantas y otros. Trabajan de lunes a domingo, de seis y media de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche.

Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el plazo de pago.
texts.en:
The “2 de Julio” (2nd of July) community bank is part of the Panamericana regional office.  It has nine members.  (In the photo the group members are having lunch.  One of the members' moms is also present - the lady in the beige shawl with coffee-colored stripes and a mustard-colored hat).  The group is in its second loan cycle and its members are very happy because they didn't run into any problems during their first loan cycle.  The ladies' businesses include: public transport, neighborhood store, clothing sales, sewing ladies' bags, detergent sales, crockery sales, shoe sales, clothes sales and minibus conductor.

The group's president, Marcela, is a woman who has a strong household together with her husband and two children.  Her business is collecting fares on the minibus which her husband drives.  She says that they work together because they have found that when she handles the fares, they make more profits.  She is requesting 2,500 bolivianos which will be invested in repairing their vehicle and buying tires and other parts.  They work from Monday to Sunday, from 6.30am to 9.00pm.

When we asked Marcela what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the repayment terms.

loans.use: To repair a minibus and buy tires

loans.name: Laxita

texts.en:
Laxita D. is from the city of Bagakay Ozamiz City. She is 57 years old. Laxita is widowed and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Laxita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting banana for sale. Laxita has been engaged in her business for over one year and she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Laxita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laxita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Laxita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Laxita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: La Capilla De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama  LA CAPILLA DE SAN LORENZO, está ubicado en la comunidad de San Lorenzo en Atlacomulco México. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes.Marina López es integrante del grupo. Tiene 33 años estudió hasta 3ro de secundaria, ella deseaba seguir estudiando y culminar el nivel medio superior, pero por recursos económicos sólo terminó la secuandaria, es ama de casa y también se dedica a la atención de su negocio de abarrotes tiene 3 hijos:1 mujer y 2 hombres a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Ella se dedica a invertir en su tienda de abarrotes que inicio hace 1 año. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en ello y satisfacer la necesidad del cliente, con la inversión de su negocio ha atraido más clientes y ha mejorado la calidad de servicio, pero ella espera a futuro aumentar su capital e invertir en recaudería y asi dar un mejor servicio y calidad de producto, con el prestamo espera tener un crecimiento amplio que le permita cumplir sus objetivos y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y ayudar al desarrollo de la sociedad.
texts.en: This group is called  LA CAPILLA DE SAN LORENZO, and is located in San Lorenzo in Atlacomulco México. The group has 12 members. Marina López is a member of the group. She is 33 years old and studied until her 3rd year of high school.  She wanted to continue studying and complete high school, but because of economic resources she was not able to finish.  She works in a grocery business and is a housewife of 3 children: 1 girl and 2 boys for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.  She dedicates herself to investing in her grocery business, which she started 1 year ago. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business and satisfy her customers' needs.  This investment will attract more customers and improve the quality of service.  In the future she hopes to raise capital and invest in fruits and vegetables and thus provide better products and services.  With the loan she hopes for growth that can meet her objectives and provide a better future for her children and assist in the development of society.

loans.use: Invest in groceries.

loans.name: Aberi

texts.en: Aberi is a 60-year-old married man with six children. He lives in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children. Ten years ago, he stopped farming and began selling fish. He feels the idea was a good one, as he has reaped tangible benefits. Aberi needs the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun V. and his wife, Mrs. Chanthy Ok, have been married since 1988 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. Two are garment factory workers, one is a construction worker and one is in school. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. 

Saroeun has been raising cows for more than ten years. His wife works in a factory. The couple has asked for a loan from Kiva twice. Saroeun is requesting another loan of $700 in order to renovate their house.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Lorma

texts.es:
La señora Lorma Gutiérrez Hernández, vive en Chicoasen, Estado de Chiapas México. Vive en unión libre con el señor  José Gonzales Arévalo, con quien procreo dos hijos  quienes aun están a su responsabilidad: Edison de nueve años y Bridni de tres años.


      Ella invierte el préstamo  en la compra de zapatos por cátalo de la marca Andrea, en donde lleva  trabajando seis años, y comenta que le va bien ya que le deja buenos ingresos desde que inicio con esta pequeña actividad.
 

     En esto inicio por su propia  creatividad ya que para  obtener ingresos tiene que tener una actividad que le deje buenas ganancias y de ello poder superarse con su familia a un qué pequeña pero importante para ella.

 
    Con lo que vende está ahorrando para que  así logre agrandar su negocio y tener su propia zapatería  de la que pueda seguir trabajando y  así logra salir adelante.

 
    Su deseo es que  logre seguir trabajando para comprar material y construir su casa que es lo que más desea, como también darle lo mejor a sus  hijos.
texts.en:
Lorma Gutiérrez Hernández lives in Chicoasen, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She lives with her common-law husband José Gonzales Arévalo and they have two children who are still in their care: 9 year-old Edison and 3 year-old Bridni.

Lorma is investing her loan in buying Andrea-brand shoes from a catalog.  She has been in this business for six years and she tells us that it is doing well and has made her good profits since she started.

Lorma started her business through her own creativity since, in order to make income, she needed a business activity that would make her good profits and allow her to get ahead in life with her family which, although small, is important to her.

When she sells products, Lorma also saves so that she can expand her business and one day own her own shoe store.  This will enable her to continue working and get ahead in life.

Lorma's wish is to continue working so that she can buy materials and build her own house.  This is what she most wishes for.  She would also like to be able to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: To buy Andrea-brand shoes through a catalog

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga, 28, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, residing in a two-room house in his father's backyard on the outskirts of the city. Two of their children attend a local primary school.

Battulga began making Mongolian traditional boots in 2006, assisted by his wife while taking care of the children at home. They manufactured the footwear by hand until they bought a sewing machine for 365,000 MNT in 2010, a purchase that has made their job much easier. The boots they now produce are both traditional and modern styles which are bought by both Mongolians and foreign visitors. Battulga and his wife currently have one employee who earns a salary of 150,000 MNT per month.

Their business has expanded little by little and will continue to grow. Battulga is a hardworking person and caring father who says, "We have our sewing machine and we need to have our own workshop in the future." He is requesting a loan of 700,000 MNT to buy leather and other necessary materials for his boot-making business.

loans.use: To buy leather and other necessary materials

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov S., age 25, is a sewing worker in the garment industry. She has been working in this sector for over one year and has a formal salary. 

Her husband earns a living as a cow trader. He buys oxen in rural areas from farmers and re-sells them. He occasionally supplements his income as a motor broker. Though the couple has been married for a few years, they have no children as yet.

Pov S. is aware that her husband’s business is becoming increasingly profitable and she hopes to sustain it through a Kiva loan by accumulating a larger quantity of cows for future sale.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger quantity of cows to offer for sale in the future

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Drissa B. est un célibataire de 25 ans, qui vit chez son grand frère à Hamdallaye “Zantiguibougou”, un des quartiers périphériques de ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  B. après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié  il y a plus de trois années au commerce notamment  à la vente d’articles divers (d’huile alimentaire, sel, spaghetti, savon etc.) dont il dispose une place au  marché avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménages. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ trois ans. Il est à son troisième prêt individuel. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce  troisième prêt, il compte acheter, 6 sacs de sel, 5 futs d’huile alimentaire, 2 cartons de cubes maggi, 3 cartons de spaghetti, 2 cartons de savon, 1 carton de sardine, 3 cartons de concentrée tomate, etc. Il s'approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de place avant de les revendre en détail, au  comptant et à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Drissa B., aged 25, is unmarried and lives at his older brother’s place in Hamdallaye “Zantiguibougou”, an outlying district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run several businesses without success, Drissa became familiar with commerce over three years ago, especially in the sale of various goods (cooking oil, salt, spaghetti, soap, etc.). He has a place at the market and a customer base composed essentially of housekeepers. He is much in demand by his customers for the quality of his products.

To satisfy his burgeoning customer base, Drissa decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about three years ago. He is now on his third individual loan. The previous loans were properly repaid. 

With this third loan, he intends to buy: 6 sacks of of salt, 5 barrels of cooking oil, 2 boxes of Maggi bouillon cubes, 3 boxes of spaghetti, 2 boxes of soap, a box of sardines, 3 boxes of tomato paste, etc. He gets his supplies from local wholesalers and then sells them retail, for cash or on credit.

He envisions using this loan to make a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase his business capital and to cover the loan interest. The rest of the profits will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy various grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Enkhtuvshin

texts.en:
