Esi will use the loan to increase her capital in order to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save towards buying a house, which she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities for processing and for sale.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella sells foodstuffs and she loves this business because she has lots of customers. She is 29 years old and is married with 3 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rheza

texts.en:
Rheza B. is 32 years old and married to Edgar B., who is a laborer. They have two children and presently reside in Baybay Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Hog raising is her project and Rheza would like a loan in the amount of 7,000 Php as starting capital to buy pigs, feed, and vitamins. She is thankful to Paglaum for their trust and assistance with her project. It helps them so much that Rheza can support the financial needs of the family and contribute by adding to her husband's income.

loans.use: To buy pigs, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
M. Nguyễn Thị (1205050388) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang.  She is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, Mỵ owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising poultry.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  Mỵ has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 1500000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2003, Mỵ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mỵ has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby chickens to raise & sell in the future.  Mỵ is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND, which will be used to build a shelter for her chickens.  The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Mỵ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To build a shelter for her chickens

loans.name: Rosewilyn

texts.en: Rosewilyn T. is from the village of Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Rosewilyn owns and operates a business selling used clothes. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosewilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more used clothes to sell. This loan will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to sustain her family's basic needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina P. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 58 years old, widowed and has four adult children. She is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. Carolina has been in this business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Carolina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Carolina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a sari-sari store

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mbonjum

texts.en:
Born in 1948, J. is married and is the father of seven children. He has been a struggling father who has made every effort to educate his children and provide for their needs and necessities. He has lost so many lives in the family: his mother and dad, brothers, and a sister. This has forced him to take on additional burdens in taking care of their children and grandchildren. Faced with the these challenges, the need arose for him to join a financial institution from which he could borrow money and help make ends meet. Encouraged by his friends, and fueled by the need for more capital for his business, he joined GHAPE. Since then, he has benefited immensely from the organization.

If he is approved for his fourth loan, J. plans to invest in the selling of beer and the rearing of pigs. More specifically, he will buy piglets, pigs, and pig feed. Experience has taught him how to manage a business like this. The business site is located in a very good area, and pigs are in high demand as their meat is used for many social occasions such as marriages and funeral ceremonies

. J. loves GHAPE because of the low interest and the social interactions among members.

About the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE):

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and provides poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of beer for sale as well as pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma L. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Wilma is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns & operates a business selling used clothing in the local community. Wilma is just starting this business.

In July 2009, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Wilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education of her children and supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is member of the Idunda East borrower group In Kihesa,Iringa,she is 26 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 11 and 1 years.

Salma started her own food business selling tomatoes,banana,and charcoal,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Salma`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal and tomatoes for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Salma hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal,tomatoes

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth is a member of the Idunda D borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 31 years old woman,she is married and she cares for 1 dependent.

Magreth started her own food business 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings. 

This is Magreth first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more food commodities for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Magreth hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for food

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr: V. Brigitte est née en 1984 à Agbomassè, commune d'Avrankou. Brigitte est mariée et est mère de deux (02) enfants.  Brigitte a comme activité principale la coiffure. Mais en plus, Brigitte vend des mèches et des produits de beauté. C’est pour augmenter le stock de ses produits que Brigitte sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
V. Brigitte was born in 1984 in Agbomassè, in the community of Avrankou. She is married and the mother of two children. Her main work involves hairdressing. But in addition to that, Brigitte sells hair extensions and beauty products. To increase her stock of products, she's requesting financial support from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
La señora Bárbara es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 2 hijos, vive en Cuturapi  Barrio 24 de junio y estudio secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de alfombras.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar alfombras para que su compra le resulte mejor ella viaja a Lima  y luego lo comercializa en Puno y Juliaca, trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo.

Su mayor deseo es educar a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de alfombras.

loans.name: Marixa Isabel

texts.es:
La socia  Isabel;  pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural de la ciudad del  Cusco.

Nuestra socia  tiene 35 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo es albañil y tienen  4 hijos, la socia  alterna sus  actividades del hogar con  el comercio minorista, nuestra socia tiene un pequeño puesto ambulante donde vende comidas, desde hace 5 años atrás, en la calle san isidro, la socia ayuda de esta manera al hogar y sus necesidades, ella solicita el préstamo para entre las cosas que tiene pensado comprar, ella invertirá gran parte en unas ollas y en unos cubiertos y en los insumos para los diferentes platos que realice.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the communal bank called Kantu San Jeronimo. She is a native of the city of Cusco. Isabel is 35 years old. Her husband is a brick layer and together they have 4 children. She divides her time between taking care of her home and running her small business selling snacks along San Isidro Street from her cart. She has run her business for 5 years now, and the income helps support her household needs. She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies and ingredients for the different meals she prepares for her customers. Isabel appreciates the loan very much and commits to making the payments within the required time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and ingredients for her small business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo (Braulio), de 47 años, y con sus 2 hijas; Cerafine de 13 y Satomi de 3, en su casa propia.

La venta de carne ha significado la principal fuente de sustento de su familia, hace 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde y obtiene muy buenos ingresos por ello. Todos estos años la han hecho una experta en el conocimiento de las carnes, teniendo muchos clientes que prefieren comprar estos alimentos por la confianza que Gloria les da. 
A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite conversar con sus amigas que siempre vienen a comprarle para cocinar el almuerzo de sus familias. Para el futuro le gustaría tener un puesto más grande y mejor equipado, pero sabe que poco a poco se llega lejos, es por ello que trabaja y espera paciente las mejoras que cada vez va obteniendo su negocio.

Este es segundo préstamo con MFP y ella se siente contenta con el trabajo en su grupo solidario, ya que todas sus compañeras son muy puntuales y buenas amigas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de carne para mejorar sus ventas y así poder brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijas
texts.en:
Gloria, 38, lives in her own home with her husband (Braulio, 47) and their two daughters: Cerafine, 13, and Satomi, 3. The family's main source of income is meat sales and she has been involved in this activity for the past 9 years working from 8 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. She has earned good profits. All these years of work have turned her into quite the expert on meats and many of her customers prefer to buy from her because of the trust Gloria inspires in them. She likes her work very much in that it allows her to socialize with her friends who always come to buy ingredients from her for their daily family meal preparation. For the future, she would like to have a larger, better equipped, stand. She knows, however, that little steps lead to big accomplishments so she works steadily and patiently waits for the improvements her business gets over time. This is her second loan from MFP and she is very happy with the support she gets from her fellow members, all of whom are very punctual and good friends. With these funds she would like to buy greater quantities of meat to improve her sales thereby offering her daughters a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional maize for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy tiene 40 años está casada. Tienen un hijo de 10 años, acaba de volver de España donde ha trabajado duro y ha logrado reunir lo suficiente para tener una granja pequeña de 10 cabezas de ganado lechero, para la producción de leche cruda cuyo producto entregan a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes productos lácteos.

Doña Nancy vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de Machajmarca , donde tiene una casa pequeña al frente de su granja. Actualmente vive ella sola con su hijo ya que el marido viaja constantemente a la ciudad de santa cruz, por su trabajo que es el servicio de transporte pesado.

El destino de este crédito es construir un establo para su ganado que en esta temporada de fuertes lluvias es necesario para el cuidado del ganado. Entra sus sueños y metas de doña Nancy es el aumentar la cantidad de producción de leche de esta manera crecerá la pequeña granja que tiene, con un segundo crédito la señora Nancy desea realizar una nueva construcción de su casa  y que su hijo pequeño estudia mucho para no tener la necesidad de viajar a otros países en busca de empleo como tuvo que hacerlo ella.
texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old, married, and has a 10-year-old son. She recently returned from working hard in Spain, and she has been able to get together enough money for a small farm with 10 dairy cows that will produce raw milk that will be sold to a company that makes different dairy products. Nancy lives in the city of Cochabamba in the Machajmarca neighborhood, where she has a small house in front of her farm. These days, she lives alone with her son as her husband is constantly traveling to Santa Cruz for his job in the heavy transport service. This loan will be used to build a stable for her herd, which is needed for their proper care during this season of heavy rains. Among Nancy's dreams and goals are to increase the amount of milk she produces and thus grow her little farm. With a second loan, Nancy hopes to do some remodeling on her home and that her young son will study a lot so he won't need to travel to other countries in search of employment like she did.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a stable to house her cattle

loans.name: Rosario Melina

texts.es:
La señora ROSARIO MELINA U. A. tiene 31 años, vive en el distrito de LAREDO, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LAREDO. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, está casada y tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró cosméticos como: colonias, perfumes, shampoo, delineadores, cremas, labiales.
Con este crédito de 3,000.00 nuevos soles lo utilizara para la compra de mas productos de cosméticos como: labiales, talco, polvos, colonias, perfumes, joyas. Ella sueña con adecuar un espacio en su domicilio en donde pueda exhibir y vender sus productos con mayor frecuencia.
texts.en:
Rosario Melina U. A. is 31 years old. She lives in the Laredo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad state, Peru. She completed school through the 5th year of secondary school. She is married and has two children whom she supports. Her business is selling cosmetics. With her first loan of 300 soles she purchased cosmetics such as colognes, perfumes, shampoo, eyeliners, creams, and lipstick. With this loan for 3,000 soles she will purchased more cosmetics such as lipstick, talcum powder, powders, colognes, perfumes, and jewelry. She dreams of fixing up a space in her home where she can display and sell her products more frequently.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcchase of lipstick, talcum powder, powder, colognes, perfumes, jewelry .

loans.name: Independence I Group

texts.en:
A. is a fifty-five year old married mother of three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

A. prepares and sells porridge. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Independence I. The members of the group are mainly traders. They are hardworking, trust themselves, and want the loan to invest in their businesses. A., the group leader, is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Alayo

texts.en:
Alayo M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Alayo is 38 years old and is married to a security guard. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Guo

texts.en:
Guo C. is currently in the business of selling sodas and beans at home and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of beans to sell.  Guo is 20 years old and married to a doctor. She has 1 child, who attends school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a depot for selling sodas.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Five Lofa Sisters Group

texts.en:
Five Lofa Sisters is a group of 5 borrowers led by Garmai H.. She is 46 years old and is married with 5 children aged 14 to 31.  Garmai did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty.

She and her family live and work in the Old Road Community in Sinkor which is about 5 miles from downtown Monrovia, Liberia.  For 19 years, Garmai has been selling foodstuffs such as rice and oil. She buys her goods wholesale and sells them retail to residents of her community. Garmai started selling with 4000 Liberian Dollars and now has 20,000 Liberian dollars as working capital.  She interacts well with customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.  Garmai will use this loan to purchase more rice and oil.  She dreams that she and her family will have a good future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Garmai is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and oil

loans.name: Claudia María

texts.es: Claudia María H. D. L. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Paz, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su madre D. 66 años D. edad, quien es una maestra jubilada, sus cuatro hijos D. 16, 13, 5 y 11 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar educación media y un hermano quien es estudiante universitario. Claudia es madre soltera, la cual debe esforzarse el doble por brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, es por ello que ella posee una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, los cuales se comercializan en su propia casa, negocio a través del cual desD. hace 10 años que sostiene a su familia y le brinda la ayuda necesaria a su madre para poder contar con una sana convivencia dentro del hogar. Claudia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir más en su negocio, comprando productos nuevos los cuales aún no posee, D. esta manera ella espera obtener mayor cantidad D. clientes, lo cual le permita aumentar sus ventas y mejorar la economía D. su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia María H. D. L. is 37 years old and resides in the Department of La Paz. She lives with her family that consists of her 66 year old mother, a retired schoolteacher, her four school age children (ages 16, 13, 11, and 5), and her brother who is a university student. Claudia is a single mother who must work twice as hard in order to proviD. everything her children need. For this reason, she manages a store in her home where she sells basic necessities. She has been in this business for ten years so that she could support her family and proviD. needed help to her mother so that she could peacefully coexist in her home.

Claudia is requesting a loan as additional investment into her business. She will buy new products that she currently does not have in stock so that she can obtain more customers, increase her sales, and improve her family’s finances.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Сафаров Бахром проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 34 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование высшее "Педогог". Кроме того работает водителем такси. Опыт работы 7 лет. Этот вид деятельности приносит доход. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en:
Bahrom S. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 34 years old, married and has 3 children. He has a higher education as a teacher. Besides this, Bahrom works as a taxi driver. He has 7 years of experience in this field. This type of business brings in income. Bahrom is requesting the loan for car repairs in order to provide safe service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en: Zaynab is an 18 year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Zaynab owns a souvenir/gift shop selling teddy bears, and girls’ accessories like necklaces, bracelets, and earrings. She also sells home-decoration items like frames, vases, artificial flowers and lots more. She decided on opening her shop because she has selling skills and knows how to meet her clients' demand. With the loan, she plans to purchase merchandise. This is her second loan cycle having repaid a previous loan on time. She plans to keep on improving and diversifying her merchandise so that she can attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Josephin

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of Tipan, Oroquieta City. She is 34 years old. Josephine is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $71 a month for these activities.

In 2005, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her 9th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Ta-Try Group

texts.en: Baromie B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Baromie was born in a village called Gbenebu 35 years ago. She is married and the couple has six children – three in secondary school and three in primary school.  For seven years now, Baromie has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) and rubber containers. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Baromie will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business; she will buy gallons of palm oil and dozens of rubber containers to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm oil and dozens of rubber containers

loans.name: Cresencio

texts.es: EL SR. CRESENCIO VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, TIENE SU DOMICILIO EN EL BARRIO EL PARAISO DE DICHA LOCALIDAD, TIENE 3  HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR, ES SEPARADO DE SU ESPOSA, CUENTA EL SR. CRESENCIO QUE LA SEPARACION CON SU ESPOSA FUE MUY DOLOROSA PARA EL Y PARA SUS HIJOS,PERO PUDO SOBRELLEVAR LA SEPARACION Y AHORA REALIZA SUS ACTIVIDADES NORMALMENTE, SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA DE CARPINTERIA, CONTRUYE Y REPARA MUEBLES A PEDIDO Y EN SU TIEMPO LIBRE TRABAJA COMO MOTOTAXISTA(TRANSPORTE DE PASAJERO URBANO), ESTA AGRADECIDO CON LA INSTITUCION POR BRINDARLE EL APOYO FINANCIERO. SU DESEO ES  AYUDARLES A SUS HIJOS QUE TENGAN UNA PROFESION, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MADERA PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE MUEBLES YA QUE TIENE VARIOS PEDIDOS.
texts.en:
Cresencio lives in El Torno, which is 40 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. His home is in the El Paraiso neighborhood of El Torno. He has three school age children, and he is separated from his wife. Cresencio says that the separation from his wife was very hard for him and his children. But, they got past the separation, and they now participate in their activities normally. His main activity is carpentry. He builds and repairs furniture based on prior orders. In his free time he works driving a “mototaxi” (a three wheeled motorized vehicle used for urban passenger transportation). He is grateful to the institution for providing him with financial support. His wish is to help his children have a profession. He will use the money from the loan to buy wood to make furniture because he already has various orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Twekembe Development Group, Jinja

texts.en:
Highly spirited, 38-year-old N. Scovia has brought hard work and good customer relationship skills to bear in her three-and-a-half-year-old fish-selling business in Masese Landing Site, Jinja. In this time, she has zeroed in on the weak points associated with plying this kind of business and she has made commendable amends in her own right, with a framework of exemplary ideas that have significantly helped her in dealing with the many challenges that come with running a business of this nature.

This married mother of three has a self-assured attitude that she nurtured whilst still running her erstwhile grocery business. This has done her a good turn in her current business. She also ekes out side profits from her charcoal-selling business.

The future looks bright for Scovia on the basis of the aforementioned attributes. She currently makes profits to the tune of 30,000 shillings per week and she is cheerfully upbeat that her prospects will improve with this loan. With the auspices of this loan, she is looking at buying her own boat. This she says will reduce her operational costs as she won’t be buying fish any more.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat so that she can employ her own people to catch her fish

loans.name: Sousdey

texts.en:
Mr. Sousdey S. is 41 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sreynak Sum, is 28 years old. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have one son who is in school.

Mr. Sousdey S. has been a PM (Military Police) since 1993. His wife has been selling fruit for four years. Currently, they live with their parents and they want to live in their own home. However, they do not have the money to build their own house. Hence, Sousdey is applying for his first loan in the mount of $1,100 to use for his project. 

In the photo, Mr. Sousdey S. and his wife are standing in front of their parents’ house.

loans.use: To build his own house for his family to live in

loans.name: Daler

texts.en:
R. Daler is 28 years old. He has lived for 5 years with the mother of his three children. His parents taught him the art of cultivating grapes, and he has always tried to sow his hectares so that he would have a crop in every season. He says that agriculture requires much patience and luck, because there are seasons where there is no profit and other seasons that are very good, but either way, profitable or not, he has to keep sowing. Daler asked for a loan of 13,000 Somoni that will be invested in his crop supplies. Be an important part of the growth of Daler’s business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is married with two children and one dependent. His two children are currently in primary school.

Francis is both a businessman and a clergyman and owns a shop where he sells home products. Francis' wife assists him greatly by taking care of the home when he is working at his shop.

Francis has a good loan repayment history; he needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to help him buy more stock, as his customer base has been growing and he would like to satisfy their needs.

Francis hopes to use the proceeds from this loan to help educate his children and to complete building his house.

loans.use: To buy more home product to sell

loans.name: Muzamil

texts.en:
Muzamil is a 29-year-old man with one child aged 4 years. He has no other dependents and his family is made up of three people. His family goal is to educate his child and open up a business for his wife. He owns his home located in Hoima, Uganda.

Muzamil has a salon business and has been in it for five years. He started as a barber in a friend’s salon and later on saved to start his own salon. He faces a challenge of load sharing of electricity and high rent. He hopes in future to turn his business into a big salon.

Muzamil wants the loan to pay the outstanding balance on his plot on which he intends to construct a commercial building.

loans.use: To pay the outstanding balance on land for construction of a commercial building

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena J. is from the village of Old Kibawe, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Elena is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Elena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Manuel Rosendo

texts.es:
Manuel de 50 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral.

Hace 7 años atrás comenzó con su tienda de vivieres ya que por su sector había la necesidad de una tienda de víveres y también necesitaba genera ingresos para su familia, poco a poco vendiendo aceites, arroz, bebidas su pequeño local se pudo surtir con mas víveres. Ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceites, azúcar. En el futuro quiere tener bien surtida su tienda y poder readecuar su casa.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 50, has a small store in the front part of his house. He lives in a periurban area called Perimetral. He started his grocery store seven years ago because his sector needed a grocery store. Also, he needed to generate income for his family. Little by little he sold oil, rice, and drinks in his little place. Then he was able to stock it with more food. He now works from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. everyday. He wants to use the loan to stock his business more. He will use the loan to buy rice, oil, and sugar. In the future he wants to have a well stocked store and to be able to make some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Haydde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MUJERES UNIDAS ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de  San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Haydde;   ella tiene 54 años de edad, es casado; y tiene 4 hijos,  La socia se dedica a  la venta de productos mojados desde hace 6 años. La socia se dedica a la venta de productos remojados (tarwi, trigo remojado, maíz para hacer chicha de jora, frejoles, pallares para agilizar la cocción), todos estos los vende en el mercado de tupac amaru.  La socia está vez solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos al por mayor para trabajarlos y vender.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Haydde belongs to the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank, which is located in the district of San Sebastian, Cusco province, in the department of Cusco.

Haydde is 54 years old, married, and has 4 children.  For the last 6 years he has sold steeped products, such as tarwi (a kind of lupin), steeped wheat, corn for making high-quality local beer, beans, and extracts to facilitate cooking.  All these things she sells in the Tupac Amaru Market.

Now, Haydde is requesting a loan to buy dry goods at wholesale to prepare and sell.  She appreciates and values the loan offered via this medium and at the same time, she promises to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: BUYING DRY GOODS AT WHOLESALE TO PREPARE AND SELL

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 56-year-old married man and the father of two children. He has been working as a home painter since 1987. He specializes in painting buildings.  He works on a freelance basis and independently. His business operation is limited to his town and its surroundings.

Today, he has the opportunity to expand his business into other areas and he is requesting to borrow $500 to purchase a compressor and renovate his painting tools. He expects the coming year to be successful and to further increase his business productivity. His business income is important to support his wife and children.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor and renovate his painting tools

loans.name: Lesbia Mayerly

texts.es: La señora Lesbia Mayerly P. C. es una joven de 29 años, vive en el Barrio Villa Libertad,  es casada y con su esposo tienen un taller que brinda servicios de reparación de Refrigeradoras y Aires Acondicionados así mismo labora como profesor en el Colegio Pureza de Maria,  ellos tienen 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian la primaria,  ella ha sufrido múltiples problemas de salud y las ofertas de trabajo han bajado, ahora que se encuentra más estable de salud solicita un préstamo para la ampliación de su taller, con el crédito comprara los materiales para u taller y legalizara la empresa, es para ellos de suma importancia  su solicitud, esta inversión les bridara una mayor estabilidad con la empresa y la comodidad a su clientela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lesbia Mayerly P. C. is a 29-year-old lady living in the neighborhood of Villa Libertad. She is married and with her husband run a shop providing repair services for refrigerators and air conditioners.

He also works as a professor at the Colegio Pureza de Maria. They have 3 minor children all in elementary school.

She has had multiple health problems and the requests for repair services have decreased. Now that her health is more stable she is requesting a loan to expand her business. 

She will use the loan to purchase materials for the workshop and legalize the business. This request is of the utmost importance to them, as it will bring greater stability to their business and comfort to their customers.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase materials for the workshop and legalize the business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a poultry business from home, her potential customers are neighbours and restaurant operators. Susan faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes that someday she will be a big supplier of chicken in the market.  

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase a brood of chicken and chicken feeds.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a mother of three daughters and a son. Her daughters are studying, while her son left his education after eighth class and started work to bear the financial burden of the family. He provides movie making services to people. He has a small shop in the market and offers his services to people at parties and marriage ceremonies. Razia lives in Vehari, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She lives there with her family in a three-room brick house in the area named 39-WB. She has been living here for the past 20 years.

She is a very caring and hardworking woman; she carries out her responsibilities of a housewife well and operates an animal sales business at her home. She purchases animals from the animal markets, raises them up, and sells them to customers for a profit. In this way, she generates income for the family that helps her pay the education fees for her daughters.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her animal sales business. With the loan, she will buy animals like goats and buffalos, and sell them at a profit. She is hopeful that this investment will further grow her business and she will be able to manage her household expenses better as a result. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

Note: In the photo, the woman with a raised hand is Razia.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: The persons shown in the picture are Mrs. Pen S. who has been living in Kompong Tom Province. Pen S. makes a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for offspring and for slaughter. Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house, and making a profit of approximately $2 per day. They have six children, three of whom are single and the other two are married. Unluckily, her pigs are not big enough due to lack of food. To help solve this problem, Mrs. Pen S. has requested a loan that she will use to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs. She will use rest of the loan for her husband to buy a ladder for climbing the palm trees.

loans.use: To buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs. She will use rest of the loan for her husband to buy a ladder for climbing the palm trees.

loans.name: Roque

texts.en: Roque C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is married and has four children, ages 19, 16, 13 and 4. To make a living, Roque owns and operates a business raising livestock. His main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. Roque also buys and resells dried fish to his neighbors. He displays the dried fish in his wife's sari-sari store. Roque joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Roque is requesting a new loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase feeds, vitamins and more dried fish to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, vitamins and more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Nara S. is from the village of Palilan,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Nara is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nara owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Nara has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Nara joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nara is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nara from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Tuguldur

texts.en:
Mr. Tuguldur E. is 23 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters, aged one and two, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife looks after the babies. They do not have their own place to live and currently live in Tuguldur’s parents' house. 

Tuguldur is a computer technician. Since 2006, he has been operating a PC repair, maintenance and sales business. He rents a small workshop in “Computer land,” the second largest PC market in Ulaanbaatar city.  Once a month, he used to travel to Beijing, China, to buy necessary spare parts for PCs. But now he orders them online from wholesalers and distributors, reducing travel expenses. 

Tuguldur’s dream is for his family to have their own place to live. He understands that he can achieve this by expanding his business and increasing his profit. Tuguldur is applying for the loan to increase his working capital and to buy more spare parts for his PC repair business.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for his PC repair business

loans.name: Dejid

texts.en: Dejid, 41, is married and lives with her husband and two daughters in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in their own house and her husband works  a seasonal job. Her older daughter attends college and younger daughter goes to a local secondary school. She finished a vocational school in 2003 and started her own hair salon afterwards. She rents a room at a local market where it is mostly crowded. Her husband bought a mini-truck in 2006 and has used  it to operate a transportation service business. He then started working as a driver for a mining company in 2009. Both her husband and she try hard to make a better life. Dejid is trying to expand her business and increase her income. She is a hardworking and active person who says, " We are paying attention to our daughters' education. We want them to get good education". She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy more equipment for her hair salon.

loans.use: To buy equipment for beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a hardworking married man with two children living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. For two years he has been into poultry farming and the business has facilitated him in running the family. He has a challenge in the high cost of feed. His dream is to set up a shop of poultry feed. Paul needs the loan to buy poultry feed.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria R. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Gloria is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits & beverages. She also sells coconuts & green bananas. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional snack foods, coconuts & bananas. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack foods, coconuts & bananas

loans.name: Rohatoy

texts.en:
Rohatoy F. is married and has three sons. She started her business with one cow but today has expanded that to three. Her sons help her with her business, which she started about 12 years ago. Rohatoy is applying for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to increase her business and the size of the herd she owns. She believes that by doing this she will generate additional income and give her family a better life. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being the home of a key post along the Silk Road and the place where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand the size of her herd

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa R. is from the village of West Kibawe, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Felipa is married and has 4 grown children. To make a living, Felipa owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling beverages, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Felipa has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felipa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Felipa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional beverages & canned goods. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Felipa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE - CUSCO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Carlos, el socio tiene 28 años de edad;  el socio es conviviente, el socio tiene 1 hijo de  1 y medio años de edad; el socio trabaja en una imprenta, el socio es empleado en esta imprenta y está encargado de muchas labores dentro de ella, el socio desea ahora el crédito para poder comprar víveres para el hogar, el socio quiere comprar sacos de arroz, aceite, azúcar para su familia el cual pagara de una sola y con lo que le den de su sueldo el ira pagando en partes, para lo cual el socio requiere el préstamo para poder comprar al por mayor los víveres que le servirán en su hogar. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de víveres para el hogar.

El socio esta agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE - CUSCO” and is located in Huanchac District which belongs to Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

Carlos, 28 is the member.  He has a spouse and a one-and-a-half-year-old son.  He works in a print shop.  He’s employed by the print shop and he's in charge of several jobs in it.

He needs a loan to buy groceries for home.  He wants to buy sacks of rice, oil and sugar for his family all at once.  He will use his salary to repay the loan in installments.  He needs the loan in order to buy the foodstuffs for his home at wholesale.  He asks for a loan to buy groceries for his home.

He is grateful and wants to express that he will repay his loan installments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Rositas Del Ocho Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Rositas del Ocho" este nombre fuen elejido porque las señoras viven en el barrio ocho de la comunidad y lo que más les gusta son las rosas. El grupo está ubicado en el estado de México. La comunidad se caracterisa por una laguna que se encuentra a 100 mts de la poblacion y la mayoria de las personas van a convivir ahí. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y es la tercera vez que solicita un prestamo. Una de las integrantes del grupo se llama Laura, ella tiene 31 años, estudió solo la primaria, tiene 3 hijos, es ama de casa y a su vez comerciante, comenta que su negocio lo comenzo con mucho amor ya que es la herramienta para que sus hijos sigan estudiandiando y la manera de brindarles una mejor vida. La señora Laura se dedica a la venta de ropa que comercializa por catalogo, vende sus productos con las mismas personas de su comunidad, ya tiene 15 años en su negocio, su dedicación en su negocio ha permitido que sus clientes sean fieles con el buen servicio y trato, el prestamo le ayuda a invertir más en ropa, sueña que algun dia tenga un estableciomiento que le permita mostrar todos sus productos y ademas de asesorar a la gente para que comiencen su propio negocio.
texts.en:
This group is called "Rositas del Ocho" a name chosen because it reflects the fact that the members live in the community’s Ocho neighborhood and what they like best are roses.  It is located in the State of México.  The community is noted for a lagoon located 100 meters from the town.  Most of the residents go there to relax.  The group has 10 members and this is the third time it’s requested a loan.

One of the group members is Laura.  She is 31 years old and only finished elementary school.  She has three children.  She’s a housewife but also a merchant at the same time.  She comments that her business started with much love since it’s the tool she uses to provide her children with a better life.

Laura sells clothes via catalogue.  She sells her items to residents in her community.  She’s been in business for 15 years.  Her dedication to her business has allowed her to establish a regular customer base that is faithful to her thanks to the good service and kind treatment.  

The loan will help her invest in more clothes.  She dreams with some day having an establishment where she can display all her products and counsel people who would like to start their own business.

loans.use: to invest in catalogue clothing.

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza is a 44-year-old mother who has three children. After her children grew up, the family’s expenses increased so Fayza wanted to add another income source for her family (besides her husband’s salary) to support the family financially.

Using her creativity and her skills, Fayza started a year ago designing plastic flowers and trees as inside plant decorations, as shown in the picture. She basically takes orders and creates them at her house.

Having a pretty good space in her house garden, Fayza wants to add decorating with naturA. flowers to what she does, including making bouquets from naturA. flowers. In order to do that, she has applied for this loan to buy some seeds, plants and the tools she needs for the garden.

loans.use: To buy seeds, plants and the tools she needs for the garden.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is a 48-year old married woman with five children. The oldest child is 25. Minda’s husband works as a farmer.

Minda is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land located in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Minda has been growing rice for 8 years. She also raises pigs and goats.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Minda hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married and a mother of seven adult-aged dependents. She is 43 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Vilma is a farmer. She grows rice and harvests palay to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She earns approximately PHP 36,000 per quarter from this farm. She has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 at GDMPC to purchase rice seedlings to be planted this coming planting season.

Vilma has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Vilma hopes to gain more profit and purchase an additional rice field.

loans.use: To purchase rice seedlings.

loans.name: Take & Pay Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Take and Pay” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each member in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Yussuf is the leader of this group. He is 27 years old and married with 4 children – 3 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Yussuf sells building materials – cement, iron, corrugated zinc, nails, etc. He has been a businessman for 15 years. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, corrugated zinc, nails, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en: Tahreer is a 33-year-old young woman. She is married and has three sons and one daughter. Tahreer manages an animal farm raising cattle and goats. Her husband works on the farm and generates money by selling dairy products. This is the only source of income for the family. Tahreer wants to buy goat grains but she doesn't have enough money to pay in cash. Therefore, she took out a loan of JOD 800. By getting this loan, the animal productivity will increase and Tahreer will generate a better income. Tahreer is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase goat grains

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 42-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan. She is the mother of six children.

Laila started her embroidery business from home years ago, and over time, she could provide it with machines. Now she is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to purchase materials needed for the project.

An aspiration of Laila's is to expand her project and purchase another sewing machine to increase the sales volume and her income, which will help her daughter in continuing her university education.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Balikuddembe Women's Group

texts.en:
45-year-old Grace is a happy camper. She is highly optimistic. For the past decade, Grace has been bringing tenacity, diligence, and determination to her food sales enterprise in the Lugazi food market.
Hard work is an important part of her daily routine.
Grace, a happily-married mother of 7, has struck quite a chord with many of her clients with her friendly attitude and the way she acts expeditiously in attending to them.
Unbeknownst to her, it has kept clients coming and her business afloat.
Grace sells staple foods such as bananas, maize flour, sweet potatoes, yams, Irish potatoes, green vegetables, and rice.
Grace also subsists on some modest income from a cattle sales business. Prior to engaging in the above business, she was leaning more toward farming.
Grace is on the ball and she sees more success on the horizon. Her determination, hard work ethic, and tenacity are distinguishing traits that will continually work in her favor.
She says that her weekly gross sales are to the tune of Uganda shillings 50,000.
Grace says she intends to utilize this Kiva loan to purchase more bananas, rice, and sweet potatoes to resell, and will use the rest to pay fees for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, rice, and sweet potatoes to resell, and to pay fees for her kids.

loans.name: Ana Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela nació en la ciudad de Cusco y tiene 34 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos.   

Actualmente, Graciela vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta  de ajo, ella viaja a la ciudad de Arequipa a comprar sus productos (ajo). Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Graciela requiere el préstamo para comprar más ajos. Su sueño de Graciela es llegar a vender sus productos (Ajo) en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. 

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Graciela was born in the city of Cusco and is 34 years old. She is married, and she and her husband have two children.

Currently, Graciela lives and works in her native city of Cusco. She sells garlic, travelling to the city of Arequipa to buy her products (garlic). She has been involved in this business for five years already, and it is going very well for her. At this point, Graciela needs the loan to buy more garlic. Her dream is to eventually sell her products (garlic) in the city of Puerto Maldonado.

The "Comuzone I" communal bank meets every month in Cusco (Peru). Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial area and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, as well as for having one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy more garlic

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина жительница района Дангары. Ей 24 года. Она не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. У нее имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности она портниха. В этой области она работает три года. Кредит берет для покупки цветных ниток, пуговиц, бисера и однотонных материалов.
texts.en: Parvina lives in the Dangara district.  She is 24 years old and single.  She lives together with her parents.  Parvina has a secondary specialized education.  She is a seamstress.  She has been working in this field for three years.  Parvina is requesting this loan for the purchase of color threads, buttons, beads and solid-color fabrics.

loans.use: to buy color threads, buttons, beads and solid-color fabrics

loans.name: Patience Stella

texts.en: Patience is a 28-year-old divorced woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 to 8 years. She describes herself as visionary. She operates a cereal sales business where she sells maize, beans, peas, peanuts, millet, and sorghum. She has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase maize. Her business goal is to grow into wholesale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a van to facilitate running her business.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase or order more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra money from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme célibataire sans enfants.Elle tient un restaurant au bord de la route nationale qui traverse sa localité.Elle vend le petit déjeuner , le déjeuner et le dinner.Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins et de participer aux dépenses d'entretien de sa famille. Elle sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter 2 sacs de mil, 3 sacs de haricot, du riz et de l'huile. Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison et de la mettre en location.
texts.en: This borrower is an unmarried woman with no children. She owns a restaurant on the side of the national highway that runs through her area. She sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Her income allows her to take care of herself and help in providing for her family. She is seeking a loan of 150,000 F to buy two bags of millet, three bags of beans, rice, and oil. Her ambition is to build her own house and rent it out.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of millet, 3 bags of beans, rice, and oil.

loans.name: Davaanyam

texts.en:
Davaanyam is 25 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her husband is a clerk in the local market. 

She started her garment retailing business by renting a counter in a local market. Her products are very stylish and handpicked, and  therefore she has many regular customers. 

Now that her products are selling well, she needs to expand her supply in order to run her business successfully. She is a young and hardworking woman who says, "I have a baby coming, Every time I think about it, it makes me work even harder."

She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Khi

texts.en:
Khi is a 47 year old married woman. She has 3 children, one son and two daughters. She and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Khi earns a living running a general store which she has done for 10 years. Khi would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and candy, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enabL. her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income which will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enabL. her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and candy, to stock her general store

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Doña Marlene de 51 años de edad, casada, madre de 5 hijos, todos ellos independientes, ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de comida y nacatamales lleva 18 años dedicándose a este negocio. Inicio con sus actividades con dinero propio y apoyo de su esposo, compro materia prima para empezar con sus nacatamales tenia 33 años edad cuando comenzó. Anteriormente tenía una pulpería pero decidió quitarla para dedicarse a la venta de este delicioso plato típico.  
Ella requiere para compra de maíz, leña, carne,verduras, arroz. Ya que son los principales ingredientes que utiliza para realizar sus tan apetecidos  nacatamales. Uno de sus proyectos próximos es terminar de construir su casa que esta algo deteriorada e invertir en mejoras a su negocio.
texts.en:
Marlene is 51 years old, she is married and she has 5 children, all economically independent. She is a retailer and she engages in selling meals and “nactamales” (typical dish made of maize, meat and rice wrapped in banana leaf), something she has been doing for 18 years. She started her activity with her own money and with some help form her husband. She began by buying ingredients for her nactamales, and she was 33 when she started. She had been previously running a corner shop but she decided to close it to engage in selling this typical delicious dish.
She is requesting a loan to buy maize, firewood, meat, vegetables and rice, as these are the main ingredients she uses to prepare her really tasty nactamales. One of her future projects is to finish building her house as it is a bit dilapidated and to invest in improving her activity.

loans.use: To buy maize, firewood, meat, rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan wants a loan to buy new clothes to sell. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married, aged 42, and has the responsibility of taking care of her three children.

She hopes to educate her children and build a permanent home. Her business goal is to expand into new markets.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fredy Humberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Fredy, es conviviente y tiene 38 años de edad, el tiene 2 hijos; el socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos como detergentes,jabones entre otros productos,el distribuye a las diferentes tiendas que venden estos productos,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos . El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como jabones,detergentes y desinfectantes al por mayor.
El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Mr. Fredy, 38, has a common-law wife and two children.  He sells consumer products such as detergents, soaps and other items which he distributes to the specialist stores.  He works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and is able to provide for his children through his work.  He wants to expand business to sell more products.  He is requesting a loan to buy wholesale items such as soap, detergents and disinfectants.

He is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale soap, detergent and disinfectants.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a businessman who runs a computer college to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years. He is also married and has one child aged 3 years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income. He hopes to open a secondary school in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy computers.

loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Mahuclo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUCLO est un groupe composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Nanan Awaou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 35 ans. Nanan Awaou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Nanan Awaou est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Honoré. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Nanan Awaou et son mari. Pour cette raison,Nanan Awaou vend du riz accompagné de diverses sauces dans sa région depuis environ deux ans ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Nanan Awaou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Nanan Awaou sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHUCLO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du riz, de l'huile végétale et de la tomate.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by ten members of the ND.ène association, represented by Mamadou ND.. Nder is a tiny farming village on the southern edge of the Sahara desert, whose colorful history as the capital of the ancient Wolof kingdom of Walo is still celebrated in Senegalese folklore. In this arid region, profitable cultivation of Nder’s main crops of yams and peanuts relies on irrigation, but capital for investment in irrigation pumps has always been scarce. The ND.ène association therefore submitted the following application for a microfinance loan:

“The state having established a general support framework for community development associations since the 1960’s, our group quickly realized that grassroots community development will not be a reality unless our members are effectively mobilized and organized for this purpose. Taking into account the extremely difficult socioeconomic context characterized by: 1) migration out of rural areas due to the lack of promising local development alternatives, and 2) The absence in the Diéri zone of any hydro-agricultural system established by the state or managed by the local government, the group rolled up our sleeves and decided to rely on our own efforts and on those of our strategic partners in order to achieve our goals.

The purpose of this loan is to provide the members of the group with a motorized irrigation pump with a capacity of 300m3/hour, which can irrigate 10 hectares of fields and will be managed by a pump attendant who will ensure its maintenance and proper functioning. The team responsible for this project will keep track of its progress and will begin to repay the loan without difficulty as soon as the first harvests begin.”

Original French :
