« L’état ayant défini le cadre général d’intervention des associations de développement depuis les années 1960, à cet effet le groupement a vite compris que le développement à la base ne sera une réalité que si les membres ne seront fortement mobilisés en s’organisant en conséquence. Compte tenu du contexte socio économique très difficile marqué essentiellement par :

• L’exode rural faute d’alternative de développement endogène prometteuse.

• Absence d’aménagement hydro agricole conçu par l’état et géré par les sociétés d’encadrement dans la zone du Diéri ;

le groupement s’est retroussé les manches, pour compter sur ses efforts propres et sur ceux de ses partenaires stratégiques pour atteindre l’objectif qu’il s’est assigné.

Objectif du Prêt :

Il s’agit de mettre à la disposition des membres du groupement un groupe moto pompe d’une capacité de 300m3/heure pouvant irrigué 10 ha de culture et sera géré par un pompiste qui assurera l’entretien et le fonctionnement.

Pour le Remboursement :

L’équipe de suivi du projet fera des descentes dans tous les projets et dès la fin des premiers récolte commencera à faire le recouvrement des crédits sans difficulté. »

Background :

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Irrigation pump purchase

loans.name: Santi

texts.en: Santi is a 27 year old mother of 3 children. The eldest is a boy and the younger two are girls. They are all in elementary school. She makes doormats using fabric remnants that she stitches together into nice doormats. She buys the material from garment factories nearby for $0.18/kg. She has been in this business since before she joined MBK. She sells her products for $2.50 - $3.80 per score through intermediary traders as she does not have the courage to sell them directly yet. She needs this loan so that she can buy more materials for making her products.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make her doormats

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is 63 years old and has two children. For three years she has been working in a grocery store and she has now expanded her selection to include goods for the home. She travels once a week to San Cristobal (a two-hour trip) to acquire foodstuffs, and every fifteen days to Tuxtla Gutierrez (three hours by highway) to buy household goods in the city’s supermarkets. Her regular customers come from the indigenous communities near her area. She would like to use the loan to invest in supplies for her grocery store. She belongs to the Santa Lucia 4 group.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA VICTORIA TIENE 63 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS, LLEVA TRES AÑOS TRABAJANDO EN UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y ACTUALMENTE LA A AMPLIADO CON ARTICULOS PARA EL HOGAR. PARA COMPRAR MERCANCIA COMESTIBLE VIAJA A SAN CRISTOBAL (A DOS HORAS) UNA VEZ A LA SEMANA Y CADA 15 DIAS A TUXTLA GUTIERREZ (A TRES HORAS POR CARRETERA) A COMPRAR EN LOS SUPERMERCADOS DE ESA CIUDAD ARTICULOS PARA EL HOGAR. SUS CLIENTES HABITUALES SON GENTE DE COMUNIDADES INDIGENAS CERCANAS A SU ZONA. LO DEL PRESTAMO QUIERE INVERTIRLO PARA ABASTECER SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES. PERTENECE AL GRUPO DE SANTA LUCIA 4.

loans.use: Merchant

loans.name: Elsa Eva

texts.es:
Elsa is currently separated from her husband and she has 2 children. One is 19 years old and the younger one is 16. She began her business because she wanted to give her children a better education and to improve their quality of life. Additionally, because she can’t count on her husband’s income, it was necessary for her to do something to get by. She began by selling a little bit of everything 6 years ago. During the past year she decided to work full time at selling cosmetics, and her sales improve day after day.

Elsa is requesting a loan of $475.00 to buy more merchandise so that she can offer her products more quickly to her customers. She offers to pay the loan in 6 months. She and her family thank you very much for the support you give, allowing her to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Elsa esta actualmente separada de su esposo y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 19 y otro menor de 16 años de edad, ella empezó con su negocio por que quería brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación y mejorar su calidad de vida, además de que al no contar con los ingresos de su esposo era necesario para ella hacer algo para salir adelante. Ella empezó vendiendo de todo un poco desde hace 6 años atrás, siendo el último año en el que se decidió dedicarse de lleno a la venta de cosméticos y sus ventas mejoran día a día.

Elsa está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para comprar más mercadería y así poder ofrecer sus productos de manera más rápida a sus clientes y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics merchandise

loans.name: Maria Eneida

texts.es:
Maria, 51, is a widow. She has three children who no longer live with her. Maria is an enthusiastic and hard-working woman. She started her own business selling natural weight-control products three years ago, both to clear expenses after the death or her husband and to supplement her small pension. Fortunately, demand for the products is very good and her customers have seen good results from their use.

Maria is now asking for a US$275 loan to buy merchandise. She promises to repay it in 4 months. She hopes to continue growing her business and get ahead. You play an important part in Maria's life. She is very grateful for the opportunity you're giving her to improve her life and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene 51 años de edad, es viuda y tiene tres hijos, que viven aparte. Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, desde hace tres años que falleció su esposo, para poder solventar sus gastos, Maria inició su propio negocio con al venta de productos naturales para control de peso, porque que la pensión que recibe es muy baja. Afortunadamente la demanda por estos productos es muy buena ya que ha tenido buenos resultados en sus clientes.

Ahora Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares para la compra de mercancía, que se compromete a regresar en 4 meses, con esto espera continuar creciendo con su negocio y salir adelante. Se parte importante en la vida de Maria, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para mejorar su vida y su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla A. is 48 year old mother of five children. She lives with her husband in Bware Migori Kenya. She is well known in her the community as japur (local language meaning  farmer). She has a big chunk of land where she grows sugarcane. She also rears local cattle breeds that produce between 8 to 10 litres of milk a day which she sells to the community at US $ 0.45 a litre. She plans to buy a dairy cattle breed that can produce not less 15 litres a day with US $ 800 she has applied for.

loans.use: Buy hybrid dairy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicken feeders, drinkers, heaters, chicken feed, and medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more mangoes to sell

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas S., 39, is married with six children and lives with her husband in a part of PreyVeng province, Cambodia. She opened her business in 2004 selling provisions of food and other grocery items. She typically earns around three dollars each day. Her husband is a village chief earning three dollars a day and helps his wife when he is available. One of her married sons works as a driver and the rest of the children are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Meas S. will use this loan to purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory and to repair her son’s car.

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory and to repair her son’s car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more nutrition products to quickly sell / Invertir en mas productos para vender mas rapidamente

loans.name: Sai

texts.en: Mrs. Sai M. is 35 years old and earns about $4 a day raising pigs and growing rice on her farm. Her husband, Mr. Lao Siem, makes a living raising fish, and makes around $3 a day. They have three children who help their mother farm. They have applied for a loan to buy a grinding mill that they can use and also rent out to their neighbors. Mrs. Sai plans to use the additional revenue generated by the mill to support the family and buy fertilizers to use on her farm. (Picture: husband and wife)

loans.use: To buy a grinding mill and fertilizer.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel is a young mother who strives to provide the best she can for her family. She has been farmer since childhood and comes from a family that has had great success in agriculture. This is the livelihood that has allowed her to live independently. She has dedicated herself for the past 5 years to the cultivating of maiz, potato and wheat. At the end of the harvest, she sells her goods direct to consumers in the marketplace of her city. The loan she is requesting will be used for the purchase seeds, fertilizer and to rent a tractor to prepare her farmland for the next growing season.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Raquel, es una joven madre de familia, que se esfuerza por lograr obtener los mejores ingresos para su familia, ella es agricultora desde muy niña, ya que su familia es cuna de famosos agricultores y esta es la fuente de ingreso que le permite vivir de manera independiente. Ella lleva 5 años dedicándose al cultivo de maíz, papa y trigo. Al término de la cosecha los oferta directamente en el mercado de su ciudad.Su solicitud atiende al deseo de adquirir mayor cantidad de semillas, abonos y para alquiler un tractor a fin de preparar sus tierras para la próxima siembra.

loans.use:
Purchase seeds, fertilizer and to rent a tractor.

Compra de semillas abonos y alquiler de un tractor.

loans.name: Fofana Mariama

texts.fr:
Mrs. S. Fofana Mariama was born the 22 of April, 1953 in Sokodé, 470 km (292 miles) from Lomé. She is married and mother of 5 children. She has a business reselling plastic garbage cans, loincloths and toothpaste in the neighbourhood of Agoè. Generally she is in the habit of distributing her merchandise to her loyal clients and collects payment every 8 days. This is her second loan and she is asking for $600 (250000 FCFA) to buy 30 pieces of cloth for loincloths and 4 large plastic garbage cans. These purchases will allow her to replenish her stock.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Fofana Mariama est née le 22 avril 1953 à Sokodé à 470 kilomètres de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de seau en plastique, de pagne en bazin et des pâtes dentifrices dans le quartier d’Agoè. Généralement elle a l’habitude de distribuer ses marchandises à ses clients fidèles et procède à la collecte des fonds chaque 8 jours. Elle est à son deuxième cycle de crédit et sollicite 250000 FCFA pour acheter 30 pièces de pagne bazin et 4 grands seaux en plastique. Ces achats lui serviront pour la reconstitution du stock épuisé.

loans.use: purchase of 30 pieces of cloth for loinclothes and plastic garbage cans

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly Y. lives in Deok Peang Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a garment factory worker. Her husband, Mr. Thol Lan, is a construction worker and subsistence farmer. He faces an obstacle because he does not have enough cattle to plow his field. Therefore, Mrs. Ly Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow to add to the old one to use as draft animals. Mrs. Ly Y. is 30 and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the last one is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Ly Y. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizers to support her husband’s field. Mrs. Ly Y. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase an additional cow to add to the old one to use as draft animals.
